loans.name: El Bello Amanecer Group

texts.es:
Yessi trabaja junto con su esposo en la cerrajería que ambos tienen “CERRAJERIA ELMER” así se llama su negocio que esta ubicado en un mercado D. la zona donD. viven, su esposo empezó haciendo llaves  no tenia un lugar especifico y durante mucho tiempo trabajo como ambulante,  poco a poco y con el esfuerzo D. ambos han logrado comprar un puesto en el mercado D. la zona D. esa manera se han formalizado ahora han ampliado su negocio no solo hacen llaves sino todo tipo D. soldadura además D. vender repuestos para cocinas etc. Con sus ganancias han podido mejorar su casa y están ahorrando por que quieren comprar otro puesto para dedicarse al negocio D. comidas  algo que siempre ha querido hacer.
Por otro lado la Sra. Yessi usara el dinero D. su préstamo para comprar llaves y venderlas, ella pertenece al grupo “EL BELLO AMANECER” formado por 10 socias todas viven en Ventanilla Callao, ella  esta feliz por que en EDAPROSPO ha encontrado el apoyo necesario para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Yessi and her husband work together at a locksmith shop called “Cerrajeria Elmer” which they own. The business is located at a market in the area where they live. Her husband began making keys but did not have a specific place to perform his work, so for a long time he worked as a traveling service provider. Gradually over time, they were able to acquire a local market post in order formalize their business. In addition to making keys, they have expanded their business to incluD. all types of welding services and the sale of kitchen parts. With their earnings, they have been able to make home improvements and save toward the purchase of another market post where Yessi plans to open a food business. This is something she has always wanted to do.

Yessi will use the money from her loan to buy keys to sell. She is part of the group “El Bello Amanecer” (The Beautiful Dawn), which consists of ten members who live in Ventanilla Callao. Yessi is happy to have the support of EDAPROSPO that is needed to achieve her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase keys for her locksmith business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita B. is from the village of Siare, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old, married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Amelita owns a general store.  The other source of income for the family comes from her husband who works as a carpenter. Amelita has been engaged in her business for 28 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Amelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Amelita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Amelita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to continue to improve her business.

About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Lelia

texts.en:
Lelia D. is from the village of Luyong Bonbon, Opol Misamis Oriental. She is 44 years old. Lelia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Lelia owns & operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lelia has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lelia is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lelia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis Miguel tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí, un distrito agrícola y de creciente desarrollo comercial situado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a brindar servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva adjunta una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros), el brinda sus servicio en el distrito donde vive y también en sus caseríos y anexos. Adicionalmete trabaja como jornalero en una empresa agrícola de la zona. El divide su tiempo entre estas dos ocupaciones, los ingresos que percibe de ellas los utiliza en solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia en los gastos diarios.

El continuo uso otorgado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta empiece a sufrir algunas fallas mecánicas que requieren de urgente reparación para su correcto funcionamiento, para reparar su vehículo el ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Luis Miguel es un joven responsable y trabajador, su mayor anhelo es seguir trabajando para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Luis Miguel is 21 years old, single, and lives with his parents in the agricultural district of Cayalti, which is experiencing business growth. It is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. For a year, he has offered transportation on a “motor-taxi,” which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin to transport cargo and passengers. He offers his services in the district where he lives, and also in the housing projects and adjacent areas. He also works as a day laborer in an agricultural company in the area. He divides his time between these two jobs, and uses the income earned to cover personal expenses and help his family with daily expenses. Constant use of his vehicle has caused it to suffer mechanical failures, which require repairs for proper operation. To repair his vehicle, he has requested a loan of 1,000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Luis Miguel is a reliable, hard-working young man. His greatest desire is to continue working to help his family and get ahead. He has worked with our institution previously, and has shown himself to be punctual and responsible when making his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expenses of repairing and maintaining a motor-taxi

loans.name: Tryphonia

texts.en:
It is now fifteen years since M. Tryphonia started up her banana-selling business in Kyeikuchu, Ibanda, in western Uganda. With this as her only source of livelihood, she has painstakingly managed to make ends meet, albeit with some long-drawn-out seasonal income fluctuations and poor road systems used to access bigger markets.

With a hardwork ethic, the 40-year-old married and happy-go-lucky mother of four children has kept her business on a consolidated growth path. In a month, she makes close to 120,000 Ugandan shillings in profits. Her business, in gaining ground over these years, has in effect also meant that her family has benefited, especially in its requirements.

Tryphonia’s business plan for the future is to be able to sell more bananas to an increasingly expanding market. With this loan, she envisages purchasing manure and fertilizers for her banana plantation in order to improve her crop.

loans.use: To buy agricultural inputs like manure and mulches for her plantation

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna P. is from Gango Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old. Lorna is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks like bread, cookies and "puto" rice cake. Lorna has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lorna from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Soem Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Mao S., 58, is the village bank president for eleven villagers I. Trapeang Reang village, Takeo province. The villagers will use their portion of the loan I. various ways to improve their businesses. Mrs. Mao S. is a weaver at her home, and she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Van Megn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where he cultivates rice to sell to support his family. Her problem is that her husband’s field is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mrs. Mao S. is seeking a loan to dig a well, and she will use the rest of the loan to purchase fertilizer. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is a seamstress I. garment factory, while the youngest one is studying I. school.

loans.use: To dig a well

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene A., from the village of San Miguel, Gingoog City, is 39 years old, widowed, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Arlene owns and operates a business venture making and selling snacks and other delicacies such as steamed rice cakes in the local community. Engaged in her business for over two years, she earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Arlene joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale, she is now requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Arlene's second loan from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her enterprise.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: San Miguel, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria A. is from the village of Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is 47 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Candelaria owns and operates a business venture in piggery. Candelaria has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Candelaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Candelaria is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional piglets and pig feed. This will be her second loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa A. is a fish monger and also sells cloth at Elmina. Adjoa has received junior high education. She is married to a driver and has three children. With the support her husband she is able to properly take care of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra fish to smoke for distribution to her customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to further her children’s education.

loans.use: buy extra fish to smoke

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
El cliente Tomas S. Rocha. Vive en la Comarca Wiquili del municipio Achuapa departamento león, tiene dos hijo a su cargo se dedica principal mente a la actividad ganadería. y realiza labores en actividad agrícola. 
El cliente cuanta con una propiedad de 23 MZ propia de terreno, donde la desarrolla para la explotación ganadería donde la alimentación de verano la realiza a través de pasto picado. 
El destino del crédito fue para la compra de Dos vacas paridas destinado para la producción de leche ya que esta actividad es de gran importancia.  
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su finca y mejorar la producción de sus ingresos, para el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas S. R.lives in Wiquili, Achuapa municipality, León department.  He has two children in his care and he is, for the most part, a cattleman and farmer.

He has a 23 manzana (unit of area=1.68 acres) piece of property where he raises cattle and grass forage for them.

The loan will be used to buy two recently delivered dairy cows for milk production because this activity is of great importance.

This will permit better conditions in his farm and improve income production for his family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy two recently delivered dairy cows.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Ms. Jovelyn N. is from the barangay of Polao, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old, single and has no dependants. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating a sari-sari store. She is also receiving monthly support from her sister working abroad. Jovelyn has been engaged in this kind of business for two years. She earns an average amount of not less than 1,500 PHP from this business.
Just this year, Jovelyn joined Kiva partner, PMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. As a newly recognized member of PMPC, Jovelyn is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP under the Regular Loan Program as her first loan. This will be used to add to her capital for her existing sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, making loan repayments and possible business expansions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Lesbia Rosa

texts.es:
Lesbia es una mujer trabajadora, de edad avanzada, muy dedicada a su familia. Hoy en día trabaja como responsable de un colegio infantil y costurera que ha hecho su profesión por años.
Es madre soltera, y ha venido mejorando su casa poco a poco y con ayuda de los financiamientos de la institución, en donde logro hacer la división de cuarto ya que le era de mucha necesidad.
Con este financiamiento lograra la mejora para una higiene mejor. La compra de un inodoro, para instalarlo entre otros materiales como: arena, cemento, pega y otros.
texts.en: Lesbia is a hard-working, elderly woman who is devoted to her family.  She currently works in an elementary school as well as working as a seamstress which has been her profession for years.  She is a single mother and has been improving her house little by little with the help of loans from our organization.  For example, she really needed to put up partitions in one of her rooms and managed to do this.  With this loan she will improve her house's hygiene.  She will buy a toilet to install and also other materials such as sand, cement, adhesive, etc.

loans.use: To buy a toilet in order to achieve better hygiene and other materials needed to carry out the work

loans.name: 03.01.38 Cho Dien Bien Group

texts.en: Nga L. T. T. (186) is a 35 year old femaL. living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Nga is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 38-Cho Dien Bien (03.01.38). Nga is widowed and has 1 school-aged child. To making a living, Nga owns and operates a butcher shop, butchering and selling pork in the local community. Nga has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from these activities. In 2010, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nga is requesting her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Nga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About the Other Borrowers in the Group: 1. N. T. Thuong (184) is a 27 year old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business operating a butcher shop. 2. N. T. Hien (185) is a 24 year old femaL. who is requesting a 3,079,800 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store. About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: The mission of Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. ***************************************************** Nga L. T. T. (186) là 35 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa. Nga là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên. Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 38-Cho Dien Bien (03.01.38). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ giết mổ & bán thịt heo trong cộng đồng địa phương. Nga thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 4 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, Nga kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND. Vào 2010, Nga đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. Nga đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. N. T. Thuong (184) là 27 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt. 2. N. T. Hien (185) là 24 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 3.079.800 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng. Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women: Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa. *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rizza

texts.en:
Rizza P. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 28 years old. Rizza is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rizza owns and operates a general store. Rizza sells shampoo, soft drinks and other things. She wishes for her family to have better living conditions.

Rizza joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rizza is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn T. is engaged in farming particularly in producing assorted crops to sell as her main source of income.  She has been in this activity for more than 12 years and earns a monthly net income of 2,300 PHP.  Merilyn is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao.  She is 41 years old, married with one school-aged child.

In 2005, Merilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Merilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.  Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the farm.  This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Merilyn from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for farming.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch S., 30, is employed at a factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day. S. is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. Her husband buys cows to resell, earning an income of USD 4 per day. 

The family has to spend USD 45 on food, USD 5 on electricity supply, and USD 40 on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase rice to resell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph because S. was not available.

loans.use: To buy rice to resell

loans.name: Julio Daniel

texts.es:
Julio Daniel C. M. tiene 28 años, vive en Unión Libre con su esposa en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos de diferentes edades. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. TIERRA NUESTRA se encuentra ubicada en el recinto San Luís de Zapotal pertenece al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla de 14 miembros se dedica a las labores agrícolas en ciclo corto de siembra de maíz, arroz.

Julio Daniel se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, soya y arroz. Compra sus productos en  Ecua - Agro y vende en el mismo lugar.

Solicita el crédito para sembrar maíz, y arroz, compra de insumos y semillas. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es que sus hijos estudien y esten bien

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Julio Daniel C. M. is 28 years old.  He lives with his common-law wife in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He has three children.

The 'Tierra Nuestra' (Our Land) community bank is located in San Luís de Zapotal district, in Ventanas canton.  The bank has 14 members who work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.

Julio Daniel grows corn, cacao, soya and rice.  He buys his products in Ecua - Agro and sells in the same place.  He is requesting this loan to grown corn and rice, to buy supplies and seeds.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is for his children to study and for them to be all right.

Julio Daniel likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy supplies and seeds

loans.name: Sebekai Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sebekai, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 47 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Barouéli, préfecture de Barouéli; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce d’habillements, de pâtes  d’arachide, de tubercules, de galettes, et de savons.
Les femmes du groupe Sebekai sont à leur douzième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des tissus, d’arachide, de tubercule, de savon et de céréales                                                                         
BINTOU S.  s’approvisionne en tissus avec les grossistes au marché de Bamako mensuellement. Elle vend ses habillements à domicile, au marché de Barouéli et  dans les foires environnantes, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 60 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, les frais de contributions des différentes cérémonies civiles, certaine dépenses familiales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce d’habillements.
texts.en:
The women of the group named Sebekai are married and they are 47 years age on average. They have 3 children each and they live in large traditional extended families in the city of Baroueli. It is located in the prefecture of Baroueli in the region of Segou (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They are known through family, as neighbors, and through friendships.  They are involved in the sale of clothing, peanut butter, tubers, cookies, and soaps. 

The women of the Sebekai group are on their twelfth group loan and it will be used to purchase fabrics, peanuts, tubers, soaps and cereal grains. 

Bintou S. purchases her fabrics from the wholesalers in the market in Bamako on a monthly basis. She sells clothing from her house and at the market in Baroueli and at the fairs in the surrounding regions. She completes her sales in cash and credit, selling to a clientele made up of women and men. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 60 000 FCFA which will be used to the payments of this loan, to contribute to various civil ceremonies, to cover certain family expenses and to reinvest back into her clothing business.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics.

loans.name: Enhtuvshin

texts.en:
Enhtuvshin, 47, is married and lives with her husband and son in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her two older daughters attend college and her younger son attends a local primary school. They live in a ger, a Mongolian nomadic housing tent, and are building a winter home on their property.

Enhtuvshin began working for a restaurant as a cook in 1991. Her husband drives a truck, which they use for their transportation and trading business. Her husband transports shipments for a company and also brings coal that he sells at the local market in the winter time. Enhtuvshin is a hardworking and active person who says, " My husband and I work hard because we want our children to get a good education. After our daughters graduate from the University we will finish building our winter house". Enhtuvshin is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to buy spare parts for their truck and cover the maintenance fees.

loans.use: To buy spare parts.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
Sao S. is a 50-year-old widow and local villager living in Phnom Penh City. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow vegetable crops for both dry and rainy seasons and she always gets good results because she has had experience in this sector since 2000. Sao S. typically generates an income of around $3 US to support the family.

Sao S. has two children; one is married and the other is single and works as a seamstress. Sao S.’s daughter doesn’t have her own vehicle to ride to her job location; instead, she hires a motor taxi. To reduce the cost of traveling expenses, Sao S. is applying for a loan for her daughter to purchase a secondhand motorcycle. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to invest in planting vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a secondhand motorcycle for her daughter to ride to work

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Kadiatu D..  She is married and has 2 children ages 12 and 18 years. She also has 1 additional dependent, whom she adopted.  In the year 2001, Kadiatu took over a business selling food and drinks from her mother. She has been able to manage the business and has a very good loan repayment history. She opens her business 6 days a week and 6 hours a day.

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL in order to buy bags of rice, gallons of vegetable oil and other food items. In the future, Kadiatu D. hopes to have a more spacious place for her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Mujeres De Esperanza 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Yeimi is one of the members of the “Mujeres de Esperanza 1 y 2” (Women of Hope 1 and 2) group which has 10 micro businesswomen who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, etc. Her family is composed of herself, her husband and two children. She tells us that her most difficult challenge is collecting from customers that owe her.

Yeimi is very excited to get her second loan from Esperanza Internacional having successfully repaid her previous loan and taken a step towards her business’ growth. She has had her business for about 10 years; she started it by using her savings to buy clothing to sell.

Yeimi is planning to use her new loan to buy jeans, blouses, underwear, and shirts. She will use her profits to reinvest in her business and continuing savings. Her dream is to have her own store and a family.

This Esperanza associate started with us because she is interesting to progress with her business and she will do it thought the loans. Her history is being used to exemplify the other group members as well as clients of Esperanza, both the Haitians (who for the most part have emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti, some of them quite recently) as well as the Dominicans who generally live in very poor communities like this zone, and many others like it in the Dominican Republic which have few resources; they lack drinking water and reliable electricity.

This group is located in an area of few resources called Puerto Plata, a city whose economy depends primarily on real estate and tourism, although the latter has recently been overshadowed by new, emerging tourist areas.

loans.use: to buy jean, blouses, underwear, and shirts

loans.name: Zachary

texts.en:
Zachary, aged 31, has been in farming for five years in his native town of Kisii in South Rift, Kenya. He is married with no children. His farm produce of sugarcane and maize go to the local Magena market.

Zachary has requested a loan of 45,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the loan will enable him to own a cow which will turn into a personal asset upon repayment of the loan. He is glad it will also provide milk for the family. He says he is focusing on purchasing more acreage of land and owning more dairy cows to be a full-time farmer.

Zachary says he is yet to discover the challenges in dairy farming but remains optimistic he will succeed in it. He appreciates Juhudi Kilimo financial services.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes es una persona muy trabajadora y una persona que tiene mucha creatividad e imaginación, ella se dedica hacer figuras en madera, dice que le enseñaron unas personas por parte del gobierno del estado y les dieron unos cursos con los cuales ella esta saliendo adelante y esta sacando a su hijo Noel adelante ya que es madre soltera, dice que cuando es temporada de la mariposa monarca sube a los santuarios a ofrecerlos y ya tiene varios clientes que le compran la artesanía para ellos revenderlos. Ella esta agradecida con la Fundación por que gracias a los prestamos ella esta saliendo adelante y puede comprar lo necesario para su negocio, ella comprara pegamento, lijas, madera y también quiere invertir en un poco en el negocio de venta de colchas por catalogo. Doña Lourdes tiene con su negocio aproximadamente 1 año y ella esta muy contenta con lo que hace ella dice “soy muy feliz haciendo mis artesanías ya que la gente se sorprende al verlas y me las compra que es lo mejor de todo y así puedo mantener a mi pequeño hijo”.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a very hard-working person who has a lot of creativity and imagination.  She makes handicrafts from wood.  She says that some people working on behalf of the state government taught her this trade.  They provided some courses and, as a result, she is managing to get ahead in life together with her son Noel.  She is a single mother.  Lourdes tells us that during the Monarch butterfly season, she goes to the butterfly sanctuaries and offers her products for sale.  She has several customers who buy her handicrafts to re-sell.

Lourdes is grateful to Fundación Realidad because, thanks to their loans, she is getting ahead in life and is able to buy what she needs for her business.  She will use this loan to buy adhesive, sandpaper and wood.  She would also like to invest a little in her business selling bedspreads through a catalog.  Lourdes has been in her business for approximately one year and she is very happy with what she does.  She says "I am very happy making my handicrafts because people are amazed when they see them and they buy them from me which is the very best thing.  In this way, I am able to support my young son".

loans.use: to make handicrafts from wood

loans.name: Elizabeth Waithira

texts.en:
The mother of two children aged 16 and 14 years, Elizabeth is 40 years old and married to David, who contributes to the family income. Elizabeth has been running her grocery shop for about three years, earning approximately 9,000 Kenya shillings a month.

Introduced to KADET LTD by a group member, she is requesting her first loan to buy stock of fruits, green vegetables and cereals. Elizabeth hopes to eventually own a permanent house, have a retail shop, and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to add stocks of fruits, green vegetables and cereals.

loans.name: Lutfiyamo

texts.ru: Лутфиямо проживает в районе Муминобод. Возраст, 36 лет. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Ее муж занимается пчеловодством. Сама она имеет средне – специальное образование, она садовод. По специальности работает 10 лет. А также она занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет не большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений и расширения своей деятельности.
texts.en: Lutfiyamo lives in the Muminobod region. She's thirty-six years old, married and has two children. Her husband works as a beekeeper and Lutfiyamo has had vocational training as a gardener. She's worked in this area for ten years. There's a big plot of land near her house, where she grows vegetables. She's asking for a loan in order to buy some mineral fertilizers and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers and expand her business

loans.name: Lucy Betty

texts.es:
Lucy es una mujer trabajadora de 40 años de edad. Ella vive en casa familiar con sus 5 hijos en una comunidad urbana de comerciantes que se encuentra en vías de desarrollo. La zona donde vive Lucy es el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz perteneciente a la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Lucy tiene 7 años de experiencia en su negocio. Ella vende menestras  en un pequeño puesto ambulante ubicado en las afueras del mercado Moshoqueque (el mercado popular con mayor régimen de ventas en el norte)

Lucy solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para  surtir su negocio con nueva mercadería como ajo, culantro, ajíes y distintas especies que tienen gran demanda en su puesto. 

 Lucy desea invertir en su negocio para aumentar sus ventas y poder darle comodidades a sus 5 hijos.
texts.en:
Lucy is a hard-working 40 year old woman.  She lives with her five children in a urban community of merchants that is in the process of developing.  Lucy lives in the José Leonardo Ortiz district in the city of Chiclayo.

Lucy has seven years of experience with her business.  She sells vegetable stew at a small traveling stall located on the outskirts of the Moshoqueque market (the popular market with a large arrangement of sales in the north).  

Lucy is asking for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles with Edpyme Alternativa to stock her business with new merchandise like garlic, cilantro, peppers, and other items that she has a demand for at her stand.

Lucy wants to invest in her business to increase her sales and give comforts to her five children

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (ingredients).

loans.name: Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group

texts.en:
Ni Kadek is 29 years old and lives in Melaya, West Bali.  She is married and has two children, aged 10 and eight.  Her younger son is in second year in elementary school and her older son is in fourth year in elementary school.   Her husband works as a farmer.  Though Ni Kadek often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income.  She has been raising pigs for five years.  

Ni Kadek is the head of the Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah group, which is made up of 15 neighbors from the same village.  This is the group’s third loan with MUK.  With the 1.5M IDR that Ni Kadek receives, she will purchase two piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as meat.  With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs.  With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
La  señora María Luisa  vive en la ciudad de Managua  es madre de dos niños  es una persona responsable honestas con muchos deseo de superación.

Dona maría visito nuestra oficina para solicitar un crédito para el mejoramiento de su vivienda y gastos escolares.
El material que la señora va a comprar es arena, bloques, cemento, para la construcción.
 Doña María dice que está agradecido con ceprodel por el  préstamo que se otorgo.
texts.en:
María Luisa lives in the city of Managua.  She’s the mother of two children and is a responsible, honest person with a strong desire to get ahead.

María visited our office to request a loan to do some home improvements and to pay school fees.

The supplies she’ll buy are:  sand, concrete blocks and cement for the construction.

María says that she’s grateful to Ceprodel for the loan that was granted her.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay school fees.

loans.name: Chari

texts.ru: Чари проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где выращивает овощи для продажи. В этой области Чари более 20 лет. Он берет кредит для закупа минеральных удобрений, чтобы посеять и получить хороший урожай.
texts.en: Chari lives in the Jilikul Region. He is 35 years. He is married. He has three children. His wife is a homemaker. Chari is a farmer. He leases a land plot and grows vegetables for sale. He has been in this line of work for over 20 years. He is taking out a loan for the purchase of mineral fertilizers  in order to do his planting and eventually obtain a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is married with three children, all of whom are studying in a local school. Nasreen is a housewife who stays at home and carries out her household responsibilities. She is a very helpful and supportive person and always carries out her responsibilities very efficiently. 
Nasreen's husband is involved in making electrical wires and cables to order. He makes business deals with different electrical equipment supply companies to fulfill their orders to earn profits. It is Nasreen’s family business and her eldest son also helps his father after his studies in making the wires. 
Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, to financially support her husband in his business. He will use the loan to buy material such as copper etc. to be able to fulfill his clients' orders on time and make larger profits. 
Nasreen's husband has been operating his business for the past 20 years. Nasreen is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to his business and improve the living conditions of her family as a result. 
Note: In the photo, the lady with the book (an Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: to buy copper etc. for electric wires and cable-making business.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El presente comité es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, se formó gracias a que una de las miembros oyó hablar del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, entonces lo comentó a sus amigas y vecinas y de allí surgió el grupo denominado San Vicente. Actualmente cuenta con 12 integrantes donde todas ellas trabajan de forma responsable y solidaria, dentro de un ambiente de respeto.
La señora Hilda se dedica a la venta de comestibles desde hace ya varios años, se considera una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada, pues su trabajo implica mucho esfuerzo, ya que todos los días se levanta a muy tempranas horas de la mañana para elaborar los alimentos que vende. Gracias a su amabilidad ha logrado formarse una clientela bien definida. Sueña con poder tener un local propio donde vender sus alimentos.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los ingredientes que utiliza para la elaboración de los alimentos que vende como ser carne, verduras, condimentos y demás. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que le da.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of Carapeguá.  It was formed thanks to one of the members hearing about the program for entrepreneurial woman.  She then mentioned it to her friends and neighbors, and from there the group named San Vicente was created.  There are currently 12 members, who all work in a responsible and united manner, and in an atmosphere of respect.

Señora Hilda has been working selling food for the last several years.  She thinks of herself as a striving woman who is willing to make sacrifices.  Her work requires a great deal of effort, as every day she gets up very early to make the food she sells.  Thanks to her friendliness, she has been able to put together a solid customer base.  

She dreams of having her own premises from where she can sell her food.

She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients that she will use in making the foods she sells, such as meat, vegetables, condiments and additional items.  She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it is providing her.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other items.

loans.name: Tele Alofa

texts.en:
Tele is 48 years of age and is married with six children. Tele owns and operates a business venture, providing dress-making services to local community members.  She has many years of experience in this business. Tele needs a loan of WST 1000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tele joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tele's 1st loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Francisco Mario

texts.es:
Francisco, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, el se dedica a la venta de ropa y enseres del hogar, este negocio lo estableció por iniciativa propia desde muy joven, actualmente este  negocio que cuenta con clientes y con mucha experiencia.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de vestir como blusas, camisas, pantalones, ropa interior,  lo que pretende es tener todo lo necesario para incrementar la rentabilidad del negocio.
Su aspiración es tener su propia casa, donde sus hijos puedan crecer y apoyarles para que estudien, también estar pendiente de todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Francisco lives with his wife and two children. He sells clothing and home equipment. He established his business out of his own initiative when he was very young. He now has customers and a lot of experience.
He is requesting a loan for the purchase of clothing such as blouses, shirts, pants and underwear. He hopes to have everything necessary to increase his business' profitability.
His dream is to have his own home where his children can grow up, and to support them so that they can study.  He also hopes to supply all of their needs.

loans.use: to buy clothing such as blouses, shirts, pants and underwear.

loans.name: Las Minas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas está formado por 10 socias quienes son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras y muy amables quienes con su trabajo diario aportan a  la economía de sus hogares. Viven por la parroquia del Valle, este lugar es de clima frió y esta rodeado de montañas, es una de las zonas más fértiles para la agricultura, su gente es amabley mantienen las tradiciones de sus ancestros.

Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la Señora Luzmila, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle, tiene 53 años, es separada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 5 hijos, tres de ellos son casados e independientes, sus hijos solteros tienen 20 y 14 años de edad, su hijo de 20 años trabaja y le ayuda económicamente y su ultima hija estudia en una academia de corte y confección. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Luzmila como pasa en el campo se dedica a la cría y venta cuyes, pollos y cerdos y solo cuando le llaman trabaja labrando la tierra.

Nuestra socia se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. 

Su meta es crecer en el negocio de cría y venta de animales.

Las fotos pequeñas adjuntas son de dos socias que por motivos personales no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Minas” (The Mines) consists of 10 members who are hardworking, determined, and friendly women who work every day to support the finances of their households. They live in the parish of El Valle, a cold place that is surrounded by mountains. It has one of the most fertile areas for farming. The people are friendly and have maintained the traditions of their ancestors.

One of the members of this group is Sra. Luzmila. She lives in the outlying areas surrounding the parish of El Valle. Luzmila is 53 years old, separated from her spouse, and has five children. Three of them are married and independent while the others (ages 20 and 14) are single. Her 20-year-old son works and helps financially while her youngest daughter is a student at a sewing and dressmaking academy. Luzmila does not own a home, so she lives in a rental property.

Doña Luzmila spends her time in the field raising and selling guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. She works alone on her land whenever she feels the need.

Luzmila is seeking her second loan with the Communal Bank and will invest the money in the purchase of chickens and the appropriate feed. Her goal is to grow her business of raising and selling animals.

The smaller photos are of two of the members who could not be present at the time the group photo was taken because of personal reasons.

loans.use: to buy chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 34-year-old married woman from Madab, Jordan and a mother of four children. She has been doing embroidery from home and she is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase raw materials needed for her business.

Mariam is looking to improving her business and increasing her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Elima

texts.en: Elima is married and blessed with one child who is still in school. She operates a retail shop to bring up the family. She has been in the business for the last two years. In the next 5 years, she wants to manage  a supermarket. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to access loans to boost her business. With 50,000 Kenya shillings, she wants to buy cooking fat, sugar and detergent for resale.

loans.use: To buy cooking fat, sugar and detergent.

loans.name: Namuiima

texts.en:
Namuiima is 43 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past fifteen years, Namuiima has been working hard to manage his market stand, which sells fresh produce. 

To help expand his business, Namuiima has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Namuiima to generate greater profits and improve his family's welfare. Namuiima hopes that in the future he will be able to continue growing his business. 

Namuiima is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Namuiima who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Jose Nahun

texts.es:
el sr. José Nahún tiene 25 años de edad, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, Jose es Caficultor y Agricultor, posee  5 años de experiencia en el cultivo de café y la agricultura. 
José obtiene ingresos todo el año, cuenta con una pulpería que genera ganancias para mantener a su familia y cumplir con otros compromisos, Jose utilizara el credito para comprar un sistema solar y así poder iluminar su casa y su pulperia por las noches, gracias a esto podra atender a sus clientes en horas de la noche y cerrar mas tarde su pulperia.
dejara de utilizara candiles para iluminarse, esto sera de gran ayuda para no dañar la salud de sus hijos.
texts.en:
José Nahún, 25, is married and has three children.  José is a coffee grower and farmer.  He has five years of experience growing coffee and in agriculture.

José has income year round.  He has a grocery store that generates profits to support his family and fulfill other commitments.

José will use the loan to buy a solar system and so be able to light his house and his grocery store at night.  Thanks to this he will be able to wait on his customers at night and close his business later.  He will stop using oil lamps for light, which will be a great help in not endangering the health of his children.

loans.use: to buy a solar generator.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es: El Sr. Roberto es una persona joven que trabaja con su minibús de siete pasajeros en el servicio de transporte público del sindicato de transportes de la zona de Pampahasi,  Roberto vive junto a su madre y a su hermano menor, Roberto se encarga de todos los gastos de la casa como ser pagos de luz y el agua. Roberto es muy conocido en la zona y por sus compañeros de trabajo como una persona responsable y correcta ya que él como hermano mayor se preocupa por que su hermano menor termine sus estudios. Uno de sus mayores deseos es lograr que su hermano termine sus estudios de colegio y posteriormente estudie una carrera. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo de dinero para la compra de materiales de construcción en la casa de su madre ya que el techo de uno de sus cuartos a tenido varias goteras y quiere realizar la reparación antes que comience la época de lluvias.
texts.en:
Roberto is a young man working driving a seven-passenger minibus providing public transportation services as part of the Pampahasi transportation syndicate.  Roberto lives with his mother and younger brother.  Roberto takes care of all household expenses like electricity and water.  

Roberto is very well known in the zone and by his fellow workers as a responsible, correct person since he, as the older brother, sees to his younger brother and is concerned that he completes his schooling. One of his greatest wishes is that his younger brother completes high school and later on a career.

On this occasion he’s asking for a loan to buy building materials because the roof on one of his mother’s house’s rooms is leaking and he wants to repair it before the rainy season starts.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Judilin

texts.en:
Judilin is a 32-year-old married woman with four children. She lives in Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, the Philippines. 

To earn her living, Judilin owns and operates a business venture selling a variety of different fruit and vegetables. She has been in this business for three years, and from it she earns PHP 4,000 each month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. Judilin has been a member of GDMPC for four years. In the future, Judilin wants to build herself a house and to ensure her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Wahinda

texts.en:
Wahinda is a married woman with one child who is enrolled in school. Her husband is a driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

Wahinda has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past 7 years. In addition she also sells cosmetics and vitenge or kanga (African traditional cloth). Her potential clients are her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of fluctuating prices of commodities in the market. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future.

With the 60,000 KES, she wants to purchase more sacks of charcoal and cosmetics for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal and cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Willy Gerardo

texts.es:
Willy es un hombre de 29 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad de la zona Sur de Costa Rica, ubicada en Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas. La economía local está basada en actividades agropecuarias, donde destaca la siembra de tubérculos, café, maíz, frijoles y ganadería.

Hace unos meses Willy tiene la necesidad  de remodelar su hogar.  

Willy está solicitando un préstamo de ₡500.000 (quinientos mil colones), para la compra de materiales de construcción como Zinc, cemento, fibrolid y para pagar la mano de obra. Con este cambio de infraestructura su familia estará más protegida  y tendrá una mejor calidad de vida. 

Willy es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal en la Danta, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Willy is 29 and lives with his family in a community in southern Costa Rica located in Concepción de Pilas, Puntarenas.  The local economy is based on farming, with emphasis on the cultivation of root crops, coffee, corn, beans and livestock.

For some time Willy has needed to remodel his home.  He is asking for a loan in the amount of $1025 (500000 CRC) to buy construction materials such as zinc and cement and to pay for manual labor.  With this change in infrastructure his family will be better protected and will have an improved quality of life.

Willy is a member of the Community Credit Company in Danta, one of 150 partner organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica.  This will be his first loan and he hopes to continue growing on a personal and financial level and to also actively participate in the credit organization in his community.

loans.use: to fix up his house.

loans.name: Lourdes Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señorita Lourdes es socia del banco comunal Zhidmad, vive por la comunidad Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que se encuentra rodeado de exuberante vegetación natural, es un lugar donde se respira la paz y tranquilidad ya que se encuentra fuera del ruido de la ciudad, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura, muchos laboran en la ciudad, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señorita. Lourdes tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su madre quien se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, la casa en la que vive es propiedad de su madre.
 
Ella se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, cría cuyes, borregos, ganado y pollos, también labora en la atención de una pequeña tienda la cual ha iniciado hace 2 meses y labora de lunes a sábado sin un horario fijo.
 
Este es su cuarto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir para la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su tienda.
 
Su meta es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of the community bank Zhidmad. She lives by the community Zhidmad en Cuenca, a place that is surrounded by lush natural vegetation. It is a place where one can breathe the peace and tranquility that is located outside the noise of the city. Its people raise animals, agriculture, and many labor in the city for a living. They maintain the culture and traditions of its people.
Lourdes is 21 years old, unmarried, and lives with her mother who is in agriculture and the raising of animals for a living. The house in which she lives is the property of her mother.
For a living she does housework, raises guinea pigs, sheep, cattle and chickens. She also attends to a small store which she had started two months ago. She works from Monday to Saturday with a fixed schedule.
This is her 4th loan she had received from the community bank and she is going to invest it in the purchase of basic necessities for her store.
Her goal is to own her own house.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessities for her store.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
El señor Angel es un hombre de 47 años, casado, actualmente se dedica a la venta de algodón en la ciudad de Pisco, Perú. Esta actividad la aprendió gracias a sus padres que con mucho esfuerzo le dejaron como herencia estas hectáreas de terreno y la producción de este producto, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años y está muy contento por los avances que viene logrando durante el transcurso de estos meses.

Actualmente desea que los prestatarios Kiva lo ayuden y el pueda comprar los fertilizantes, plaguicidas y huano que es necesario para el desarrollo de las tierras en donde trabaja, él sabe que con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación e inversión él podrá generarse una mejor calidad de vida, mejorar sus ingresos económicos y de este modo su esposa se sienta cómoda y contenta junto a él, también desea poder mejorar el aspecto de su casa, debido a que solo está hecha a base de esteras.
texts.en:
Angel is a 47-year-old married man.  Currently he works selling cotton in the city of Pisco, Peru.  He learned this work thanks to his parents who, with great effort, left him the inheritance of these hectares of land and the production of this crop.  He has worked in this job for four years and is very happy for the progress that he has been making in these months.

Currently he wants the Kiva lenders to help him so he can buy the fertilizer, pesticide, and guano that is necessary to develop the lands where he works.  He knows that with a lot of effort, dedication, and investment he will be able to create for himself a better quality of life and improve his income.  In this way his wife will feel comfortable and content with him.  He also wants to be able to improve the appearance of his house, since it is made only of straw mats.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and guano.

loans.name: Anjeline's Group

texts.en:
In Ombe village in Ndhiwa sub County, Kenya, Anjeline has volunteered to be the promoter for a new chlorine dispenser. Anjeline is a friendly member of the community with 12 children. Anjeline lives with her family in a house made of mud walls and an iron roof.

Ombe village does not have a piped water supply, so the community collects their water from Ndiprao stream. This water is easily contaminated with bacteria that can cause water-borne diseases. Chlorine dispensers offer a solution to this problem by allowing people to treat their water to make it safe to drink. Anjeline’s family, and the 55 other households using the local water source, need a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining chlorine dispensers at the water sources in the area. 

Anjeline has volunteered to act as the promoter to encourage the community to use the dispenser and to refill it with chlorine when the tank runs low. Anjeline volunteered to be the promoter because she wants to help the community treat water in order to help prevent sicknesses. There is also another volunteer promoter from the surrounding community who is part of this group loan, named Millicent.

The Kiva loan will be repaid by Evidence Action (www.evidenceaction.org) on behalf of the community through the sale of carbon credits. Using the chlorine dispenser generates carbon credits by avoiding the need to boil water to make it safe to drink. Revenues from the sale of carbon credits to organizations and individuals wanting to reduce carbon footprints will be used to repay Kiva lenders and also to make sure that Anjeline’s community can have access to safe water now and in the future.

loans.use: To provide communities with free access to chlorine to treat their drinking water

loans.name: Petko

texts.en:
Petko V. is a 48 years old ex-military officer. Being a military officer he has graduated a Transport school.

He has three kids of two marriages. Now he lives with his second wife in Blagoevgrad.

After he discharged from the army 6 years ago he rented a premises and started a tyre and automobile spares trade.

Petko Velikov will spend this $ 2 000 loan in buying an equipment for tyre mounting and dismounting.

loans.use: To buy an equipment for tyre mounting and dismounting

loans.name: Houfongbé

texts.en:
Houfongbé A. is 53 years old, married, the mother of four, and is the guardian of a child from her deceased older brother. Her husband is primarily a carpenter. Twelve years ago, to help with family expenses, she entered into commerce in «gari» (granulated cassava flour), a flourishing business. Despite being illiterate, she is a disciplined manager. Her good experience managing loans need not be demonstrated any further. She is requesting a loan of $650 to acquire a field of cassava plants. Cassava roots are made into gari, which is widely consumed in the region. This loan, when released, will really benefit her, since she will have a higher income, something that will make a difference in her family’s standard of living

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Agée de 53 ans, Madame A. Houfongbé est mariée et mère de quatre (4) enfants et à sa charge un (1) enfant de son grand frère décédé. L’activité principale de son mari est la menuiserie. Pour contribuer aux besoins familiaux, Madame A. se lance dans la production et la vente de « gari » farine de manioc. Elle exerce cette activité florissante il y a 12 ans et en fait une gestion rigoureuse malgré qu’elle soit analphabète. Son expérience en matière de gestion de crédit n’est plus à démontrer. Elle sollicite un crédit de $650 afin d’acquérir un champ de maniocs,matières premières du gari très consommé dans la région.. Ce crédit débloqué lui serait très bénéfique puisqu’elle aura à augmenter le revenu qui se répercutera sur le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To acquire a cassava field for making gari

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.en:
Mr. Gilberto is married and has one son who is 17 years old and studies electrical mechanics and he also has one small daughter who is 9 and attends elementary school. Gilberto is a school bus driver, but his salary is not enough to support his family as well as cover the costs of caring for his mother. Out of necessity to find additional income, he began to selling groceries and foodstuffs from his home, and with the help of his wife, has seen his business grow.

Unfortunately, his daughter became very sick and the hospital costs cut into the savings he had, which he was going to use to invest in the business. Now, she is doing better, but Gilberto needs a loan of $200 in order to buy supplies to stock his store and to allow it to continue to grow. He suggests repaying this loan in 5-10 months. You can help improve the life of this family, their well-being rests in your hands, and everyone thanks you greatly for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

El señor Gilberto es casado y tiene un hijo de 17 años que estudia electromecánica y una pequeña hija de 9 años que estudia la primaria. Gilberto trabaja como chofer en un autobús escolar, que pero el salario que obtiene no es suficiente para el sustento de su familia además que tiene que cubrir los gastos de su madre que esta a su cuidado. Por la necesidad de obtener un ingreso extra decidió iniciar la venta de abarrotes en su propio domicilio, y con la ayuda de su esposa este negocio ha estado creciendo.

Lamentablemente su hija enfermó y los gastos de la hospitalización le redujeron el capital que tenia disponible para invertir en su negocio, ahora ella se encuentra mejor, pero Gilberto necesita de un crédito por $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para surtir su negocio y continuar creciendo, él ofrece devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Tú puedes mejorar la vida de esta familia, en tus manos esta su bienestar, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is 31 years old, married and has three children. Mwajuma sells “khanga”, a type of cloth worn by majority of women in Tanzania. Currently, she buys one piece of khanga at USD 2.50 and resells the same at USD 5. She sells on credit and collects her receivables on monthly basis.

Currently she buys 150 pieces of khanga at a time. She want to increase this number to 200 pieces. This number could earn her a reasonable profit margin and improve her business. What holds her back is lack of enough working capital, because she has to wait until her customers pay the money before she purchases another consignment. She is in need of USD 550 to purchase the right amount of stock.

loans.use: To purchase stock of cloths

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel I. has been a dynamic client of LAPO for 8 years. She has proved her wealth of experience in her line of business. She fries and sells "akara" (a kind of beignet; "fast food" equivalent) to a neighboring village.

Mabel is 46 years old, married, and has five children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She needs the requested loan (US$ 400) to buy more bags of beans and groundnut oil so as to expand her business which she started 20 years ago.

loans.use: To buy more bags of beans and groundnut oil

loans.name: Ayao

texts.fr:
Ayao A. was born on January 27, 1977, in Lomé. He is married and the father of two. Trained as an electronics technician, he does well enough, though he works out of his home due to a lack of funds to open a shop. In addition to his two children, he has two other persons as dependents. He has proven himself at his work, and his services are more and more in demand. The lack of tools and supplies keeps him from meeting customer expectations. To satisfy them, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy supplies, which would enable him to meet these expectations quickly. Then his income will increase, and his family's living conditions will improve.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Monsieur A. Ayao, né le 27 janvier 1977 à Lomé, est marié et père de deux (02) enfants. Electronicien de formation, il se débrouille à la maison faute de fonds pour ouvrir un atelier. Il a en plus de ses 2 enfants 2 autres personnes à charge. Il fait preuve d’une maîtrise de son travail et est de plus en plus sollicité. Le manque de matériels le limite pour satisfaire sa clientèle. Pour ce faire, il sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour acheter des matériaux de travail. Cette acquisition lui permettra de satisfaire rapidement sa clientèle. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus et améliorera les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy  supplies

loans.name: Somtochukwu

texts.en: Somtochukwu Okunkwo is 35 old, married with 5, and lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. She sells electrical goods such as outlets, cords and parts. She has been in this business since the year 2001 and needs a loan to buy more electrical materials to sell.

loans.use: To buy more electrical goods and parts to sell

loans.name: Samina's Group

texts.en:
"I am Samina S. from the mid-size city of Faisalabad, Pakistan. I am married and the mother of an only daughter. My husband buys and sells bricks. Now we require a loan to expand our business by taking on bigger orders.

There are two other members in my loan group. Najma N. requires a loan for their grocery shop. Sobia B. needs a loan for her blanket business. These women are my neighbors and we live together like a family."

loans.use: Expand our brick-selling business

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru:
Nurali O. is 34 years old, he has a technical education and is a veterinarian by profession. Nurali is married and has 4 children. He works as a veterinarian at an animal farm in the Vakhsh region. Nurali also fattens and sells livestock. He has been in this business for 2 years. He will use his loan to purchase livestock to fatten and resell. Nurali will sell the livestock after fattening it for 40-45 days.

Nurali will use a portion of his revenues to purchase new livestock and a portion to support his family as he is the sole income earner in the family. Nurali’s main customers are local butchers who use his meat to create meat products and sell them to local residents. Nurali will pay back the loan over a 12 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Одинаев Нурали, возраст – 34 года, образование средне-техническое, по специальности ветеренар, женат, имеет 4-х детей. В настоящее время Нурали работает на животноводческой ферме Вахшского района ветеренаром. Нурали занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности он занимается уже в течение 2 лет. На полученный кредит он планирует приобрести крупный рогатый скот для откорма и продажи. Скот он планирует продавать через 40-45 дней после его откорма. Часть вырученных денег он будет использовать на приобретение нового поголовья скота и корма, другую часть будет использовать на содержание своей семьи, так только он один пока является источником дохода в семье. Основными его покупателями являются местные продавцы мясных продуктов, которые приобретая у него скот производят мясную продукцию и реализуют жителям данного района. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase livestock and feed

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam is gifted in the kitchen, adding her signature flavor to everything she makes; these are the qualities that compelled her to become the chef of her own small restaurant, which she started in her home two years ago. This business idea was born from the fact that her dear husband's salary couldn't cover their children's education or the nutrition of the little ones. Now, with this new income from the restaurant, things have gotten much better at home. She's thankful for the growing clientele and is thinking about expanding the space of her restaurant so that her customers will be more comfortable. With your help, she can make this dream a reality.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

Miriam, es muy hábil en la cocina y su sazón es una de las mejores; estas cualidades la impulsaron a dedicarse a la preparación y venta de comida en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó a manera de restaurante hace dos años, su iniciativa de trabajo se desarrolló debido a que el dinero que percibía su querido esposo era insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de la educación y alimentación de sus pequeños. Ahora con este nuevo ingreso que ha ido obteniendo las cosas en su hogar han mejorado y mucho y está pensando, gracias a la gran acogida de sus clientes, ampliar su espacio de trabajo para ofrecerles mayor comodidad.Tu importante ayuda podrá hacer realidad este anhelo.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils and expand the space of her small restaurant.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan F. is dedicated to providing transportation services by taking children from their homes to school and back. He began the business because his income from his other work was not sufficient, so he saw the transportation service as an option for sustaining his family.

He started the business 10 years ago as a complementary activity that he worked at part time, and today he does it full-time. He provides transportation to various schools and now he has two vehicles.

He is asking for your support because he needs $375 US, that he will repay in 4 months, in order to pay for driving permits and for the maintenance of his vans. With your support, Juan will continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan F. se dedica a dar servicio de transporte a los niños de su casa a la escuela y viceversa lo inicio dado que con el sueldo que percibía de su trabajo no le alcanzaba, entonces vio como una opción el servicio de transporte escolar para poder mantener a su familia. Empezó hace 10 años, como una actividad complementaria que realizaba de medio tiempo y hoy en día lo hace de tiempo completo, dando servicio a varias escuelas actualmente cuenta con dos unidades.

El solicita de sus contribuciones ya que requiere US $375 que esta dispuesto a liquidar en 4 meses para poder pagar los permisos y el mantenimiento de las camionetas. Con tu apoyo Juan seguirá desarrollando su negocio.

loans.use: To maintain his vehicles

loans.name: Gulnaz's Group

texts.en:
Gulnaz A., the group leader, comes from Multan, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. She has lived all her life in this city. Guinaz was married seven years ago and is the mother of four: three daughters and one son. Two of her older children attend school and the others are not of school age yet. Gulnaz’s husband has a mobile phone Sims dealership. His monthly income ranges between $175 and $200.

Currently, Guinaz's family needs a loan to expand their business. Gulnaz has been joined in her loan group by five women: Rukhsana P. requires her share of the loan to expand her scarves business, Hanifa B. will invest her share in her family’s grocery store, Shahbaz S. sells oil, Sonia B. will buy a rickshaw, and Zahida F. sells cloth.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Gie Casa Mas Group

texts.fr:
We are a group of young women with experience in catering. We would like to start a restaurant on the beach in Carabane. Our ecovillage is in a tourist zone and receives a lot of visitors from diverse backgrounds. We would like to offer dishes specific to the region but also seafood that is fished locally. Our goal is to fight rural exodus. Our village is a transit point for Spanish tourists who spend a lot of time in the village.  This could open up enormous possibilities for marketing fresh fish products to be eaten on the spot.
Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

nous sommes un groupe de jeunes femmes avec une expérience en restauration et voulons créer un petit restaurant au bord de la plage de Carabane.
