Notre écovillage est une zone touristique et reçoit aussi beaucoup devisiteurs qui viennent d'horizon diverse. nous voulons proposer des plats spéciques de chez nous et aussi la consommation des fruits de mer qui nsont pêchés localement. Notre objectifr est de lutter contre l'exode rural. notre village etant aussi un point de passage pour les touriste espagnoles qui passent beaucoup de leur temps dans le village,pourra offrir d'énormes possibilités de commercialisation de produits halieutiques frais pour une consommation sur place.

loans.use: Purchase of cooking and restaurant

loans.name: Sophea Soam's Group

texts.en:
The group leader in this small group is Mrs. Sophea S., and this group of borrowers consists of six members in Trok Kandal Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Mrs. Sophea S. currently has a soup-selling business. Since her business has improved, Mrs. Sophea S. is now requesting a loan to purchase more ingredients to cook more delicious soup for her customers. Her husband, Mr. Vichet Chuon, just stays at home and assists his wife with her business. Mrs. Sophea S. is 38 and the mother of five children, three of whom are working in a garment factory while the others are attending a local school.

Mrs. Theang P.'s husband came to take a loan for his wife, so he is presented in the photo instead of his wife.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients to cook more delicious soup for her customers.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema has owned her own livestock business in Arusha for 8 years. She is married with four children, ages 8, 15, 17, and 20. She works daily from 6:00am to 7:00pm and generates a monthly profit of approximately $30.

Rehema has taken out two previous loans through BRAC Tanzania to expand her livestock business. She paid back both successfully and on time. She would like to use this loan to create a new business in Arusha.

loans.use: To open another livestock business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy jewelry and other items.

loans.name: Yovana Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yovana tiene 32 años. Desde hace siete años ella  administra su taller de fabricación de accesorios de grifería. El esposo de Yovana trabaja manejando un mototaxi desde hace tres años. Con su trabajo duro ellos aseguran los ingresos mensuales que les permiten mantener a sus tres hijos.
Sin embargo, Yonvana cuenta que hace algunos meses el mototaxi de su esposo tiene problemas mecánicos. Yovana necesita un capital para comprar materiales, como el bronce, para su taller de grifería, además para apoyar a su esposo con la reparación de su mototaxi.
texts.en:
Yovana is 32 years of age. For seven years she has run a shop where she makes accessories for faucets. Yovana's husband has worked driving a "mototaxi" (a motorcycle with a covered seated area attached to carry passengers) for the last three years. With her hard work, they have been able to insure that they have the monthly income needed to support their three children.

However, Yovana reports that it has been some months that her husband's "mototaxi" has had mechanical problems. Yovana needs capital to buy materials, like bronze, for her faucet shop, and also to support her husband in the repair of his "mototaxi."

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase material for the making of faucet accessories and to repair her mototaxi.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es:
Pulpería N. es el nombre del negocio de la señora María N. cuyos inicios se dieron desde hace ocho años en el municipio de Chichigalpa en el mercado municipal. Actualmente la señora Maria tiene 46 años de edad y una de las cualidades que esta esforzada dama posee es que tiene un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio.

Ha venido mejorando el negocio a través de los años gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual ha invertido los créditos en la compra de la mercadería para surtir sus estantes. La razón por la cual solicita una vez más el crédito es para la compra de sus productos para su respectiva comercialización en el mercado municipal.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria N. started her business, which is called Pulpería N., eight years ago in the town of Chichigalpa’s local market. Maria is now 46 years old and one of the qualities of this hard-working woman is that she has a great spirit of self-improvement for her business.

She has been improving her business over the years thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel, for which she has used to invest loans in the purchase of goods to stock her shelves. The reason she once again requests a loan is to purchase more products for marketing and sale in the local market.

Translated from Spanish by Larissa Kravanja, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of goods

loans.name: Taborakkhon

texts.en: Taborakkhon J. is 37 years old, married, and has three children.  She works hard in the market of Isfara city selling fabric for traditional Tajikistani dress.  Taborakkhon's husband helps her with their business, because she is often busy helping their children study (her husband is pictured).  Taborakkohn and her husband have agreed that their business will attract more customers and earn more profits if they offer a wider range of products.  They also specifically hope to make their business appealing to people who earn a wide range of incomes.  In order to attain more products and increase the inventory of her business, Taborakkhon is requesting a loan of $1000.

loans.use: To purchase more fabrics and other products.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
“It’s better to give than to receive” is what Josephine believes in. She always practices this and her experiences prove that it is true, because she has been receiving a lot of blessings from God, like her family’s good health, good business, good relationships with family and neighbors. 

Josephine, together with her husband and three children, live in Brgy. Binarzang Quirino, Isabela. She has a pig-raising business and her husband manages their two-hectare rice and corn fields. She has three pigs, which she will sell for around $200 (9000 PHP) after four months. Thus, she expects to gain more than 50% income from her capital investment.

“Enough capital means more pigs to raise and therefore more income for the business”, said Josephine. So, she is requesting a loan of  $100 (4000 PHP) to increase her revolving capital.  With this capital, she expects to triple her yearly income. 

"I will work harder to provide good education for my children", she added.

loans.use: Buy additional pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Delia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Delia C. es una dama originaria del municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León y se ha dedicado por varios años a su actividad de pulpería la cual la tiene ubicada en su casa de habitación donde atiende a su fiel clientela todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana.

Hoy en día ella ha salido adelante gracias al apoyo brindado por Ceprodel el cual le ha facilitado créditos los cuales ella los ha utilizado en la compra de la mercadería para su pulpería. Es importante destacar que por medio de este crédito se beneficia tanto ella como su amada familia que tiene el deber de mantener.
texts.en:
Delia C. is originally from the Nagarote municipality in the city of León. For several years, she has dedicated herself to her general store which is located in her home. There, she tends to her loyal customer base every day starting from very early in the morning. These days, she is getting ahead thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel which has facilitated credit that she’s used to purchase merchandise for her store. It’s important to highlight that these loans have benefited both her and her beloved family which she must support.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products for her store.

loans.name: Asanji

texts.en:
Asanji is married to Theresia and they are blessed with six children. He has faced challenges in life such as ill health and poverty. Faced with all these challenges, it was not comfortable for Asanji to cope with the family needs. Asanji was introduced to GHAPE in the year 2003.

Asanji received his first loan of 20,000 FRS and invested in pigs, while he started the repayment promptly. Given a new loan he plans to rent a field of raffia palms to tap for palm sap which he will use to produce palm wine, commonly call “white mimbo”. "White mimbo" is a drink that many people in the country love drinking during ceremonies and on special occasions since it is inexpensive.

He has hope that the business will succeed because of the experience he has in the business and he has been doing this business for quite a long time, inheriting the process from his parents.This business he is doing will help those in his community by providing drink during ceremonies. He plans to use the profit from the loan to pay his children's school fees, save more to carry on bigger investments, and complete his child's apprenticeship fees. Asanji plans to start repayment on the fourth month from the date of disbursement.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Renting of raffia bush

loans.name: Fakhriddin

texts.en:
Fakhriddin F. is 20 years old. Despite his young age, he is already supporting his parents and, together with his brother, they’ve been working at baking “lepeshka”- traditional Tajik bread. He believes that this business is profitable and is not subject to seasonality. He gets up early and bakes the lepeshka and other bread so that people have fresh bread on their tables for breakfast.

All the raw materials such as flour, salt, and yeast are purchased in the local market. Now, due to high demand, Fakhriddin wants to increase the number of his bread he bakes, so he is requesting US$ 800 for a term of 12 months. The loan shall be spent for purchasing flour and coal for baking the “lepeshka”. In future, together with his brother, Fakhriddin is dreaming of openning their own workshop and with the profit, building his own house and his family. Fakhriddin deeply appreciates the trust and support you give him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing flour for baking “lepeshka”

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim C., 41, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham Province. By selling grocery items, she makes US $1.60 each day. Her husband works as a farmer and a barber and makes US $2.00 each day. 

Yim C. is asking for a loan of US $200 to raise a cow. She sees this purchase a good investment to expand her business and she is confident it will increase her income. (She pictured with her husband.)

loans.use: To raise a cow

loans.name: Abduholik

texts.ru: Хасанов Абдухолик проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 50 лет, женат  и имеет шестерых детей. Нигде не работает , но имеет помещение , которое сдает в аренду. Получает за него около 300 долларов США. Но весь доход от аренды уходит на обеспечение семьи. Теперь он планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить молодого бычка. У него имеется стойло , но у него нет возможности завезти скот. А получив кредит он сможет обзавезтись хозяйством и заняться делом.
texts.en:
Abduholik H. lives in the Varzob region. He is 50 years old, is married and has six children. He does not have a job, but he has a location which he rents out. He gets around 300 US dollars for it. But the entire income from the rent goes to providing for the family. Now he plans to get credit in order to purchase a young bull. He has a stable, but does not have the resources to get livestock. Getting credit, will allow him to get livestock and work on a business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a bull

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel S. manages a small air conditioning shop. She is 35 years old and has 4 children. She has workers who repair damage to the air conditioning units. This is her only source of income since her husband abandoned her.

She is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy new tool kits for her shop. The loan will help Hazel continue her business. She is also interested in starting another line of business to supplement her income. 

CEVI provides her the loan that she needs to run her business. She also receives trainings and insurance coverage services from CEVI.

loans.use: To buy new tool kits for her air conditioning shop

loans.name: Ahror

texts.ru: Ахрор энергичный мужчина, занимающийся продажей видеокассет и DVD дисков. Он торгует на рынке города Худжанда.У него стабильная реализация.Каждый свой займ он берёт для увеличения своего бизнеса, или обновления аппаратуры. Ахрор утверждает, что ему удобно в кредит осуществлять свои планы по расширению своей торговой точки. Он рад продолжать сотрудничать с Микроинвест и продолжать своё дело.
texts.en:
Ahror is an energetic man, involved in sales of video cassettes and DVD disks. He sells at a market in the city of Khujand. His business is stable. He used each one of his previous loans either to expand his business or to update his equipment. Ahror affirms that it is convenient for him to use financing in order to make his business growth plans come to fruition. He is glad to continue the collaboration with MicroInvest and to continue his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Leoncia

texts.en:
Leoncia is a beautician in their village. She is 53 years old and married to Dalmacio who is a tricycle driver and also maintains their farming business. The couple was blessed with five children. Some of them are already married while some are working in the City of Tuguegarao.

To further develop her business, Leoncia is requesting a loan from lenders amounting to PHP 11,000. She will use the loan to purchase different beauty products and materials she could use in her service. She also wants to establish a simple beauty salon in their town and through the amount she is requesting, Leoncia would be able to secure permits in order to operate a business legally.

loans.use: To purchase beauty products

loans.name: Saboat

texts.ru: Сабоат – 53 лет. Замужем и мать 3-х детей. Она занимается продажей дорогих национальных тканей.  Она торгует на рынке Бунафша находящийся в районе «Панчшанбе» города Худжанда. В пятницу она выходит на рынок «Джума-базар», а в воскресенье на рынок «Якшанбе-базар». Сабоат закупает товар из оптового рынка города Истаравшан, и часть товара в городе Бишкек Республики Кыргызстан. Она ездит за товаром  3 раза в город Истаравшан и 1 раз в месяц в город Бишкек. Сабоат за свой кредит хочет закупить партию летней дорогой ткани шифон для национальных платьев.
texts.en:
Saboat is a 53-year-old, married mother of three children. She is engaged in selling varied traditional fabrics. She sells in the Bunafsha market located in the Panchshanbe region of the city of Khujand. On Fridays, she comes to the Djuma-Bazaar market and on Sundays to the Yakshanbe-Bazaar market. Saboat buys some goods from wholesale markets in the city of Istaravshan and others in the city of Bishkek in the Kyrgyz Republic. She travels for goods three times per month to Istaravshan and once per month to Bishkek. With her loan, Saboat wishes to buy bundles of different chiffon fabrics for traditional dresses.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various summer fabrics and chiffon for traditional dresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of livestock and feed

loans.name: Athe

texts.fr: Athe B. est âgé de 43 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. il réside à Adeta où il exerce le commerce des fruits. Son activité consiste à payer les marchandises auprès des agriculteurs et de les amener dans la capitale pour la revente. Ce commerce est très florissant à cause de la forte demande et de la faible concurrence. Avec ce crédit, il souhaite accroître la capacité de son activité.
texts.en:
Athe B., 43 years old, is married with 4 children. He lives in Adeta, where he works as a fruit vender. He purchases fruits from growers, then takes them to the capital for resale. It's a flourishing business, because demand is high and there isn't much competition. With this loan, he expects to increase his productive capacity.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de maíz y otros productos para surtir negocio

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios and her family live in the rural village of Lawig, Lamut, Ifugao. Her three children are now studying: her eldest is now in college, her second child is in high school, while the youngest is in the elementary level. Despite the economic crisis that they are experiencing, Remedios and her husband continue to strive hard so they can afford to send their children to school and hope that they can have a better future. The couple is really working hard to provide for all the needs of their family.

Farming is the common source of income in their village and her husband is no exception. He plants a variety of vegetables while Remedios is engaged in a vending business. She sells cooked viands (tasty dishes) and snacks in the Lawig National High School and sometimes she also sells fruit and vegetables by roaming around their village.

Remedios is hoping for her business to become progressive and profitable. To do this, she needs additional capital and she is now asking to borrow PHP 5,000 from Kiva lenders that she can use. She hopes that, through her business, she can continue to assist her husband in providing all the needs of their family, especially in sending their children to school.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her business

loans.name: Tumurbat

texts.en:
Tumurbat P. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and two young daughters in Uvurhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His eldest daughter is 10 and goes to a primary school. The youngest daughter is just four and stays home.

Tumurbat, a trained shoe-maker, repairs shoes for man and women at the central black market where he is busy with new and revisiting customers. He purchases raw materials such as leather and cotton from the wholesale markets in the city. Tumurbat says that with his profit, he would like to open a saving account and start putting aside some money. He requests a loan to purchase more raw materials for his shoe-making.

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for shoe-making.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine P. is from the village of Cabilinan, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 38 years old. Josephine is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns and operates a "sari-sari" (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2007, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and to save for the future.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Exequiel

texts.en:
Due to our economic crisis, Exequiel J. ,Jr. and his wife Analie J. of Brgy. DMP Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya are working very hard to earn a living and to pay for the schooling of their four children. The two eldest are now in tertiary education while the two youngest are in secondary education. In this regard, they need to earn more income so that they are able to support their children's studies.

Exequiel is a 'jeepney' driver while his wife is engaged in running a general store, selling different snacks and groceries. Every week, they are able to earn an average net income of P 1,500 which they utilize to acquire their daily basic needs and pay the tuition fees and allowances of their children. In this regard, they need to earn a higher income so that they can maintain their businesses and they are able to meet their daily needs.

Because of this, Exequiel applied for a loan amounting to P 5,000 to be used for the maintenance of his 'jeepney' and for improvement to his wife's business. They believe that they will be able to improve their living conditions with the support of KIVA lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for the maintenance of their businesses

loans.name: Dante

texts.en:
Dante H. is from the village of Plaridel, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 33 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Dante owns and operates a business buying and selling chicken parts in the local community. Dante has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately $175 a month from these activities.

In 2008, Dante joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Dante has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Dante is requesting the same amount, 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be his 3rd loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ronald Antonio

texts.es:
El Señor Ronald Antonio P. M., labora como oficial de mantenimiento del mercado Mayoreo Managua, el habita con sus Cuatro  hijos y su esposa, de los cuales tres se encuentran estudiando, el esta casado, ha trabajado créditos con Ceprodel durante seis años, en ese lapso ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con los 11 Créditos otorgados que ha trabajado con Ceprodel, el es un excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para realizar la compra de materiales de construcción para mantenimiento y reparación del piso de la  vivienda en que habita y para el pago de la mano de obra.
texts.en:
Señor Ronald Antonio P. M. works in maintenance at the Mayoreo Managua market. He lives with his four children and his wife. Three of his children are in school. He has worked with Ceprodel for six years, and during this time, he has invested in improving his house with the eleven credits he has had. He is an excellent client. He will use this credit to buy construction materials to maintain and repair the floor of his home in which he lives and to pay for labor.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To maintain and repair the floor of his house

loans.name: Qalame Dine Group

texts.en:
Adelah is 36 years old. She has four children who are in school. She is the group leader of Qalame Dine group. There are four members in this group.

Adelah wants to take a loan for her business of tailoring. With this loan she wants to buy a new (sewing) machine and disk for her business. 

Ahamd Sha and M. Sha want to take a loan for their metal shop business. They need this loan because they want to expand and progress their business.

Kamelah wants to take a loan for her beading business. She needs to buy necessary materials. 

They request a group loan of 40000 AFN. They want to thank all lenders to AFSG and the Kiva process in Afghanistan. They are thankful that they help the poor people of this country.

loans.use: Expand their businesses.

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.en: S. Mahmadi is 45 years old and is married with four children. He manufactures by order the carved wooden doors, window frames and partitions of the national oriental style. He has been in this business for ten years already and, during these years, he has become a real expert in his business and has a lot of clients. Since Mahmadi has a lot of clients and demand, the business is very successful and brings in a stable and significant income, allowing Mahmadi to improve the living conditions of his family. Now he has a great order for manufacturing window frames and doors. Thus today Mahmadi requests 10,000 Somoni to purchase input materials of wood products for his business. Mahmadi’s previous loan was managed by him without violations, and he promises to repay the current one on time. He is counting on your help and he expresses his gratitude to everyone for supporting him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase input materials for his business

loans.name: Amapolas Group

texts.es:
Las 8 integrantes del grupo Amapolas que pertenece al Centro Focal Los Andes, elaboran su reglamento interno para trabajar durante el precente ciclo 1, organizadas por sus líderes, presidenta, tesorera y Secretaría de Actas, llevan adelante su reunión. Ellas se agruparon por la necesidad de acceder al préstamo para invertir en sus negocios, así Ruperta Juana C., una de las integrantes, tiene una tienda de barrio hace 1 año y desea incrementar su mercadería, Santusa Susana C. de 35 años confecciona prendas de vestir a pedido ya que tiene un pequeño taller en su domicilio y necesita el préstamo para comprar tela.
Las demás integrantes tienen negocios como tejido de chompas, mantas, gorras, aguayos (tela colorido),venta de muebles.
Todas quieren mejorar sus negocios comprando mercadería o materia prima.
texts.en:
The 8 member of the group "Amapolas" belong to the Los Andes regional office of ProMujer. They developed their internal working rules during the previous (and first) loan cycle. They are organized around their leaders: President, Treasurer and Secretary, who run their meetings. They formed the group in order to access a loan to invest in their businesses. Ruperta Juana C., one of the members, has had a neighborhood store for a year and wants to increase her merchandise. Santusa Susana C., 35, makes garments on order; she has a small workshop in her home and needs a loan to buy fabric. The other members have businesses such as the weaving of sweaters, blankets, caps, aguayos (big squares of colorful woven fabric), and the sale of furniture. All of the members want to improve their businesses by purchasing merchandise or raw materials.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise and raw materials

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Es Sr. Víctor Manuel Q. trabaja en una fabrica en la elaboración de puros de tabaco en el Municipio de Condega. El solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de ladrillos para piso ya que esta terminado de construir su propia casa.

Este cliente tiene aproximadamente 4 años de trabaja en esta fabrica de puro, empieza sus labores desde la 7 de la mañana y las finaliza a las 5 de la tarde de los días lunes hasta el medio día del sábado.

El Sr. V. es casado y no tienen hijo. El espera que con la compra de los materiales de construcción como son los ladrillos para piso llevar a cabo casi en su totalidad la construcción de su casa de habitación la que ha construido con su propio esfuerzo y el de su esposa. 

Este ese el crédito numero 3 que el Sr. V. ha tenido en Ceprodel en un periodo de 2 años. Estos créditos le han beneficiado positivamente ya que el no cuenta con los ingresos suficiente para financiar la construcción de su vivienda por lo que a través de dichos créditos ha logrado su metas con es la de una casa propia.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel Q. works in a factory in the municipality of Condega that produces cigars from the Tabasco region. He is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase bricks for the floor of the house he is building. This client has worked in the factory for about 4 years. He works from 7:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m., from Monday to midday Saturday. Mr. V. is married and doesn't have any children. With the purchase of construction materials, such as bricks for flooring, he hopes to complete construction on the house that he and his wife have been building through their own hard work. This is the third loan that Mr. V. has had with Ceprodel over the course of 2 years. These loans have positively impacted him since he doesn't have enough income to finance construction on his house. Through these loans he has achieved his goal of owning a home.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bricks and cement for flooring.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en: Catalina G. is from the village of Langcangan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 60 years old. Catalina is married. To make a living, Catalina runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of viands (tasty dishes) and other items in the local community. Catalina has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Catalina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Catalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. Catalina decided to take a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Catalina from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Doumouh

texts.en:
Doumouh is a 24-year-old married woman. She has six years of experience in the hairdressing and beauty business. After getting married, she decided to open a beauty salon and start receiving clients. She was able to make a good number of clients from the whole region due to her good services.

Today, Doumouh is requesting $1,200 to buy additional tools, hair accessories and beauty products to meet her customers’ demands and to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy additional tools, hair accessories and beauty products

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia .I. is 20 and single with no children.  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting fishing.  Rosalia has 6 years of experience in this business.  Rosalia needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Rosalia joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Rosalia's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Rosalia .I. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives

loans.name: Ramani

texts.en:
Ramani is a 31-year-old married woman living with her husband. She has one 6-year-old child. Her husband assists with her business and they are very close and work well together.

Ramani has a clothing shop where she sews dresses for local customers and villagers. Two years ago, she started this business.

Ramani has requested a 15,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to expand her sewing shop to help her business. She is grateful for BRAC Sri Lanka because of the support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To develop her clothing business

loans.name: Evarista

texts.es: Evarista tiene 46 años, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la venta de madera, actividad que es su principal fuente de ingreso y la de su familia. Ella trae la madera de provincias y las vende en su ciudad a un precio mayor, generándole buenas ganancias. El trabajo es duro, por ello cuenta con el apoyo de su familia, y gracias a esta ayuda podrá muy pronto ampliar su negocio. Ella necesita capital para comprar mayor cantidad de madera y de esa manera obtener más ingresos, además en estas épocas del año las ventas son buenas, por tal motivo necesita comprar en mayor cantidad. Por el momento continuará trabajando arduamente como lo viene haciendo, porque sabe que solo así lograra el éxito en su negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual en todos los pagos de las cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en los viajes que hará para traer mayor cantidad de madera y de esa manera aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Evarista, 46, lives with her partner and their three children in her own home. She has sold lumber for the last three years; this is her family’s main source of income. She brings wood from the provinces to sell in the city at a higher price thus generating good profits. It’s hard work but she can count on her family’s help and thanks to this funding will be able to expand her business. She needs capital to buy larger amounts of wood so that earnings will be higher; besides, this time of year sales are good so she needs to have larger amounts in stock. For the present, she will continue to work hard like she’s been doing so far because she knows this is the only way her business will succeed. This is her 1st loan with MFP and she pledges to be very punctual with her repayments. She will use the requested funds to pay for the trips she will make to bring larger amounts of wood thus increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber.

loans.name: Manh

texts.en: Mr. Manh R., 26, lives in Siem Reap province. He owns a small shop in front of his home where he sells coffee and some cooking supplies to his neighbors. Manh R. lives with his wife, who stays at home to assist him in selling his items. This couple was married years ago and they have a lovely young child who is not enrolled in school. Due to lack of capital, Manh R. would like a loan of US $700 to purchase more inventory items to continue selling. He will use some of the loan to decorate his shop in order to attract more clients.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory items to continue selling

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia B. is from the village of Calamagui 2nd. She is 48 years old. Amalia is married and has three small children. To make a living, Amalia owns and operates a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes from tending a canteen near the school. Amalia has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2010, Amalia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Amalia is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Amalia's first loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 56 years old. He is married with 7 children aged between 15 and 40 years old. All the children except one have completed school.

He is a farmer from Eastern Kenya near Nkubu town where he has been farming for 30 years. His main products are bananas, coffee, beans and maize which he sells to the local market. He depends on farming to cater to the family's needs. His main challenges in farming are diseases and transportation problems.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 47,250 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help the family expand their farming activities thereby improving their livelihood and allowing him to educate his youngest daughter. He plans to expand his dairy farming by buying 2 more dairy cows.

He says that Juhudi Kilimo loans are paid monthly so this will give him ample time to look for money to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a 42 year old lady who is married to a businessman.  She is blessed with five children who are still in school.  She has been in business for eighteen years. She also farms to supplement her family’s income.  She is an active member of a group in Faulu Kenya where she saves her money on a weekly basis.  The members of the group guarantee each other's loans from Faulu Kenya.  Therefore, she has requested a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to add to her stock of fruits.  This will be her second loan from Faulu Kenya.  She hopes to grow her business so as to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: To buy more fruits for sale

loans.name: Vannak

texts.en: Mrs. Vannak C. is 30 years old and she is a villager who lives in Kaoh Reah Leu village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Symon Choeun, are fruit sellers who are able to earn a small profit to support their family's living expenses. In order to support this business and in order to increase their income to improve the family's standard of living, Mrs. Vannak C. has decided to ask for a loan. With the loan she will buy more fruit to sell and rent some land to cultivate papaya. This couple has three children: one is attending in the local school while the other two are too young to study or work.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell and to rent some land to cultivate papaya.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria S. is from the village of Lawis, Sindangan, Zamboangae del Norte. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a Balut making venture. Victoria has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Victoria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.
 
 About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Corona

texts.en:
Corona T. is a busy entrepreneur managing her fishing business. Her previous loan from ASHI has provided working capital to expand her business and purchase additional fishing materials. With the loan, Corona has noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with additional inventory of fish.

Corona joined Kiva partner ASHI in 2003 attracted by ASHI's low interest rates and range of loans for business, education, and home repair. Prior to ASHI, Corona had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams. Positive growth from her business has helped Corona fund the education of her children. Since joining ASHI, Corona has experienced positive changes in her life. She hopes her fishing business will continue to flourish so she can provide long term financial stability for her family.

The fishing business also contributes income for them and that’s why, even if sometimes selling fish is hard to do, Corona never gets tired of doing it. Therefore, she is now requesting another loan for a larger amount of 24,000 PHP to purchase additional fish nets and support maintenance of their boat pump. This will allow her to grow their business further so that their children fulfill their dreams and experience a life that’s full of happiness. She continues to pray and wishes all lenders all the best and good luck and hopes they will will continue to support poor families like hers who want to improve their standards of living.

Her long term goals are to help support her children's education, invest and build a better house for the family and to have a full-fledge fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish nets and support maintenance of their boat pump.

loans.name: Fedeline

texts.en:
Fedeline I. is from the town of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is 54 years old, married, and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She is just starting this business.

In 2008, Fedeline joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. Fedeline is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which again will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. is married and has three children. She has received senior high education. Ama sells body creams at Elmina. Her husband is a repairman. Ama uses her income to help her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Ama will use the loan to purchase more body creams and lotions for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business. Ama plans to save to educate her children.

loans.use: purchase more body creams and lotions for sale

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La Sra. C. P. es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, actualmente se desempeña como comerciante donde su negocio consiste en la venta de ropa nueva y zapatos donde tiene tres años de desempeñarse en este negocio. Tiene dos años de trabajar con Ceprodel donde se le han otorgado cinco créditos consecutivos. El crédito lo solicitó para la compra de pantalones, blusas, camisas, ropa interior, chinelas y zapatos deportivos.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. P. is originally from the municipality of El Sauce.  Currently, she works as a merchant and her business consists of selling new clothing and shoes.  She has been in this line of work for three years.

She has been with Ceprodel for two years, during which she has received five consecutive loans.  She has asked for the loan in order to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, undergarments, slippers and sneakers.

loans.use: To purchase pants, blouses, shirts, undergarments, slippers and sneakers.

loans.name: Gina Damiles Group

texts.en: Gina D. is from the village of Masabud, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Gina is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. Gina is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products like cooking oil, shampoo, eggs, etc., in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Gina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Gina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy new tables and chairs for his business

loans.name: Res

texts.en:
Res P. is an older woman and a single mother who currently resides in the middle of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. Res P. has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and she uses her knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family.

 Res P. also travels to sell her medicine, walking around her community. Res P. has four children and all of them are single. One of her children is selling a few products such as plastic items, perfumes, and beauty products to people in and around his community. Res P.’ son wishes to have more money to increase his capital to purchase more items for extra profits. So Res P. will use her loan to support her son’s business in order to buy some products to resale. Res P. was not available for photographing, so her son is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy some products to resell

loans.name: Yacouba

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Yacouba TRAORE N.1 a 33 ans, marié et père de six enfants dont 3 garçons et 3 filles. Il réside avec son épouse et leurs enfants dans une grande famille traditionnelle Bougoula Hameau situé environ à 7 kilomètres de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Yacouba TRAORE après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès, s’est initié au commerce d’articles divers. Il dispose D4une boutique devant le domicile conjugal où il mène cette activité d’achat et vente des articles divers (maïs, Cigarette, bonbon, allumette, Chewing gum, lait en poudre, Thé, sucre, savon, etc) depuis plus de douze années. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y'a environ quatre ans. Ainsi il a bénéficié de trois prêts individuels qui ont été tous correctement remboursés.
Il sollicite ce quatrième prêt  pour lui permettre d’augmenter son fonds de commerce afin de se procurer de, 5 tonnes de maïs, 10 cartouches de Cigarettes différentes, 2 cartons du thé, 4 sacs du sucre, 8 paquets de lait en poudre, 4 paquets de bonbon, 10 paquet de Chewing-gum, 30 paquets d’allumette, 4 cartons de savon, etc.
auprès des commerçants grossistes de la ville de Sikasso et environnants. Il revend ses marchandises en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de toutes sortes de couches sociales de sa localité.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 300 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr Yacouba Traoré No. 1, aged 33, is married and the father of six children, three sons and three daughters. He lives with his wife and their children in a large traditional family in the hamlet of Bougoula, located about 7 kilometers from Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Mr Yacouba Traoré, after having tried several activities without success, opened a grocery store with various articles. His store is in front of the family home, and he has been buying and selling various articles (corn, cigarettes, candy, matches, chewing gum, milk powder, tea, sugar, soap, etc.) for over a dozen years. He enjoys a high demand from his customers due to the good quality of his products.

To satisfy his ever increasing clientele, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. He was granted three individual loans that have been properly repaid. He applies for his fourth loan to increase his working capital. He will buy 5 tons of corn, 10 cartridges of various cigarette brands, 2 boxes of tea, 4 sacks of sugar, 8 packs of milk powder, 4 packs of candy, 10 packs of chewing gum, 30 packs of matches, 4 packs of soap, etc. He gets his supplies from wholesalers in Sikasso and neighboring villages. He retails his products, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of people from all levels of society in his village.

Thanks to this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 300,000 CFA francs, which he will use primarily to increase his working capital, provide for his family and pay the interests of his loan.

loans.use: To buy various grocery items

loans.name: Joseph Kariuki

texts.en:
Joseph has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for five years. He is 50 years old, married and blessed with eight children.

He discovered KADET through its various marketing activities in his town. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers, seedlings and to hire workers.

Joseph hopes to boost his farm production and increase his number of dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for the labour.

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with one small daughter. He has a business selling cleaning supplies at a market in Novaya Kakhovka. Sergei started this business 6 years ago after he was unable to make enough money as a farmer to support his family. He enjoys his business now because inventory sells quickly. Having many repeat clients ensures his sales. 

Sergei is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to help purchase new inventory to sell. He wants to increase the assortment of products to improve sales overall. He hopes to receive additional income, which he will spend on his family's needs.

loans.use: To purchase cleaning supplies to sell

loans.name: Adjoah

texts.en:
Adjoah E. is married and has 6 children. She has had no formal education. Adjoah has been selling provisions such as onions, canned tomatoes and cooking oil, in addition to a range of other goods, at her store in Abrafo, near Abura, for 5 years. Her husband is a farmer. Adjoah and her husband use their incomes to pay for food, other necessities and school fees and books.

Adjoah will use this loan to purchase more provisions for her shop to have a broader range of goods to gain more satisfied customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoah plans to reinvest in her business. She will also use some of the profit to repay her loan and further her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions to have a broader range of goods

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis G. has worked as a farmer for five years and currently produces coffee and bananas for sale.

He has requested this loan of 50,000 Ksh in order to purchase poultry. He hopes within in five years to have expanded his business and to own over 3,000 chickens. With the potential increase in income from the loan, he hopes to better feed his family and improve their standard of living.

Francis is 63 years old and has five children, ranging from the ages of 17 to 30 years old.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: That

texts.en: That T.  L. is 58 years old.  She is a farmer whose main activities are focused on raising cows . She has milk to sell every day.  That T.  L. earns a  stabL. income from these activities to help support her family.  She has been a SEDA client since 2004 and has used her loans very effectively in expanding her cattL. raising. Last year she borrowed 4,142,000 VND to  buy grass and baby trees for food for the cows. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 5,450,000 VND to improve housing for her cows.

loans.use: To improve housing for the cows

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles S. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years-old. Angeles is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Angeles owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling coconuts for copras (dried meat) and coconut charcoals in the local community. Angeles has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Angeles joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angeles has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and to provide working capital. Angeles is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional coconuts to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Angeles from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional coconuts to sell.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del Banco comunal “Luz de esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó. Ella se dedica a la preparación y venta de sus productos de amasandería, entre los cuales se encuentran pasteles, alfajores, queques, chocolates, turrones, galletas, empanadas de cóctel y pan amasado. 
María trabaja a pedido, por lo que sus clientes frecuentes son conocidos quienes le solicitan cierta cantidad de sus productos de amasandería a domicilio, ella se dedica a este rubro desde hace 3 años. Durante este tiempo su clientela ha ido en aumento, debido a la calidad de sus productos. 
María compra su mercadería en supermercados mayoristas, lugar donde los precios son más convenientes.
Con el préstamo de Fondo esperanza mas unos ahorros que María tiene en su poder, comprará materiales de construcción para fabricar un local establecido en el ante jardín de su casa, lo que convertirá en un bazar y confitería para vender todos sus productos. La motivación de realizar este proyecto es debido a la ubicación donde se encuentra su casa, ya que cerca tiene un colegio. El cual atraerá nuevos y más clientes. Para concretar este proyecto necesita esperar un permiso para ubicar su local al interior de su casa, el cual consiste en la patente de “Bazar y confitería”.
María vive con sus 2 hijos de 11 y 7 años de edad.
Su sueño es concretar su proyecto del Bazar y confitería, para brindarles a sus hijos una vida más confortable y una mejor calidad en su educación.
Para María participar  de Fondo Esperanza ha sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que le han enseñado a distribuir mejor sus ganancias y el préstamo obtenido le generará mayores ingresos por lo que está muy agradecida. También disfruta mucho de las reuniones que realiza Fondo Esperanza, debido al compañerismo que se ha generado.
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en: Maria is a member of the Luz de Esperanza community bank in the Chilean town of Curico.  She operates a business making and selling baked goods: pies, alfajores, cakes, chocolates, cookies, etc.  Maria has operated the business for 3 years and she works to order.  She knows her customers and they know her.  They come to her house to order whatever baked goods they need.  She has steadily added customers over the years as her reputation for making quality products has grown.  Maria buys her supplies at retail supermarkets because the prices are better.  She will use this loan from Fondo Esperanza, plus her own savings, to buy construction materials for adding a space to her house where she can set up a shop.  Her house is near a school so she thinks building the shop there will help her business.  She hopes to attract new customers, as well.  To complete the project, she needs a permit to set up a home-based store.  Maria lives with her 2 children, 11- and 7-years old, respectively.  She wants to set up the bakery so that she can provide her children with a good education and a better life.  Fondo Esperanza has been a great help to Maria's business because she has learned how to better spend her money and the loans that she's received from the bank have helped her to increase her income.  She also enjoys the regular meetings that Fondo Esperanza arranges with other members of the bank.  Curico is a town in Maule, a region of central Chile.  The area has a Mediterranean climate and is considered to be among the most pleasant in the country.  It's also know for its wines and its natural beauty.  According to the latest census figures, the area is also one of the poorest in Chile despite a growing workforce.

loans.use: Construction materials for food business.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel has a wife and two children. This hardworking man is a computer technician, and his business is a repair center. He found the need to do service in his community and used his knowledge to serve people and sell them the pieces they need to have better equipment.

He will use this loan to buy computers from brand outlets. Emmanuel is excited to be taking out his 4th loan with the Kiva partner, Esperanza, after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He will use the profits to invest in his business and save, as he is saving to have his own house.

He became interested in and motivated others to join Esperanza because of the good things he heard that it was doing in his community and other nearby areas, especially the low interest. Compared to others around, Esperanza's rates are very low and with this opportunity he can make his business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy used computers

loans.name: Ruqqiya's Group

texts.en:
Ruqqiya belongs to Khanewal which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She lives there with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Jinnah Abadi. She moved here 10 years ago. She is a housewife and spends most of her time staying at home and doing her household work. She has a one-year-old son and takes care of him and is raising him very well. 

Her husband’s name is M. S. and he works in the fields as a farmer. He grows different seasonal crops and after cultivating, he makes good profits.  

Ruqqiya has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to buy fertilizers, seeds and pesticides to grow his business further. 

He has been operating this business for the past 10 years and Ruqqiya is hopeful that an investment will bring better profits to him by expanding his business. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Ruqqiya.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides for agriculture business.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Asha M..  She is married and has one child, aged 10.  In 2006, she established  her furniture making business.  Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy wood for her work.  In the future, Asha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   

In Nepal, furniture is still made the old-fashioned way.  Using little more than basic hand tools, skilled artisans form raw lumber into beautifully finished pieces of furniture.  With precision and an eye for detail, furniture makers produce shelves, bed frames, and cabinet sets.  With the help of a Kiva loan, a furniture maker is able to increase the volume of their lumber purchases or hire additional labor.  This additional leverage allows an entrepreneur to increase productivity and profitability. 

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007.  Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering micro-credit and business training programs to low-income women.  In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

loans.use: to buy wood for her business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry N. is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, all of whom are currently in school. Henry has a business making bricks, which he has run for five years. He also has a second business selling phone airtime.
To help expand his business, Henry has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase firewood for firing bricks, which he will then sell. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Henry hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for firing bricks.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab, 54, is a farmer from the village of Sakasheti, in the Gori district. He lives with his wife Larissa, their 29-year-old daughter, and their 22-year-old son. 

All the family members are involved in agriculture. In particular, they have nine hectares of agricultural land, where tomato, cabbage, wheat and appletrees are grown. All harvested vegetables are sold to the wholesalers. Also Zurab owns a tractor and truck, which is used in his farm for tilling the land and transportation of vegetables and fertilizers. 

With the requested credit Zurab will purchase fuel for the tractor and fertilizers. All this will be used for tilling and fertilizing the land. Some part of the credit will be paid to the hired workers, which will help the family in cultivation. After the cultivation vegetables will be sown. 

Zurab's family hopes that they will have a good season and will harvest quality vegetables. Part of the income will be reinvested in the farm and the other part will be used for house renovations and the purchase of new furniture.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and fertilizers for tilling and fertilizing the land and to pay agricultural workers

loans.name: Blanca Gladys

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 42 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Chiclayo. La comunidad donde vive Blanca, es urbana y está en vías de desarrollo. Cuenta con agua y luz propia.

Blanca  cuenta con una mototaxi (unidad móvil que consta de una moto con una cabina en la parte trasera para transportar pasajeros) la cual conduce su esposo y que le genera ingresos destinados a los gastos del hogar. Adicionalmente, Blanca se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza a las personas de su comunidad.

Blanca solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles que destinará en ambos de sus negocios. Primero le dará mantenimiento a su mototaxi y luego comprará cosméticos y otros productos de belleza para venderlos. 

Blanca es una clienta recurrente de nuestra institución y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Blanca, age 42, is an enterprising and hardworking woman who lives with her husband and son in the District of Chiclayo. She resides in an urban community that is in a period of development. Blanca receives water and electricity services.

Blanca owns a motorcycle taxi (a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin for transporting passengers) that her husband drives in order to generate household income. In addition, she sells beauty products to people in her community.

Blanca is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 2000 PEN to use for both businesses. She will pay for maintenance of her motorcycle taxi and buy cosmetics and other beauty products to sell.

Blanca is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa who has earned good references, both personal and work-related.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance of her motorcycle taxi and to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 42 years old and married, with 2 school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper. Jerry is a farmer working in the Philippines. He engages in growing rice and has been doing it for 22 years. 

Jerry is asking for a loan of PHP20,000 to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds to be planted in his farmland. Jerry earns PHP35,000 when he harvests his rice crop. He hopes that, through his loan, he will further increase his rice production.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and rice seeds to be planted in his farmland

loans.name: Juliana Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Juliana, de 61 años de edad, madre soltera, tiene 3 hijos , es comerciante, se dedica a elaborar y vender tortilla , ella es originaria de León, lleva 17 años en este negocio, sus estudios son básicos solo logro terminar el segundo grado de primaria. Esta actividad la inicio por medio de un familiar cercano quien le ayudo y la motivo a poner su propio negocio de venta de tortillas. Con el paso de los años ha venido adquiriendo clientela y ha sobrevivido por medio de este negocio además de que sus hijos le ayudan a ella y también de las remesas que recibe.
Solicito el préstamo para reparar el techo de su negocio, realizar mejoras al piso y reparar la estufa donde cocina las tortillas y comprar materia prima como maíz.  Con esta inversión quiere poder darle una mejor apariencia a su negocio, tener suficiente materia prima almacenada para elaborar tortillas pues el precio del maíz tiende a incrementarse.   Su próxima meta es hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, hacer crecer su negocio para en un futuro dejárselo de herencia a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Juliana, 61, is a single mother of three children.  She’s a merchant.  She makes tortillas to sell.  She’s originally from León.  She’s been in this business for 17 years.  Her schooling is basic; she only completed second grade.  She started the business thanks to a close relative who helped her and motivated her to start her own tortilla business.  As the years have gone by she’s been acquiring clientele and has survived by means of this business.  Her children help her and she also receives money that’s sent to her.

She asked for the loan to repair the roof, the floor and the stove that she makes the tortillas with and to buy raw materials like corn.  With this investment she wants to give her business a better appearance and to have enough raw materials stored to make tortillas because the price of corn tends to increase.  Her next goal is to do some home improvements, to make her business grow to pass it down as an inheritance to her youngest daughter in the future.

loans.use: to repair the roof in her business, repair the floor and the stove where she makes the tortillas and also to buy raw materials like corn.

loans.name: Shasenem

texts.ru: Шасенем проживает в районе Джиликул. Ей 42 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж и старшая дочь работают в средней школе, они преподаватели. Сама Шесенем у себя дома занимается шитьем национальных платьев и наволочек. Кроме того она занимается вышивкой разных рисунков на наволочках. Этим видом деятельности Шасенем занимается более семи лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Shasenem lives in the Jilikul Reigon. She is 42 years old. She is married. She has five children. Her husband and eldest daughter work as school teachers. Shesenem sews traditional ethnic outfits as well as pillowcases out of her home. She also  embroiders  pillowcases. She has been in this business for over seven years. She is taking out a loan in order to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Abadahigwa Cb Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is 37 years old. She has five children who are aged 5 to 16 years old. Some of her children are adopted. Her husband is a house constructor.

Immaculee owns a general store in which she sells different items such as cooking oil, peanuts, etc. This business has enabled her to meet the needs of her family and improve their standards of living. She needs a loan to buy more items such as cooking oil, peanuts, etc.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Gisela

texts.es: La señora Gisela es dueña de un vehiculo  su esposo es chofer del mismo; el crédito lo necesita para pagar el costo de la reparación del sistema de frenos, que últimamente están dando problemas; esto le ayudara a que su trabajo sea mas seguro para  los pasajeros pues esta actividad es la fuente de ingresos que tienen para mantener  a su familia. Es casada, no tiene hijos y vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de San Martin de la ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Gisela is the owner of a vehicle that is driven by her husband. She needs this loan to pay the cost of repairing the brake system, which has been causing problems lately. This will make the vehicle safe for her passengers since this business is the source of income by which she supports her family. Gisela is married and has no children. She lives at her parents’ house in the District of San Martin in the city of La Paz.

This is the fifth time she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay the cost of repairing the brake system in her taxi.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 32 years old and is a married woman with four children. The oldest child is 11 years old while the youngest is 2. 

Alma is a farmer working in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Alma works hard to help provide for her family's needs and send her children to school.
