She requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs. Alma hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Fanny Guadalupe

texts.es: Fanny es socia del Banco Comunal Wiracocha, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, ella tiene una tienda de Bisutería, vende zapatos y ropa y hace Buffete, es socia hace mas de un año y medio, recuerda que el primer crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para su tienda de Bisutería, ella agradece ya que económicamente pudo lograr muchas cosas, se pudo comprar las cosas materiales que le faltaban, este préstamo lo utilizará para su tienda de bisutería, ahora la meta que tiene es tener una restaurante en el extranjero, ella agradece mucho a Finca por las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the Communal Bank “Wiracocha”. She is 34 years old and has two children. Fanny has a store where she sells trinkets, shoes, clothing, and variety of other items. She has been a member for more than a year and a half. Fanny recalls that her first loan was used for her trinket shop. She is grateful that she now has the financial ability to acquire many things and can buy items that she lacked before.

This loan will be used for her trinket shop. Her goal now is to open a restaurant abroad. Fanny is very appreciative for the training she received from FINCA.

loans.use: to buy various types of jewelry to sell in her store.

loans.name: Malvar

texts.en:
Malvar is an honest and a responsible man. He spends most of his time providing good customer service in his general store. He sells canned goods, breads, soap, shampoo and toothpaste to the people in his village. He also sells medicines. He had been operating his general store for almost 10 years.

Malvar is 45 years old and has two grown-up children.

Malvar is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy soft drinks, milk, sugar and medicines to sell in his store. He needs additional items to sell in order to boost his profits. 

He wants to keep making better sales and continue growing as an entrepreneur. In the future, he would like to achieve financial stability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, milk, sugar and medicines to sell in his store.

loans.name: C1903 Abisunganye Group

texts.en:
Prisca, 25 years old, is married and has four children between the ages of 8 and 16 years old. She is the leader of a group called "ABISUNGANYE" in the local language. Prisca (in green clothes in the middle of the photo) has 10 years of experience selling shoes. Her business is well-organized. She works from 6 a.m. until 7 p.m. every day.

Prisca has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes. With any profit, Prisca and her team will be able to save for the future and pay school fees for their children.

loans.use: To purchase shoes to resell

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is 26 years old. He is single and supports his parents. He is a farmer and he has been doing this for the last five years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for maize farming.

Leonard learned about KADET through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy maize seeds and fertilizers. He hopes to use the profit from this loan to acquire more land for farming to increase his maize production and educate his children in the future.

Leonard's hope and dream is to become a large scale farmer and buy a bigger piece of land and build a permanent home. He is a diligent man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Bukeru

texts.en:
Bukeru is 43 years old and lives in the town of Bugiri, which is located in the Iganga region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 24 years, Bukeru has been working hard to manage and operate his grocery store, which sells food and home supplies to local customers.

To help expand his business, Bukeru is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more food items like passion fruit, Irish potatoes, etc., and will help Bukeru to generate greater profits and to thereby improve his family's standard of living. Bukeru hopes that in the future he will be able to open grocery stores in more locations.

Bukeru is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Bukeru who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy additional food items (e.g., passion fruit and Irish potatoes)

loans.name: Yenny De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Yenny, vive con sus tres hijos, el lugar donde residen es propio, ella se dedica a la venta de pasteles y pupusas, ella tiene tres años de estar en la venta, este negocio surge por la necesidad de tener una ocupación y sobre todo un ingreso económico.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ingredientes para la venta, más que todos los productos no perecederos como el maíz, aceite, sal, bolsas para empacar y condimentos, la inversión le ayudara para mantener los materiales y de esta manera aumentar la producción.
La aspiración de Yenny es fortalecer el negocio a través de los préstamos, ver por sus hijos la manera para que se superen.
texts.en:
Yenny lives with her three children.  The place they live is their own.  She works selling pastries and "pupusas" [tortillas stuffed with meat and vegetables].  She has been doing this work for three years.  The business came up because of her need to have a job and, above all, an income.

She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to sell, more than anything else non-perishable items such as corn, oil, salt, grocery bags, and condiments.  The loan will help her maintain her supplies and so increase her production.

Yenny's goal is to strengthen her business with loans and to see a way for her children to improve themselves.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, salt, grocery bags, and condiments.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Leticia; ella tiene 43 años de edad, casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de molinera,ella muele granos como habas,trigo entre otros productos,la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de molinera y negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar sus molinos y comprar las semillas de cada producto natural que necesita. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Leticia is 43 years old, married, and has two children. She continues to operate her milling business. Leticia processes foods such as beans, wheat, and other products. She also manages a restaurant. Leticia works from 8am to 7pm. Through these businesses, she is able to help her children get ahead. She wants to expand and improve her milling business and her restaurant. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to keep operating her milling machines, so she will buy grains of each of the products that she processes.

Leticia is grateful to those who have helped her to realize her dream, so she promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy grains for processing.

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is 29 years old and single. He lives in the Philippines. Juan has a shop that sells bananas, coconuts, and spices. He has had this business for five years. 

Juan is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which he will use to buy sacks of bananas, coconuts, and ginger. He has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Juan hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of bananas, coconuts, and ginger.

loans.name: Nelius

texts.en: Nelius is requesting another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES to boost her M-PESA (mobile phone based money transfer) business. With this loan, she plans to increase the money float she uses in her money transfer business. She dreams of establishing a second M-PESA business in the future.

loans.use: to increase the money float for her mobile phone based money transfer business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina used to sell kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves) but now sells second-hand clothes at Enyinase near Elmina. She has been selling second-hand clothes for five years. 

Faustina is married to a farmer and has four dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband to provide for their family. 

She will use her loan to purchase more clothes for sale. With the new profit, Faustina plans to get a shop for the sales of her clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aubrey Marie

texts.en:
Aubrey Marie is a 23-year-old married woman with two children, ages 5 and 2. Her husband works as a farmer. Aubrey Marie owns a dry goods store in Trinidad, Bohol. She has had this business for a year now. Aubrey Marie sells items like toys, cell phone accessories, and ladies accessories. She earns about 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month with this business.

Aubrey Marie has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as toys, beauty products and school supplies. In the future, Aubrey Marie says she hopes to have "a great and wonderful life".

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as toys, beauty products and school supplies

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité Kuña Katupyry, se inicio cuando un grupo de señoras se reunieron solidariamente para trabajar en equipo con un solo ideal, que es sobresalir  con su arduo trabajo de día a día.  Es un grupo de 16 señoras humildes y muy trabajadoras, actualmente están en el 10° ciclo y agradecen infinitamente por el apoyo,  los seguimientos constantes, las capacitaciones y por confiar en ellas a otorgarles una ayuda para mejorar la calidad de vida de ellas y sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora. Por medio de su arduo trabajo ella puede solventar el día a día de su familia y mantener a la vez su negocio. Su meta es crecer y seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de verano, para que de esa forma pueda cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Ella agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry communal bank began when a group of women met jointly to work as a team with a single ideal, which is to stand out day by day with their hard work.  It is a group of 16 modest and hardworking women.  Currently they are in the tenth loan cycle and they are infinitely grateful for the support, the constant monitoring, the training, and for trusting in them to help them improve their quality of life and that of their families.

One of the members is María, who works selling all types of clothing.  She is a very hardworking woman and a fighter.  Through her hard work she is able to pay her family's daily expenses and at the same time support her business.  Her goal is to grow and continue helping her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy summer clothes so she can fulfill her customers' demands.  She is grateful to the foundation and to Kiva for the opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Shauri

texts.en:
Florence is a 39-year-old green grocer at Kilifi, Kenya. She is a mother of four whose spouse provides them with additional income. She has been in this business for the last three years, earning greatly.

This is her third borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance her business. She will use the money to purchase kale, cabbages and tomatoes and to renovate her stall. She will use the anticipated profit to educate her children and repay her loan.

She hopes to have a successful business and a happy family in future.

loans.use: to purchase kale, cabbage and tomatoes and to renovate her stall.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: A 40 years old. Mrs. Joy U. sells yams to people in her environment at Uwasota Quarters,( a semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria). High Patronage by customers gives her joy. She planned to boost her business with the above amount.

loans.use: To buy more yams for sale

loans.name: Mafwa

texts.en:
K. has been in his business since 1980. He started with $400, selling socks and general goods. K. was informed by his church about Hope’s programs. He decided to become a member of a loan group in 2004. Now K.’s business capital is around USD 800. He is happy with Hope’s loans and likes his business. He spends almost all of his time talking to his clients about their needs. K.’s vision is to become a wholesaler for his community, and through this he will not only grow his own business but also create jobs for others.

As the demand from people of his community and the neighboring area has increased, K. has not been able to satisfy their demand. With a $600 loan, he will be capable of providing goods for their needs.

loans.use: To increase inventory for retail

loans.name: Khadidja

texts.en: Khadidja was born in 1960 in Yenikand village in the Salyan region, Azerbaijan. She is married and has four children. She has been in this business for 10 years. She enjoys looking after chickens. With her previous loan of $500, she bought 50 hens. Now, she needs a loan of $1000 to buy 100 hens.

loans.use: To buy 100 hens

loans.name: Azucena

texts.es:
Azucena is thirty-three. She is married and has three children. Her husband works in the construction business in their home town of Creel, in the state of Chihuahua. When she realized that her husband's salary didn't cover their basic expenses, Azucena decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. At first, she sold only to family and friends, but soon she began to get other clients, and her sales increased.

To keep up with client demand, Azucena is asking for a loan of $325 to buy more inventory. She expects to repay the loan in six months. She is grateful for the support of her lenders, their belief in her, and their investment in her business and the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Antonio Padial, Kiva Volunteer

Azucena tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y madre de tres hijos, su esposo trabaja en una empresa constructora en la localidad de Creel en Chihuahua, de donde son originarios. Al ver que el salario de su esposo no cubría las necesidades básicas de su hogar Azucena decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, comenzó vendiendo sus productos a familiares y amigos pero pronto logró ganar más clientes e incrementar sus ventas.

Para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes Azucena está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Azucena agradece la confianza y ayuda que puedas depositar en este negocio y en el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her cosmetics business

loans.name: Kungaba

texts.en: Kungaba C. is a 50 years old wife and mother of eight children. She faces difficulties in raising money because of her age and her low income makes it difficult for her to educate and provide basic needs for the ever-growing needs of her eight children. These difficulties led her to become a GHAPE member where she received a first loan of $40. She was able to repay this loan and use the profits to provide some basic needs for the family. With the current loan of $200, she plans to sell foodstuffs in the local food market where buyers come from all over the province and use the income to pay her children's school fees. She plans to pay this loan in 15 months.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Nelya

texts.en:
Nelya has requested a loan of $1000 to expand her small family business where she sells pet supplies and rodent control products. She and her husband, Georgiy, work together in the business, and their three college-age sons help when they can. Nelya and Georgiy would like to open a new vending location in a village near Kamenka-Dneprovskaya where they currently operate. 

Their business has been a family venture ever since they started 15 years ago. They considered several different business possibilities before settling on this one. It has been a good business to be in as there is always demand for both pet food and supplies as well as rodent and pest control. Over the years they have developed a good reputation and gained many loyal customers and acquaintances which further helps the success of their business. 

Eventually Nelya and Georgiy would like to open a regular store facility. HOPE Intl- Nadiya Ukraine and kiva.org are happy to be able to assist theses dedicated entrepreneurs meet their needs and pursue their goals.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex K. G. is a welder at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. He has his own shop. He is also married with four children ages 12, 8, 6 and 2 years respectively. His wife is a trader, and she sells foodstuffs. Alex also manufactures baking ovens and coalpot (traditional stove used for cooking here in Ghana). He has lots of customers. In addition to this, Alex also sells car plates. At Alex's shop, lots of cars have been parked awaiting body works (maintenance). He also has three apprentices working under him.

One major challenge that Alex faces is that most of his customers do not make full payment when they bring their cars to him for repairs, so he has to look for money to complete their work for them before full payment is made.

Alex is asking for a loan of US $1,000 to enable him to buy more car plates for repairing car bodies, materials to manufacture ovens, gas, and electrodes for welding.

loans.use: To buy more car plates for repairing car bodies, materials to manufacture ovens, gas, and electrodes for welding.

loans.name: Khatira

texts.en: Khatira is a 56 year old woman who sells undergarments in the central Sabirabad bazaar. She is married and has five children. She has ten years of experience in this field and this business is the only source of income for her family. She tries very hard to cover her family needs and she works from early morning until late at night. She would like to expand and diversify the number of product sshe sells and has applied for a 1200 USD loan

loans.use: Expansion and diversification of products for sale

loans.name: Ma. Reyes

texts.es:
Because her husband—a bricklayer—does not earn enough money to cover the household expenses and raise 6 children, Ma. Reyes started a fast food business in 1987. She initially sold her meals from home, then sold traditional Mexican snack foods in a borrowed business space. After the owners asked for their space back, she started selling brand name cosmetics and perfume. In 2002, a friend sold a taco cart to her, which she set in her patio near a busy avenue, in installments. Since then, she has been selling tacos and sandwiches for a living.

However, Ma. Reyes needs a loan of $475.00 USD, which she is willing to repay within 5 months. With this loan, Ma. Reyes will be able to purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare her food, buy tables and chairs, and paint her cart so she can attract more customers. With your support, Ma. Reyes and her husband will be able to help her family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Debido a que lo que gana su esposo como albañil no es suficiente para pagar los gastos de la casa y de sus 6 hijos, Ma. Reyes comenzó su negocio de venta de comidas desde 1987, primero elaborando comidas en su casa, después en un pequeño local que le prestaron comenzó a vender antojitos mexicanos, después le pidieron el local y se puso a vender cosméticos y perfumería de reconocidas marcas y a partir del año 2002 una comadre le traspasó un carrito de tacos en abonos, el cual instaló en el patio de su casa que da a una avenida principal (muy transitada) y desde entonces me se dedica a vender tacos y tortas.

Sin embargo Ma. Reyes necesita un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 5 meses y con este dinero Ma. Reyes podrá comprar materia prima para elaborar sus productos y unas mesas y sillas, además de poder pintar su carrito para que tenga mejor presencia y así los clientes se acerquen con más confianza. Con tu ayuda Ma. Reyes podrá sacar adelante a sus 6 hijos con la ayuda de su esposo.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients, paint, tables, and chairs for taco business

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty’s Prepared Food Sales become an important source of income for her family. She is sixty years old although she acts like she is twenty. She is very kind and communicative. The success of her prepared food sales in largely due to the suggestions of her beloved son who works in a hospital, her clients who day after day refer others, due to easy payment terms, and due to the clean and orderly distribution of the food every afternoon. Due to the high degree of client satisfaction, her orders have increased faster than she thought they would. As a result, she needs a greater quantity of containers, kitchen utensils; covers and food, to continue with her business. Consequently, she needs a loan to quickly acquire these products in order to please her growing clientele.

Translated from Spanish by Jenny Dean, Kiva Volunteer.

La buena sazón de Doña Betty, le ha permitido convertirse en una fuente importante de financiamiento para el bienestar de su familia. Ella tiene sesenta años y pesar de su avanzada edad se desenvuelve como si tuviera veinte, es muy amable y comunicativa nos comenta que el éxito que tiene la venta de sus platillos es en principio gracias a los comentarios de su querido hijo que labora en un hospital y luego de sus clientes que día a día la recomiendan con otros, debido a la facilidad de pago, a la limpieza y orden en cuanto a los repartos que realiza todas las tardes. Ha observado con mucha satisfacción que los pedidos se incrementan mucho más rápido de lo que ella algún día pensó y tiene la necesidad de adquirir mayor cantidad de recipientes, utensilios de cocina, cubiertos y alimentos, para continuar con su esforzada labor, por esta razón acude en búsqueda de tu ayuda para adquirir pronto lo necesario a fin de satisfacer y complacer a sus queridos comensales. queridos comensales.

loans.use: To Buy Food, Covers, Kitchen Utensils and Containers.

loans.name: Thi Dao's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. T. Thi Dao is a hard-working woman but she does not have a happy life. She divorced with her husband and is currently on her own raising 2 children. Everyday, she makes beans T. sell, works on the rice field and breeds the pigs. She borrows money T. buy more fertilizer and insecticide. She hopes the money will help her family situation getting better so that her children can go T. good school. Other members in her group also borrow 125 USD in 25 weeks. They are: Mrs. N. Thi Mien, 49 years old, borrows money T. buy rice T. make rice vermicelli; Mrs. T. Thi Mai, Mrs. D. Thi Thuy and Mrs. T. Thi Loan borrow money T. buy more pig mash.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tô Thị Đào là người phụ nữ chăm chỉ, tháo vát nhưng không may mắn, chị đã ly dị. Nay chị một mình vất vả nuôi hai con ăn học. Hàng ngày chị làm đậu bán, chăn sóc ruộng đồng và nuôi đàn lợn thịt. Chị vay vốn để mua phân bón, thuốc trừ sâu bón lúa. Chị hy vọng số vốn này sẽ giúp chị cải thiện kinh tế gia đình để các con chị có điều kiện ăn, học tốt hơn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm chị cũng đều vay 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần. Chị Ngô Thị Miên, 49 tuổi, vay vốn để mua gạo làm bún. Chị Trần Thị Mai, Dương Thị Thủy, Trần Thị Loan đều vay vốn để mua cám lợn.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, insecticide, rice and pig mash.

loans.name: Nadia's Group

texts.en:
I am Nadia K., married and the mother of an only daughter who is two years old. I live with my family in a two-room mud-brick house in Multan, Pakistan. My husband works at a private institution in another city, Lahore, Pakistan, while I run a boutique. I started this boutique two years ago and currently I need to expand it.

I have been joined in my loan group by four other women who are: Tahira B., who is borrowing for her family’s fruits business; Zulaikha K. who makes flower bouquets; Samina N., who runs a boutique; and Fatima B., whose husband trades livestock.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Comite Santa Catalina Group

texts.es:
When Mrs. Elsa V. heard about the program offered through Fundacion Paraguaya, she didn't hesitate in contacting her neigborhood 's friends to inform them about it. After an informative conversation among them, the 16 ladies decided to form a committee.

The members of the group dedicate themselves to diverse activities like selling clothes and handicrafts. Others are owners of small grocery shops and candy shops. Some of them are seamstresses.

The money given through the loan will help them buy raw materials related with the diverse activities that each one of them do. Among some of the materials used are: theads, needles, fabrics, flour,eggs,beverages,oil,pasta,etc.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Elsa Vázquez al enterarse del programa que ofrece Fundación Paraguaya no dudo en contactar con sus amigas del barrio para informarles acerca del mismo. Luego de una charla informativa las 16 señoras decidieron formar un comité.

Los integrantes del grupo se dedican a diversas actividades como la venta de ropas y manualidades. Otras son dueñas de despensas y confiterías. Algunas son costureras.

El dinero otorgado pro el crédito será destinado a la compra de materiales relacionados a las diversas actividades. Por ejemplo: hilos, agujas, telas, harina, huevo, bebidas, aceite, pasta entre otros.

loans.use: Buying clothes, fabrics, threads, basic needs' articles like: sugar, noodles, flour, canned products, oil, fruits and others.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi N., 45 years old, borrows money to improve her family economy. In 2006, she joined the TYM Fund and borrowed 200 USD to invest in breeding pigs. Her project in breeding pigs succeeded since the beginning. The next round of borrowed money, she used it in making wine besides breeding pigs because the waste from the fruit is a nutritious food for pigs. Her projects went well and effectively. She was able to send her oldest child to a technical school. He owns a electrical workshop. He also contributes to repaying his mother’s borrowed money. Mrs. N.’s other 2 children are still going to school. This time, she wants to borrow 550 USD to invest in her son’s electrical workshop. Her average income is 250 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Nghiên 45 tuổi, với mục đích vay vốn để phát triển kinh tế. Năm 2006 chị tham gia vào Quỹ vòng vốn đầu tiên chị mạnh dạn vay 3.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Dự án chăn nuôi lợn của gia đình chị thành công ở vòng vốn đầu tiên, bước sang vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đã bàn bạc đầu tư dự án nấu rượu hỗ trợ chăn nuôi lợn, bã rượu là thức ăn có nhiều chất dinh dưỡng, từ những vòng vốn sử dụng hiệu quả gia đình chị đã đầu tư cho con đi học nghề sửa chữa điện tử, hiện nay con chị đã có nghề và mở cửa hàng sửa chữa điện tử, 2 người con chị đang đi học, từ khi có cửa hàng sửa chữa điện tử thu nhập kinh tế gia đình chị đã tăng cao việc hoàn trả vốn của gia đình chị rất tốt. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 9.000.000đ đầu tư vào cửa hàng điện tử. Thu nhập bình quân 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: expand electrical workshop for her son

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel E. sells a variety of things, including drinks. He is married, but his wife's income as a petty trader is not sufficient for Emmanuel and his 5 children. Demand for his goods is high, and he is looking to expand his business to increase his profits.

He is asking for additional capital to expand his business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand his business.

loans.name: Sri

texts.id: Sri I. (42) saat ini menjalani usaha sebagai penjual sembako, yaitu bahan-bahan pokok kebutuhan rumah tangga seperti beras, minyak tanah, makanan ringan bahkan ada juga rujak. Setiap hari dia mulai membuka warungnya dari jam 8 pagi sampai jam 7 malam. Para pelanggannya adalah mereka yang tinggal disekitar rumah tempat tinggalnya di Jl.Ahmad Yani Denpasar. Saat ini Sri I. telah melunasi pinjamannya yang pertama, dan bermaksud untuk meminjam lagi. Dari pinjamannya terdahulu, sebagian besar dipakai untuk membeli kebutuhan pokok untuk warungnya yang lalu kemudian dijual lagi. Dari usahanya saat ini dia bisa mendapatkan keuntungan Rp.400.000 setiap minggunya dan dia sangat bersyukur atas semua itu. Dia berharap, bisa diberi pinjaman yang lebih besar lagi yang nantinya akan dipakai untuk mengembangkan usahanya supaya lebih besar.
texts.en:
Sri I. sells staple goods, such as rice, kerosene, and snacks. Her kiosk is open for business from 8 am till 7 pm. Her clients are mostly her neighbours. She lives in Ahmad Yani Road, Denpasar. Sri I. has paid back her earlier loan and now asking for a second loan. Her first loan was used to purchase more merchandise for resale. This business brings her about $40 profit per week. She is thankful for her business success. She is hoping to get a bigger loan so she can expand her business faster.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Bashorat

texts.en: Bashorat B.  has been engaged in selling household wares in the bazaar with her mother for the past 15 years. They live poorly in spite of the fact Bashorat does her best to help her family. While Bashorat does not have a good education she has acquired appropriate business skills. Bashorat works honestly with suppliers and has a good reputation as a trader. She has many repeat customers and good assortment of goods. Bashorat now applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 2100 STJ for a 5 month term to purchase new materials for sale.

loans.use: To purchase new materials for sale

loans.name: Fausta

texts.es: Fausta tiene 45 años y dos hijos. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de las marcas más reconocidas de su medio, de esa manera, recorre todos los días las principales calles de la ciudad, en búsqueda de clientela nueva, para que sus productos tengan mayor salida y pueda obtener mayores  ganancias, debido a sus constancia, hoy ve los resultados exitosos que tiene el superar su propio record de ventas, sus clientes son por lo general trabajadores de oficinas de diversas instituciones, a los cuales les da crédito y en fin de mes les cobra. Fausta se esfuerza porque desea seguir apoyando a sus hijos, que se preparan mediante el estudio, para afrontar la vida.  Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá adquirir mayor mercadería, de esa manera tener mayor variedad de cosméticos, que la ayudarán a seguir apoyando económicamente a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fausta is 45 years old and she has two children. For the past two years she has worked selling cosmetics from the best-known brands. In this manner she walks the principal streets of the city in search of new clients, so her products will sell better and she will be able to get a better income. Thanks to her constancy, today she has successful results and has her own superior record of sales. Her clients in general work in offices of various businesses. She gives them credit and at the end of the month she collects. Fausta works because she wants to continue helping her children. They are preparing through study, in order to improve life. She asks for this loan, with which she will be able to get better merchandise, and by this manner have a better variety of cosmetics that would help her help her children financially.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of cosmetics that Fausta sells

loans.name: Nelly Elizabeth

texts.es: La Sra. Nelly, casada, con 30 años de edad y 2 hijas, 1 del primer matrimonio y la otra del 2do, ambas estudian la primeria, tiene 7 años de trabajar para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa, es técnica en Administracion de Empresas, esta solicitando su 3er credito para cambiar el techo de su dormitorio que está ubicado al fondo de la casa de su mamá, comprara  perlines y zinc ya que esta construido con madera y zinc, los que estan en malas condiciones. Ella tiene un terreno y en el futuro piensa hacer un credito mayor para ir poco a poco construyendo su propia casa para el futuro de sus hijas.  Sus creditos anteriores los ha cancelado con responsabilidad y espera continuar manteniendo su buen record crediticio, porque piensa que los mas grande que debe tener una persona es honradez y credibilidad; su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad pero aporta al hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nelly Elizabeth M. A. is thirty years old, married, and has two daughters – one from her first marriage and the other from her second – who are in elementary school. Nelly Elizabeth has worked in the mayor's office in Juigalpa for seven years and works in Business Administration. She is requesting her third loan in order to redo the ceiling of her bedroom in the back of her mother's house. She will buy purlins (support beams) and zinc for the ceiling that is already made of wood and zinc, which are in poor condition. She has a plot of land and she is thinking of getting a bigger loan so that, bit by bit, she can build her own house for the future of her two daughters. She has paid off her previous loans responsibly and hopes to continue to maintain her good credit record, because she thinks that the biggest things a person should have are integrity and credibility; her husband works outside the city but contributes to the home.

Translated from Spanish by HannahLily P, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair a room (replace roofing)

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
“In sickness and in health, for richer and for poorer, ‘til death do us part”. Julia and her husband, Manuel, still hold the marriage vows they took during their wedding. 

For many years, Manuel has worked as a farmer. With six mouths in the family to feed in, he and Julia strive to work harder to be able to sustain their everyday living expenses. Julia owns a store in their small community of Sisim Alto. She earns an average income of $20 (1000 PHP) per week, which is just enough for their daily consumption and assistance for their rice farming. To purchase additional products to sell in her small store, she is requesting a loan for $125 (5000 PHP). They expect that this amount will help them make their business grow. 

They are motivated to manage their store well because they do not want to depend on the support of their children, who also have their own families. Julia believes that “when there is hardship, there is progress”.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell in the store

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es:
La señora Adelaida T. está muy agradecida por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. Ella solicita su cooperación para este otro préstamo, para empezar a construir un cuarto para sus hijas ya que están creciendo y desean tener su propio espacio.
Ellos desean realizar esta mejora pero no cuentan con el capital necesario para llevarla acabo. 
Doña Adelaida T. se dedica a la venta de ropa usada los fines de semana y su esposo el señor Francisco Rodríguez trabaja como chofer de camión, estos son los ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Adelaida T. is very thankful for all the support she received with her previous loan. She is now once again asking for your support with another loan, to start building a new room for her two daughters that are growing up and need her own space. They would like to make home improvements, but they don’t have enough money to do so. Adelaida T. sells used clothes during the weekends and her husband, Francisco Rodríguez, works as a truck driver. Those are their only home income.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a new room in the higher floor

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy N. is 45 years old and is married with six children. All her children are enrolled in a community school. Mercy lives in a farming community named Abofour, a suburb of Offinso, in the Ashanti region of Ghana. Abofour is a forest reserve area and the most popular occupation is farming. Most residents are farmers and the illiteracy rate is very high among the adults. The highest education most families can give their children is junior high school. The lack of education has been the cause of the areas highest unemployment rate in Ghana.

Mercy is a seasoned farmer and she has been farming in the area of cocoa and cereals, like maize, for more than eight years. She has managed to build a house for her family. Mercy owns larger acres of cocoa and maize but has recently been facing problems due to a disease attacking her cocoa farm. Mercy would like a loan to purchase farm inputs like cocoa chemicals, spraying machines, fertilizers and agro chemicals etc. With the loan, Mercy believes she will be able to harvest more this year and in the years ahead.

Mercy would also like to use part of her profit to support her children's education. Mercy belongs to a village bank called ‘Asedaben’.

loans.use: To buy larger farm inputs like agro chemicals, fertilizers and farm equipment.

loans.name: Mukhtayaran Liaqat Ali Group

texts.en:
Mukhtayaran baji is a 48 year old married lady and has been a resident of Ismail Nagar of Lahore city, Pakistan, for the last 30 years. She could not get an education as her father had little financial resources. She married a man whose name is L. A. and he has a blanket selling business. He buys blankets from different cities (Multan, Faisalabad). This has become her family business, because her three sons also involve in selling blankets. Mukhtayarn baji also helps her husband by going to different cities to buy the blankets so that her husband has more time to sell them. She successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy additional blankets to expand her family business. 

She is a loan group leader of several other women of her locality. Irshad baji, Rehana kosar baji, Nasreen baji and Guddu baji each want a loan to buy blankets to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy blankets to sell

loans.name: Ongonbayar

texts.en:
Ongonbayar N. is 47 and married. She lives in the Narantuul district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, with her husband and two children. Her two children go to a secondary school in Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is a taxi driver.

In 2002, her family moved from a small town in the countryside to Ulaanbaatar. As soon as she moved to the capital city, she became a retail consultant for Oriflame, a Swedish direct-sales cosmetic company. From the start, she has been quite successful as a saleswoman and received an honor of "Golden Associate."

Today, she teaches prospective consultants how to sell Oriflame products. She has subscribed 1,500 consultants under her license (her earnings are based on the number of consultant subscriptions.) In the future, she hopes to have her own beauty salon and to invest in her children's higher education. She has requested a loan to buy a computer, a projector and some furniture to equip her teaching room.

loans.use: To buy a computer, a projector and some furniture

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 56 years old and married with 4 children. She sells medicine in retail to her customers. She started this business in 2006. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Sokyoeurn Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of 19 members, is located in Chhea Teal village in the Kandal province. They plan to use the loan they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Sokyoeurn C. has been selected by the members to be the village bank president. She sells fish and is also a pig breeder. Since her pig-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets to breed to earn more income.

Her husband, Mr. Deap Saret, is a musician who is hired by people to play during wedding ceremonies, parties and so on. Mrs. Sokyoeurn C. is a 29-year-old mother of two children who are too yoU. to work or study. Mrs. S. Vannak, who is a group guarantee, is also presented in the picture with the village bank members.

Seven members in this group loans are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for breeding

loans.name: Ngu Thi

texts.en:
T. Ngu Thi is thirty-four years old and lives in the town of Hung Nguyen.  She is married and has three school-age children.  To make a living, T. owns and operates a specialized retail store.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling liquor such as beer and wine in the local community.  T. has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately $170 a month from these activities.


In 1998, Thìn joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by giving her the ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to invest in expanding the business.  T. is now requesting a new loan that will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be her eleventh loan from TYM Fund.  T. plans to improve her business with the additional revenue the loan generates.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell.

loans.name: Saidjon

texts.en:
In the previous year’s growing season, Saidjon was diligent with his fertilizer- and pesticide-selling venture. In the season mentioned, Saidjon made adequate income, which was used to improve his home and saved for his children’s education expenses. While diligently selling fertilizer that season, his land sat uncompleted and derelict. The current rainy season is a suitable time for planting. Saidjon is taking the initiative to resume working on his land while selling fertilizer. He has requested funds to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer. Saidjon is optimistic his venture will be successful and all his expended effort will better the family’s welfare.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Vera

texts.en: Vera A. sells provisions and beef. She is married with five children and she is 58 years old. She hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more provisions and beef to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and beef to sell

loans.name: Lun

texts.en:
Mrs. Lun K., age 47, is a widow with two sons and two daughters (she shown in the picture with her daughter). One daughter is married, but lives inside the family house. The other daughter weaves silk at home. One of Lun’s sons is a horse cart driver. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Lun has been a silk weaver for 4 years; it’s a skill she learned from her neighbor. Besides weaving, she is also a farmer. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Lun is requesting a loan of 1,000USD to purchase silk material for her weaving business and to repair the horse cart for her son.

loans.use: Purchase of silk for weaving and repairs to horse cart.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 53 years old and married with seven children who are in school. He lives in Ibadan. Peter is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more stationery to sell. He sends his thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery to sell

loans.name: Bulubandi East Lutabigi Sarah Group

texts.en:
L. Sarah, age 28, is the owner of a salon since the year 2004. She is a married business lady, blessed with two children and looking after six dependents who are all in school. She is requesting a loan to purchase salon items such as hair chemicals, hair treatments, conditioners and equipment like rollers, combs and so forth to provide quality services to her customers.

L. Sarah represents her group. She is an inspiring business lady whose dream is to purchase a plot of land and construct a house.

loans.use: To purchase salon items

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is a pig grower. She has a barn closeby in her house and raises 5 pigs for fattening. She likes her job being a businesswoman. She said, she very much attaracted to pigs that is why it bemae her business.

Availing CEVi loan is truly helpful for her to sustain her livelihood. The loan will go far in buying another piglets and feed.

She hopes that she will be successful always in her endeavor. She likes to partner CEVI because they are giving small interest rate of 2% a month plus insurance ocverage.

loans.use: piglets and feed

loans.name: Idowu

texts.en:
Idowu sells drinks to her retail customers. She has been selling drinks for over ten years. She hopes for a loan in the amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira (NGN) to purchase more crates of drinks to sell.

Idowu is 44 years old and married with three children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell to retail customers.

loans.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Mrs. Vanna N. is a villager in Kdey Tahok village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectare (1.25-acre) field on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this, she is a pig breeder.

Since her pig business is going well, Mrs. Vanna N. wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets. The rest of the loan she will use to buy pig food to feed them.

Mrs. Vanna N. is 63 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a driver who is able to make a small income to support the family, while the younger one stays at home to help with the pigs.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Roy

texts.en: 45 year old farmer Roy I. has a rice farming business in Norala, South Cotabato.  He owns a one and a half hectare rice field.  He joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. and is thankful for the services it offers.  He would like to request a loan of Php 15,000 as financial assistance to his farm business.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Senior Quarters 1 Acen Suzan Group

texts.en: Suzan A., a 39-year-old business lady, is a married mother of five children, all attending school, and also looks after two other dependents. She has operated a retail shop for the past five years, and is requesting a loan to purchase essentials including soap, sugar, salt, match boxes, and cooking oil in order to expand the business. Suzan is a hardworking lady whose dream is to obtain a piece of land in the town of Lira and construct a commercial house.

loans.use: To purchase for her business soap, sugar, salt, match boxes, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Lemalie

texts.en:
Lemalie V. is a 39-year-old woman living in the town of Seesee. She is married and has five school-aged children.

Lemalie owns and operates a business making and selling food, selling dried goods in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over three years and earns approximately 400 WST a month.

Lemalie joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Lemalie is now requesting a new loan of 1,750 WST which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth C.'s main source of income comes from preparing longganisa (pork sausages) to sell in her community. She is 43 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Northern Pob., Calamba, Misamis Occidental. Elizabeth has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for making longganisa. This will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for longganisa making

loans.name: Leh We Try Group

texts.en:
Bintu K. on the left in the photo above is the leader of this group. This group of borrowers named their group 'Leh We Try', a Krio phrase meaning 'Let Us Try'. They are residing and doing business in Waterloo, a small town. They have come to SMT, a partner of 'Shine on Sierra Leone' in Waterloo to apply for a loan of SLL 2,400,000 (or SLL 800,000 each). With this loan, the group of borrowers will buy more goods to expand their businesses.

The leader of the group, Bintu, was born in Freetown and is married to a professional worker and they have one child who is in class four. Bintu sells market food – peppers, onions, Maggi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil), etc. Bintu also owns a kiosk where she sells cigarettes, soft drinks, sardines, and many other items. The twenty-seven-year-old has been running this business for almost ten years now. With her share of this loan, she will buy cartons of sardines, Peak milk, and gallons of palm-oil.

loans.use: Buy cartons of sardines, Peak milk, and gallons of palm-oil to sell

loans.name: Dulambayar

texts.en: Dulambayar is 43 years old and lives with her husband and three sons in Khovd province, Mongolia. Her husband is handicapped. All of her three sons (aged 7, 13, and 17), attend a local secondary school. Dulambayar operates a grocery and vegetable trading business in her town. She grows all the vegetables that she sells at her booth.  Dulambayar started her business in 1994 by planting variety of vegetables and has built a stable operation over the years. She is a very hardworking businesswoman and is focused on the future. Her business has provided her family with financial stablilty and has enabled her to improve her quality of life. Dulambayar has many plans for the future and says, "With continued success, I hope to buy more fields to plant my vegetables." She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more products to sell in her business.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of food products.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en: Marian is 52 years old, married, and the mother of six children. Three of her children are in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, skimmed powdered milk, biscuits, etc. in her neighborhood. She has twenty years experience in retail selling. It has been her dream to expand by adding new foodstuffs that are frequently demanded by her customers. With the loan, she wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits and foodstuffs such as tomatoes, smoked fish, dried fish, onions, spices, groundnuts, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.es:
Rosalía, de 31 años, tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Vive en su casa propia en compañía de su madre y sus dos hijos; Steven (6) y Dayana (5).
Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca; al principio trabajaba ayudando en esta labor a una amiga, pero después de un tiempo empezó a hacerlo de manera independiente y se ha dado cuenta que así obtiene mayores ganancias, además puede comprar promociones y venderlas a mayor precio.
Por otro lado, tiene un puesto de golosinas que es atendido por su madre y ella lo hace los fines de semana cuando hay mayor demanda, obtiene buenas ganancias invirtiendo poco dinero. Rosalía cree que si sigue así, en el futuro podrá concretar su sueño de instalar una tienda donde pueda ofrecer sus golosinas, sus productos de belleza y otros productos.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está segura que cumplirá puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas porque quiere seguir accediendo a otros préstamos, tampoco quiere quedar mal con sus compañeros de grupo, quienes le han brindado confianza. Rosalía tiene pensado invertir el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de mercadería para su puesto de golosinas, también adquirirá algunos productos de belleza que tendrá en stock para atender el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosalía, age 31, has a strong desire to progress. She lives in her own home along with her mother and her two children: Steven (6) and Dayana (5). For the last two years she has sold beauty products for a well-known brand. She began this work by helping a friend, but after a while she began to work independently and realized that she could make a better income that way. Also she could buy promotional products an sell them at a higher price. At the same time, she has a small candy shop that her mother tends to, and she herself comes on the weekends when demands is highest. She earns a good sum and invests a little of the money. Rosalía believes that if she continues in this way, she will be able to make her future dream of opening a store where she can sell candy, beauty supplies, and other products come true. This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is sure that she can make her payments on time because she wants to be able to have access to other loans. Nor does she want to fall out of favor with the other members of her group, those who have shown confidence in her. Rosalía has planned to invest the money that she is requesting in buying merchandise for her candy stand. She will also obtain more beauty supplies to have in stock so she can fulfill her clients' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase in merchandise

loans.name: Melita's Group

texts.en:
Melita R. is from the village of Babanuang. She is 38 years old. Melita is the leader of a 4-member loan group sponsored by ASKI. Although each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Melita R.'s Group.

Melita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns and operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. Melita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Melita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Melita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her inventory. This will be Melita's seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to sell

loans.name: Queen

texts.en:
Queen is 40 years old, married and has three children. She owns a pig farm. She works very hard to make sure her farm is productive and she believes that hard work pays. She buys piglets and rears them for sale. She has been in this business for some years. With the proceeds from her pig farm, she can save and assist her husband in providing the family's needs in the areas of feeding, clothing and more.

Queen hopes to improve her pig farm by expanding the size of the farm and purchasing more piglets for her farm. 
She is requesting a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more piglets for her farm. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets for her farm.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: Mr. Uk P., 41, is married to Sek Trop, 40, and they have five children. One of them is married and the others are single. His wife stays at home to raise a few pigs to generate a small income for the family. Uk P. has been learning the skill of building wooden houses since he was single and he has been using his knowledge to earn a living. Additionally, the family takes time to farm rice when the farming season comes. To earn more income, Uk P. is taking his first loan to buy fertilizers and rice seeds to better grow his crop.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds to better grow his crop

loans.name: Giorgina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúnen en la ciudad de Montecristi en la Provincia de Manabí, esta ciudad es de clima templado, es aquí donde se realizan los mas finos acabados de artesanía en paja toquilla y tagua, sus habitantes viven de este trabajo y son reconocidos a nivel mundial.

La señora Georgina es una habitante de esta bella ciudad, y desde hace 37 ciclos  forma parte de la Fundación, esta casada tiene 4 hijos, el esposo es empleado publico, y ella en sus ratos libres del hogar se convierte en comerciante informal de ropa, con los créditos que ha venido recibiendo de la Fundación ha ido invirtiendo en sus negocio y ha logrado incrementarlo de una manera bastante rentable que en los actuales momentos se siente muy bien con las ganancias obtenidas, para poder surtir el negocio ella tiene que viajara hasta la ciudad de Manta a comprar a los distribuidores ropa tales como interiores, blusas, pantalones y todo lo que el cliente pida.

La señora Georgina invertirá  todo el crédito en surtir sus negocio tiene varios pedidos por entregar en este mes, la manera que ella entrega es visitando a los clientes en sus casas dejándoles a créditos con el plazo de quince días para reunir el dinero y una vez que reúne el capital y las ganancias viaja a comprar mas mercadería. Cuenta nuestra socia que su mayor sueño es poder agrandar su negocio y seguir trabajando con la Fundación.
texts.en:
The “Camino al Progreso” (Road to Progress) communal bank meets in Montecristi, Manabí province. This city’s weather is mild and it is here where the finest straw and tagua nut handicrafts are made; its residents support themselves with this kind of work and are known worldwide. Georgina is a resident of this beautiful city. For the past 37 loan cycles she has been part of the foundation. She’s married and has 4 children. Her husband is a public employee. During her free time from household chores she is an informal clothing merchant. She has invested the foundation’s loans in her business and has managed to make it quite profitable; she is happy with her current earnings. To stock her business, she must travel to the city of Manta to buy clothing like underwear, blouses, pants and everything else her customers request, from wholesalers. Georgina will use the entire loan to stock her business. She has several pending orders to fill this month. She visits her customers door-to-door and leaves their items with them granting them a two-week period of time to save up to repay her. With her profits, she travels again to get more merchandise. She tells us that her greatest dream is to enlarge her business and to continue collaborating with the foundation.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy underwear, blouses, pants, etc.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en: Sun S., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Sa ang District, Cambodia, an area known for sugarcane plantations. She sells fish for an income of about $4 US per day. Her husband is motorcycle repairman and hired to dig wells, earning an income of $5 US per day to help cover the family expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of $600 US to buy more fish for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to send the children to a good school.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy fish for resale

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Sreng P., 33, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known as the most populated city in the country. She sells pork and vegetables at a local market for an income of about USD 4.7 per day. Her husband works as a teacher, and earns an income of USD 3.2 per day, to help cover the family expenses.  Sreng is requesting a loan of USD 500 to buy more vegetable and meat to stock her stand. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy vegetable and meat to stock her stand at the market

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh T. D. was born in 1977.  She works in a lock company but also she sells telephones and handphones. Her husband is a driver. She has twin girls. They have a monthly income of about 6,000,000 VND. She has participated with Kiva partner SEDA since 2009 and always repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 5,450,000 VND to expand her handphone shop.

loans.use: To expand her handphone shop.

loans.name: Aureliano

texts.es:
Don Aureliano  tiene 55 años de edad está casado hace mas de 29 años con la Sra. Lucila Matto  de 47 años de edad, tienen juntos 4 hijos todo mayores  de edad.  

	El señor Aureliano es hijo de un agricultor creció en una de la compañía de Carapeguá (Espartillar) trabajó en el campo con su padre, a los 26 años de edad se casó con Sra. Lucila quien es hija de una tejedora y  empezaron a trabajar juntos, hoy en día   hace mas 20  años que se dedica a  la venta de la tradicional sobrecamas y hamacas que lo lleva a vender por la zona de Itapúa y ciudad del Este con una  clientela bien  formada, incluso su señora quién es artesana le teje las frazadas y así le sale más económico. Gracias a este trabajo y al esfuerzo de los ambos  pudieron contar con casa propia  y también comprarse una  camioneta la que utiliza para repartir sus mercaderías  y a la vez  brindar a su familia una mejor nivel de  vida . 

	Solicita el préstamo para la compra de hilos de varios tipos  y colorantes, y telas que son materiales que utilizan para la fabricación de sabrecamas.
texts.en:
Aureliano is 55 years old and has been married for over 29 years to Lucila Matto who is 47 years old. Between them, they have four adult children. Aureliano is the son of farmer, raised in the countryside where his father worked for a company in Espartillar de Carapeguá in Paraguay. At the age of 26, he married Lucila, daughter of a weaver and they began to work together. For over 20 years, he has been selling traditional bedspreads and hammocks in the Itapúa area and the eastern part of the city establishing clientele. His wife’s craft in knitting blankets works out more economically. Thanks to this work and both of their efforts they were able to have their own home and also purchase a truck which they use to distribute their goods and offer their family a better life. He is requesting this loan in order to buy various types of thread in many colors and fabrics which are the materials they use to make bedspreads.

Translated from Spanish by Susanna Sabahi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials like various types and colors of thread, fabrics and more.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with three children, two of her children go to school, while the third is too young. She also takes care of additional family members. Rose owns a stall in Ndeeba market selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of charcoal. Rose buys bags of charcoal from the very place she works, so doesn’t incur any transport costs. She has been in this charcoal business for seven years. Her customers consist of market vendors and nearby families and she sells both on the retail and wholesale markets. As well as her charcoal business, Rose is also a part time teacher at the nearby school. Her business challenges includes seasonality and thieves. She aspires to open another stall in the same market. She decided to work with MCDT because she wanted additional capital. Rose resides in and rents a two-room house and her family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include food, rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion T. is from the town of Centro Norte, Alcala, Cagayan. She is 47 years old and is married with one infant child. Visitacion owns and operates a general store, selling children's products such as toys and games in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. Visitacion joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Alphe

texts.en:
Alphe B. is from the village of Bagong Silang in Misamis Oriental. He is 30 years old and married with 1 infant child. To make a living, Alphe runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Alphe has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

Alphe has recently joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alphe is requesting his first loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell in his shop.

location.town: Bagong Silang, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Luong's Group

texts.en:
Luong T. H. D. is 37 years old and lives in Ngoc Loi hamlet, Duc Tu commune. She is married with two children and her husband is a carpenter. Her family has a carpentry workshop and she and her husband work there producing wooden furniture. They have a monthly income of about 4,500,000 VND.

Mrs Luong is the leader of this five-member group loan from SEDA. For her previous loan, she borrowed 4,578,000 VND and has repaid this amount completely and punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,066,000 VND in order to buy more wood.

About the other borrowers in the group:

Van T. T. is 57 years old and would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND in order to buy wood.

Duyen T. D. is 31 years old and would like to borrow 5,886,000 VND in order to expand her carpentry workshop.

Mai T. N. is 27 years old and has a store. She would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to expand her store.

Bich T. L. is 46 years old and sells pork in the market. She would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND for her business.

loans.use: To buy more wood to make more furniture

loans.name: Wennie

texts.en:
Mrs. Wennie T. is from the barangay of Bagumbang, a part of Bonifacio municipality in Misamis Occidental province on the northern Mindanao islands. She is 40 years of age and married to Sanny T. who is a driver. She is blessed with three children of whom one is already an adult while the other two are still school age. She is presently engaged in wholesaling and retailing fresh eggs. She’s been in this business for ten years and earns approximately 2,400 PHP a month.

In 2009 Wennie joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Wennie is an active member of PMPC under the Regular Loan program and has successfully repaid a 15,000 PHP loan. She is requesting a second loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use all revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family especially in meeting their basic needs and for savings, loan repayments, insurance, her children’s education and possible business expansion.

loans.use: For capital for fresh egg wholesaling and retailing business

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe J. is a 37-year old married woman who supports her family by owning and operating a food vending business. She lives in Prk. Kalubihan, Brgy. Libertad, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. Ma. Fe has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her food vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 3000. Ma. Fe is now borrowing PHP 11000 so that she could have a larger working capital, which will enable her to buy more foodstuffs to sell. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 11000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Fe aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Francisco José

texts.es: El Sr. Francisco José V. G.   él  se dedica a la agricultura de granos, tiene diecisiete años de dedicarse a esta actividad es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  cinco  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales para preparar el terreno para ayudarse en su siembra, y aumentar los rendimientos en sus cultivos de ajonjolí para obtener mejores ingresos que mejoren el nivel de vida.
texts.en: Mr. Francisco José V. G. is a grain farmer. He has practiced this activty for sixteen years. He is married. He has had five loans with  CEPRODEL and has taken them out to buy materials to prepare the land to help in the landing and increase the yields for his sesame crops to obtain better income ad improve his quality of life.

loans.use: To buy planting materials such as: urea, complete fertilizer, sesame seed, tractoring the land, etc.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly T. L. is 47 years old with three children, one of whom is attending at high school. Ly is a farmer who grows many kinds of flowers for retail saL.. Her business is very good and she can earn a monthly profit of 3,000,000 VND. Ly has been participating with SEDA credit group since 2004 and has a sound record. 

Ly is requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy seed and fertilizer to prepare for next season.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Silvia Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Silvia Del Rosario C. C. se dedica a trabajar como obrera de campo y también tiene su mototaxi propia la cual la maneja su esposo, ellos viven en casa propia tienen dos hijas menores como carga familiar.La solicitante cuenta con buenas referencias acriditicias por que sus artefactos los adquirido alcontado y actualmente no tiene deuda  y en otras entidades a pagado bien por tal mótivo se propone otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en: Mrs. Del Rosario C. C. works as a field worker and she also has a mototaxi (three wheeled motorized vehicle) which is driven by her husband. They live in their own home and they have two underage daughters who they take care of. The member has good credit references since what she owns she has paid in full. At this time she has no debt and in other organizations she has paid all of her debts, it is for this reason that she is to be given the loan.

loans.use: Work Capital.

loans.name: Ralph

texts.en:
Ralph S. is from the village of Lapasan Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old. Ralph is married. To make a living, Ralph owns & operates a business providing motor transport services. Ralph has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ralph joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Ralph has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. He is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service.
