This will be the third loan taken out by Ralph from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair an existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.en:
Andrea J. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Andrea is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Andrea owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and junk food in the local community. She is also engaging in a mini-restaurant serving different kinds of viands (cooked meats). Andrea has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Andrea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Andrea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Andrea is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Andrea from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick A. is 26 years old and married to Shirley.  They have one child who is six months old. They live in Katito.

Fredrick has a retail shop that he has been running for the past four years.  He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the first loan well and on time.  He intends to use the money to buy shop products like sugar, soap, bread, etc.  This business earns him a  monthly income of Kshs.10,000.

His desire is to expand his business and improve the family’s living standard.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as soap, bread and sugar to stock his retail shop.

loans.name: Abra Laure

texts.fr: Laure  a 25 ans.  Elle gère comme activité   génératrice de revenus, la vente des mèches.  Elle exerce cette activité il y a de cela 5 ans et  s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé en gros. Elle redistribue en détail.   Elle sollicite un crédit pour acheter 250 paquets de mèches.
texts.en: Laure is 25 years old. She has an income-generating activity selling hair extensions and has been carrying out this activity for the past five years. She gets her supplies wholesale at the large market in Lomé and then retails them.  She is requesting a loan to buy 250 packets of hair extensions.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua E. is married and has 3 children. She has no formal education. Ekua has been selling smoked fish in Abrafo, near Abura, for 7 years. Ekua's husband is a farmer. Together with her husband, Ekua is responsible for paying for her children's school fees and books.

Ekua's loan will be used to buy more fish. She would also like to start selling charcoal. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to further expand it by reinvesting part of the profit. She will repay her loan with some of the money and use the rest of it to take care of her children.

loans.use: increasing her stock of fish and charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more gallons of palm oil and caustic products used in the production of soap

loans.name: Monaliza

texts.en:
Monaliza is a married woman who lives in Toledo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   soft drinks dealer, cosmetics products and transport businesses. Her husband Bamberto, who is 37 years old, works as a driver to earn his living .  They have three children who are between 12 to 14 years old. Monaliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past 11 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Monaliza has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 25000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 12th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, with which she intends to buy stock of soft drinks and cosmetics to sell so that she can continue to save up for the education of her children. Monaliza is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more cases of soft drinks and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en:
Joselyne is a 32-year-old mother of four children between 1 and 12 years old, three of whom go to school. Joselyne has owned a small store selling potatoes and bananas for 13 years, and it has allowed her to buy her own house. Her husband is also a vendor.

Joselyne will use her loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables to sell. With any profits she makes from the use of the loan, she plans to make enhancements to her business.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Francisca Candelaria

texts.es: La Señora Francisca tiene 55 años, Vive en municipio de Nagarote, se dedica a la venta de comida, en su casa de habitación en donde la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a saborear los diferentes platillos que elabora.  Uno de sus mayores desafíos es el tiempo pues a pesar de que se levanta temprano tiene que realizar los quehaceres de su hogar, las compras, cocinar entre otras cosas. El destino del crédito es para aumentar los insumos de su negocio ya que necesita granos básicos, bolsas, platos, cubiertos, servilletas, refrescos, para la elaboración de sus platillos, es una persona muy trabajadora y su deseo es seguir trabajando mientras tenga salud.
texts.en: Francisca is 55 years old.  She lives in the town of Nagarote and her business is selling meals in her home where her customers come to savor the different dishes that she makes.  One of Francisca's main challenges is time since, in spite of the fact that she gets up early, she has to do her housework, do the shopping, cook and do other things besides.  She will use her loan to increase her supplies since she needs basic grains, bags, plates, cutlery, napkins and soft drinks for her business.  She is a very hard-working person and her wish is to continue working while she still enjoys good health.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bags, plates, cutlery, napkins and soft drinks

loans.name: Oyunjargal

texts.en:
Oyunjargal, a 29-year-old widow, lives with her two daughters in a rented one-bedroom studio in Erdenet, the second biggest city in Mongolia. Her oldest daughter, Uranchimeg, attends a local secondary school, while her youngest daughter, Tselmeg, stays at home.

Oyunjargal used to be a teacher at “Urlakh Erdem” university, the famous Mongolian fashion design school from which she graduated. Then she started her own tailoring business in 2006, employing a friend who studied in university with her. Oyunjargal now rents a stall at ”Danista” market, the crowded city market. Her dream is to buy her own apartment and to give her children a proper education and good morals. This will be her first loan, with which she intends to purchase a sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Tania Gladys

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; Este banco está ubicado en el poblado de Oropesa,  provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Tania; es  casada, la socia tiene 53 años de edad; la socia tiene 2 hijos de (24, 21) años de edad, la socia  alterna sus actividades del hogar con la administración y elaboración de panes, la socia casi al igual que todas sus compañeras miembros del banco comunal se dedican a la elaboración de panes, la socia compra insumos para la panadería y desea el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Tania, age 53, is married and has two children (ages 24 and 21). She is a member of the communal bank “VIRGEN ESTRELLA DE OROPESA”; the bank is located in the Oropesa settlement of the Quispicanchis province which is part of the department of Cusco.

Tania divides her time between her household work and baking bread; almost all of her fellow communal bank members are in the bread baking business. Tania is seeking a loan to purchase supplies for a bakery. She is very grateful for the loan and is committed to repaying it a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for a bakery

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. is 55 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has six children, none of whom are currently in school. Jane has a small retail shop business, which she has run for ten years.
To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, such as soap, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, such as soap, for resale.

loans.name: Zumratbi

texts.ru: Зумратби проживает в районе Восе. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет одного ребенка. Образование-среднее. Занимается торговлей на рынке района. Она занимается продажей женской одежды. В основном она продает национальные платья, штаны, платки, и ткани. Кредит берет для покупки тканей и новых видов национальных платьев.
texts.en: Zumratbi lives in Vose. She is 43 years old, married, and has one child. She has a high school education.  She trades in the local market. She sells women’s clothing.  Primarily she sells traditional dresses, trousers, scarves, and fabrics. She is taking out a loan to buy fabrics and new styles of traditional dresses.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and new styles of traditional dresses.

loans.name: Yelba Mercedes

texts.es:
Yelba se graduará de la carrera de Química y Farmacia en 4 meses y solicitá el crédito para finalizar sus estudios universitarios.

En algún tiempo Yelba se vé con un buen trabajo ya sea como visitador médico y pudiéndole brindar a su hijo una educación mejor. La inspiran sus hijos, su hija es ya profesional y le gustaría apoyar a su hijo para que también pueda terminar la universidad. 

"Soy una persona honesta, responsable, un embarazo a temprana edad me dificultó continuar con mis estudios secundarios y ahora estoy tratando de culminar mis estudios universitarios"
texts.en:
Yelba will graduate with a degree in Chemistry and Pharmacy in 4 months and is requesting a loan to finish her university studies.  

In time Yelba will have a good job as a medical representative and will be able to give her son a better education. Her children inspire her.  Her daughter is already a professional and would like to support her son so that she can also finish her university studies.   

"I am an honest, responsible person.  A pregnancy at a young age made it difficult for me to continue with my secondary education and now I am trying to finish my university studies."

loans.use: pay for her certification course for her degree.

loans.name: Orlino

texts.en:
Orlino is 41 years old and married with three school-aged children. His wife is a housekeeper. 

Orlino is a farmer working in the Philippines. He engages in growing a large crop of rice and has been doing it for 21 years. 

Orlino is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to purchase fertilizers such as manure and seeds of rice to be planted in his two hectares of farmland. 

He wants to maintain his business and dreams of expanding his farm to gain income for the future of his family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to be planted in his two hectares of farmland and fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Maria Maricela

texts.en: Maria lives in the town of El Paraiso in southern Honduras, where she has run a small beauty salon for the past six years. Her shop enjoys steady business due to its central location in the town center. Maria is requesting a loan of 20,000 Honduran lempira (HNL) to purchase supplies such as shampoos, conditioners, and dyes for her salon. This will be her second loan with Prisma, and she had a punctual payment record over the course of her first loan.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, conditioner, lotions, styling products, and hair dyes

loans.name: Robinson

texts.en:
Robinson is a 40-year-old married father of five children. He runs a retail kiosk in Mtwapa, Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last two years. 

He has been a KADET client and this marks his third borrowing to finance his business. With this loan he plans to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour to sell. 

The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan and to educate his children. His dream is to open another branch in future and to give his family a good life.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice and flour to sell

loans.name: Patricia Carolina

texts.es:
Patricia, vive con su familia, sus padres y tres hermanos, es madre soltera de un hijo de 3 años de edad, sus padres la apoyan mucho y ella se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón, de este negocio logra mantener los gastos de su hijo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de semillas de marañón, pues son su fuente de ingreso y quiere tener mayor disponibilidad para poder salir a ofrecer a los clientes.
Su objetivo con el préstamo es fortalecer su negocio, también continuar generando ingresos para las necesidades personales y de su hijo, con la esperanza de mejorar cada día y ver crecer a su hijo sin limitaciones.
texts.en:
Patricia lives with her family - her parents and her 3 brothers. She is a single mother to a 3 year old and her parents help her out a lot. She sells cashews, which allows her to take care of her son.

She is asking for a loan to buy cashew seeds, as this is her source of income and she wants to have more available in order to be able to offer them to her customers.

Her goal with this loan is to strengthen her business and to continue generating income for her and her son's personal needs. She hopes to improve every day and to watch her son grow up without limitations.

loans.use: to buy cashew seeds.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El Señor Luis es de Ciudad del Este, está casado y tiene dos hijos, uno en edad escolar. Él se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Gracias a este trabajo y a la valiosa ayuda de su esposa, ellos pueden salir adelante.
Él se considera una persona honesta, trabajadora y muy responsable a la hora de cumplir con sus obligaciones. Comenta que todo lo que hace es por el bien de su familia, ya que desea brindarles todo lo mejor. Su sueño es tener un local donde pueda ofrecer sus productos. Además de todo comenta que su trabajo es muy minucioso ya que lleva tiempo y dedicación cuidar las hortalizas y frutas y luego venderlas. Gracias a su trabajo ha logrado formarse una buena clientela que siempre compran de el sus productos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de más frutas y verduras que le servirá para abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le brinda, ya que de obtener el crédito le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor Luis is from Ciudad del Este.  He is married and has two children, one who is school-aged.  He makes his living selling fruits and vegetables.  Thanks to this work and valuable help from his wife, the family is able to get ahead.
Señor Luis considers himself to be an honest and hard-working person who is very responsible when it comes time to meet his obligations.  He says that everything he does is for the good of his family, since he wants to offer them the best of everything.  His dream is to have a small store in which to sell his products.  In addition, he says that he very meticulous in his work, since he has been been dedicated to taking care of produce and fruit for re-sale for a long time.  Thanks to his work, he has been able to develop a good clientele that always purchases their produce from him.
Señor Luis is requesting the loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables, which will help him to supply his business and meet his customers demands.  He is grateful to the Fundación for the opportunity they are offering him, since getting the loan will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for re-sale.

loans.name: Wiguna Merta Group

texts.en:
The Wiguna Merta group is made up of nine women who are neighbors in the same village in Melaya, West Bali.  The group is seeking a loan of Rp 13,500,000 and each member will receive Rp 1,500,000. The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement the family income and out of their interest in education on best practices for pig raising. This is their third loan with MUK.

Ni Ketut, age 40, is the head of the Wiguna Merta group. She is married and has children who are still in school. Her husband earns money as a farmer, but Ni Ketut would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She will use the loan to buy six local species piglets. She plans to sell the piglets after three months for use as pig roll.  With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: To buy six local species piglets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for weaving

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with four children between 12 and 25 years old. She and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice and vegetables to sell. Elizabeth also raises pigs to help augment their income.

Elizabeth requested this loan to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Virgen del Pilar se conformó en fecha en el año 2008, con mucho esfuerzo ya  se encuentran en el octavo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa. Además del trabajo independiente D. cada una, también desarrollan actividades en forma conjunta  para recaudar fondos con el fin D. contar con un capital dentro del grupo, a la vez se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos que es la D. trabajar para apoyar económicamente a sus familias en especial.
La D. la Sr. Flavia se dedica a la venta D. comidas D. toda variedad, nos comenta que mediante su trabajo  pudo mejorar bastante su actividad y su nivel D. vida e ingreso económico. Dice que D. a poco y gracias a su esfuerzo y con la ayuda D. su marido ella ha podido crecer en su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. los insumos para la elaboración D. los alimentos que prepara, como ser carne, pollo, condimentos y demás.
texts.en:
This Women’s Committee is named “Virgen del Pilar” and was established in 2008 with great effort. The members are in their eighth loan cycle and have worked together in a united fashion as part of the program. In addition to each of their independent businesses, they also developed fundraising activities in which they have worked together in order to accumulate capital for their group. They help one another so that they can accomplish their objectives, which includes providing financial support for their families.

Sra. Flavia sells all types of food. She says that through her work, she has been able to improve in her activities, her standard of living, and her financial income. Flavia says that thanks to her efforts and with the help of her husband, she has been able to grow her business a little bit at a time. She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for preparing her dishes such as meat, chicken, condiments, and other items.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto de 50 años de edad, vive en su casa propia con su familia, la cual cuentan con servicio de agua y luz, ubicado en el distrito de Nueva Arica que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Esta zona se dedica al comercio, agricultura, ganadería y turismo.

Desde hace varios años, cuenta con su propio negocio que lo a colocado en su mismo domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes todo lo que es productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en general. Cuenta con una clientela establecida, con los ingresos que obtenga podrá solventar sus obligaciones familiares.

Augusto observa que su negocio va creciendo favorablemente. Desea seguir ampliando su negocio con la compra de más mercadería como productos de consumo diario y abarrotes para surtir su tienda.  Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,000 nuevos soles. Augusto es muy trabajador y responsable, desea lograr mayores ingresos para tener un negocio más amplio y bien surtido, con el objetivo que con las ganancias pueda brindarlemejores estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Augusto is 50 years old. He lives in his own home with his family. It has running water and electricity and is located in the district of Nueva Arica, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo. This area's main activities are trade, agriculture, cattle ranching and tourism. 

For several years, he has had his own business located in his home. He offers his customers all types of products of basic necessity and general groceries. He has his established customer base. With the income he receives, he will be able to pay for his family obligations. 

Augusto has seen his business grow. He wants to expand his business by buying more merchandise such as products of daily consumption and groceries to stock his store. To do this he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles. Augusto is very hardworking and responsible. He wants to achieve a higher income to have a bigger and better stocked business, His aim is to offer a better education to his children with his earnings.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as products of daily consumption and groceries to stock his store.

loans.name: Mashurwe 2 Group

texts.fr:
Djuma est un commerçant âgé de 52ans qui habite au Quartier Buyenzi de la Mairie de Bujumbura. Il fait le commerce de restaurant 25ans.C’est un metier qu’il commence quand il était chauffeur. Il n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il est marie à Assa qui est une commerçante de détail pour divers articles ménagers. Ils ont ensemble 6 enfants qui étudient.
 Le crédit Kiva  de 160,000 francs burundais qu’il obtient lui permet d’augmenter son capital pour acheter beaucoup de vivres pour son restaurant afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Il est membre  du groupe  communautaire« MASHURWE 2»
texts.en:
Djuma is a businessman aged 52 who lives in Quartier Buyenzi, Bujumbura. He has had a restaurant for 25 years. This is a business he began when he was a chauffeur. He did not attend school. He is married to Assa who sells various household articles retail. The two of them have six children who are enrolled in school. 

The Kiva loan of 160,000 Burundi francs that he is receiving will permit him to add to his working capital so that he can buy a lot of foodstuffs for his restaurant in order to make a lot of profit. 

He is a member of the community group called "MASHURWE 2".

loans.use: to grow his working capital so he can buy a lot of foodstuffs.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.ru:
Владимир женат.  У него и жены Галины две взрослые дочери.

Владимир занимается фермерством. Он выращивает пшеницу, ячмень и подсолнух. Владимир трудолюбивый и ответственный. Интересный факт, то, что он ветеран афганской войны. Владимир член совета ветеранов-афганцев. И он ставит для себя социальные цели. Например, помочь ветеранам-афганцам, инвалидам-афганцам. 

Владимир просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 15000 гривен на ремонт дома. Он хотел бы отремонтировать половину с дома и сделать отдельный вход для дочери.
texts.en: Vladimir is married.  He and his wife Galina have two adult daughters.  Vladimir is involved in a farming business and grows wheat, barley and sunflowers.  He is a hardworking and responsible person.  An interesting fact about him is that he is a veteran of the Afghan war and is a member of the Afghan-war veterans union.  Thus, he sets socially responsible goals for himself, such as to help Afghan-war veterans and disabled Afghan-war veterans.  Vladimir is requesting a loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia to make repairs to his house.  He wants to repair half of the house and build a separate entrance for his daughter.

loans.use: to make repairs to his house

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana sigue participando en el banco comunal “Las Palmeras” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. Susana nació en la provincia del Quispicanchis y tiene 44 años edad, ella tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos. 

Actualmente, Susana sigue dedicándose a la venta de comestibles en su pequeña tienda que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

Susana requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos azúcar y otras cosas más. 
 
Susana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Susana is still a member of the "Las Palmeras" communal bank from Asociación Arariwa in the town of Cusco. Susana was born in the province of Quispicanchis. She is 44 years old and has a common law marriage from which she has three children.
Currently Susana still sells groceries in the small store located in her home. She has been in this business for many years and it is going very well.
Susana requests the loan in order to purchase goods such as sacks of rice, sacks of sugar and other things.
Susana is thankful for the opportunity she received through this means. She pledges to make the repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: to purchase goods such as sacks of rice and sugar and other things.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Susana has a shop that sells canned goods,snacks and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and breads.

Susana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Susana hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and breads.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina, de 28 años de edad, convive junto a Michel de 27 años viven en una casa alquilada junto a sus 02 hijos; Jhon de 08 y Damaris de 01 año, a quienes estima demasiado y desean un buen futuro. Rosalina, trata de luchar contra las  adversidades del destino y  olvidar la inestabilidad familiar que aqueja su hogar, se caracteriza por ser una mujer con carácter y muy competitiva en el negocio. A pesar de que tuvo percances en el camino, supo sobresalir del mal momento. Hace 12 años que trabaja de forma independiente, es mas agradece a Dios, por darle esa oportunidad. Actualmente tiene un puesto de venta de ropa para todo el público en general, en efecto reconoce que lo esta beneficiando de forma positiva, ya que sus ventas aumentaron con el transcurrir del tiempo. La clave de su éxito, radica en la calidad y el precio de su producto. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de su esposo y su punto de venta lo realiza en su misma localidad. Ella es consciente de que le falta mucho por escalar y por ello que recurre a los préstamos para seguir surgiendo y abastecerse de mercaderías. Con el tiempo piensa en exponer toda variedad de ropa hacia el público, según los gustos y preferencias. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, espera una vez más ser apoyada con el financiamiento para seguir surgiendo, en su banco comunal es una socia colaboradora y muy querida por el resto de  las socias. Con el monto solicitado de 2,000 nuevos soles comprará  mayor cantidad de ropa por lo cual tiene que viajar a la ciudad de lima para adquirir la mercadería a precios módicos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 28 years old and lives with Michel, who is 27, in a rented house with their two children: Jhon who is 8 and Damaris who is 1. She loves them a lot and wants a better future for them. Rosalina is trying to fight against the hardships of her fate and forget the familial instability that afflicts her home. She is a woman of character who is very competitive with her business. Despite some setbacks along the way, she always knew how to get out of trouble.

She has been working independently for 12 years, and is thankful to God for giving her that opportunity. She currently has a stand where she sells clothing to the general public. Overall, she feels this business is having a positive effect on her, as her sales keep increasing with time. The key to her success stems from the quality and price of her products. She normally works alone, but sometimes her husband helps by selling alongside her. She is aware she still has a long way to go, and so she keeps returning to the loans to keep moving forward and to stock her merchandise. In time, she plans to sell all varieties of clothing to her customers, according to their tastes and preferences.

This will be her second loan with MFP. She hopes to once more be supported with the money she needs to keep progressing. At her community bank, she is a collaborative member and very loved among the members. With the requested amount of 2,000 nuevos soles, she will buy more clothing by traveling to the city of Lima to get the merchandise at a reasonable price.

loans.use: buy more clothing in a variety of styles

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer, 37, is a married woman with three children ages 9, 8 and 6.  Her husband owns and manages a vulcanizing shop.

Jennifer owns a sari-sari (convenience) store and has been in business for three years.  She sells items like canned goods, coffee, sugar and school supplies.  Jennifer works hard to improve her business so she can continue to support her family.

Jennifer has requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice and canned goods. Jennifer hopes her business will grow.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
21 mujeres de ciudad de Itá se han unido con el propósito de ayudarse las unas con las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto. Ellas ven una gran oportunidad de progreso con el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya y es por ello que decidieron formar el grupo al que llamaron Virgen de Fátima, quienes se encuentran actualmente en el noveno ciclo del programa.
Concepción es una de las integrantes del grupo, ella nos cuenta que siempre ha trabajo desde muy pequeña y que por eso no teme a ningún tipo de trabajo, ni desafíos. Ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos variados, en lo cual le va muy bien, pues ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, con lo cual podrá cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientas y a la vez ofrecerles mayor variedad.
texts.en:
21 women in the city of Itá have joined together with the aim of helping one another by working jointly. They see a great opportunity for progress in Fundación Paraguaya's  program for women entrepreneurs. This is why they decided to form the group that they called "Vírgen de Fatima," which is currently in its ninth loan cycle under the program. 

Concepción is one of the members of the group. She tells us that she has worked since she was very small, and that's why she's not afraid of any kind of work or challenge. She tells us that she sells assorted cosmetics, and that it's going very well, since she has a well-established clientele. Her goal is to be able to continue growing, and that way continue helping her family. 

She is applying for the loan in order to buy cosmetics, so that she will be able to fill her customers' orders, and at the same time offer them greater variety.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for later sale.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es: Fátima es una empresaria que hace y vende tortilla en su domicilio desde hace 20 años, es una mujer casada, con dos hijos. Tiene dos trabajadores quienes le ayudan en el negocio. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cal, leña bolsas plásticas etc.
texts.en: Fatima is an entrepreneur who makes and sells tortillas out of her home and has done so for 20 years.  She is married and has two children.  She has two employees who help her with her business and will use the money from this loan to buy dried corn, salt, firewood, plastic bags, etc.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Wangninagbe Group

texts.fr: WANGNINAGBE est un groupe  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Honorine, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Honorine est mariée à un certain Isaac. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Honorine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Honorine vend des produits cosmétiques, des bombons et des biscuits depuis sept ans. Honorine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Honorine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAGBE, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques, des cartons de biscuits et de bombons.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la troisième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Omonlayo Julienne (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 38 ans. Omonlayo Julienne a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Omonlayo Julienne est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Yves. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Omonlayo Julienne et son mari. Pour cette raison, Omonlayo Julienne vend de la bouillie de maïs de façon ambulante depuis deux ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Omonlayo Julienne s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Omonlayo Julienne sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENONKPO, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter du maïs, du sucre et du lait.

loans.name: Benoit

texts.en:
Benoit is 37 years old. He is married with 4 children aged between 3 and 13 years. 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 5 years. While his wife is a business woman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of his children and to buy a piece of land.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria owns a small shop where she sells sports apparel and clothes. Luckily her business is located along one of the major streets in the north side of Guayaquil, so there is plenty of traffic that passes by her shop. She originally started out with the help of her sister, and they both work together from 9am until 10pm Monday through Sunday. Maria is asking for this loan so that she can buy a wider selection of shoes, jerseys, and soccer gear. This 39 year-old woman is from Empalme, Ecuador and has one child who is grown up now. She hopes that by taking out a loan from Kiva, she will be able to pay for her son’s school clothes and help him buy a house in a few years. 

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Maria is asking for this loan so that she can buy a wider selection of shoes, jerseys, and soccer gear.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has a shop in the market where he sells plasticware and a variety of other products. He began his business with merchandise his parents provided to help him get established in life. At first he just sold his plastic products door-to-door. But with a lot of effort David obtained a stall at the market where he sells plastic goods for the home. In addition, he sells school supplies and toys for kids. His business also includes a black-and-white photocopy service which he provides with an old machine that he bought second hand. David will use the loan to invest in wholesale school supplies since the new school year will start soon. He will continue to invest in other products to provide a diverse inventory for his customers. He is sure that with these new products his business will grow. David is 28 years old, single and has a son. He depends entirely on his business to support his family. David is sure that this loan will give his family financial security and will allow him to save for his son's education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Julie Lerch

David tiene un local en el mercado donde vende plásticos y todos tipos de articulos varios. El empezó su negocio con mercadería que le facilitaron sus padres para que el pueda salir adelante en su vida. Al principio solo vendía novedades en plásticos puerta a puerta. Pero con mucho esfuerzo David a puesto un local en el mercado local donde vende productos plásticos para el hogar. Ademas el vende materiales escolares y juguetes para niños. Su negocio también consiste de servicio de foto copias en blanco y negro que el ha podido realizar con una maquina vieja que compro de segunda mano. David usara el préstamo para invertir en materiales escolares al por mayor dado a que el año escolar nuevo empieza pronto. El seguirá invirtiendo en otros productos también para tener un diverso inventario para sus clientes. El tiene la seguridad que con estas nuevas variedades su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. David tiene 28 años, esta soltero tiene un hijo. El depende completamente del negocio para apoyar a su familia. David tiene la confianza que este préstamo le dará seguridad económica a su familia y le permitirá ahorrar para la educación de su hijo.

loans.use: Invest in school supplies and other wholesale products

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She is a home-maker and is an educated woman. She wants to help her husband who is a taxi driver. She wants to take a group loan so that her husband can get a new car. If he gets a new one he can work better than now and he can help his family more. He would like to thank his wife and also AFSG for helping him to expand his business and make a good income for their family.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the borrower. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to some people to post a picture of a woman to the Internet. However, the loan is to the female. AFSG only makes loans to women.

loans.use: To get a new car

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro is divorced and has one daughter; they are from Escobedo in Nuevo Leon. Socorro is a very hard-working woman who received a very small annuity and seeing that her income would not be sufficient to cover the needs of her home, fifteen years ago she dedicated herself to the making and selling of food. Thanks to the experience that she has acquired and the good quality of her products she has made her business grow; she has also incorporated the sale of cosmetics and clothing, with which she has succeeded in augmenting her profits.

Now, in order to be able to cover the demands of her customers, she asks for a loan of $750 that she will use on the purchase of merchandise and ingredients necessary to the making of her foods. She promises to repay this amount in six months. Socorro is very grateful for the opportunity you offer her with your support for the improvement and continuing growth of her business.

Translated from spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

Socorro es divorciada y tiene una hija, ellas son originarias de la localidad de Escobedo en Nuevo León. Socorro es una mujer muy trabajadora, recibe una pensión muy baja y al ver que sus ingresos no eran suficientes para las necesidades de su hogar, desde hace 15 años Socorro se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas, gracias a la experiencia que ha adquirido y la buena calidad de sus productos ha hecho crecer su negocio, también ha incorporado la venta de cosméticos y ropa, con lo que ha logrado aumentar sus ganancias.

Ahora para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes solicita un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía e insumos necesarios en la elaboración de sus comidas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Socorro agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas con tu apoyo de mejorar y de continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise and ingredients - Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel has a little garage for vehicle paint jobs. He works with his oldest son who is fourteen years old. His wife is a travelling saleswoman of cosmetics. These are their main incomes, which they use to raise their four children. They live in the town Villa Tunari in the city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to purchase raw materials (paint and putty) to stock his small garage. This is his first loan with IMPRO, but the evaluation that he completed qualifies him to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Daniel tiene su pequeño taller de Chapería y pintado de Vehículos, trabaja con su hijo mayor de 14 años, la esposa es comerciante ambulante de cosméticos; estos son sus ingresos principales con los que cubren la manutención de sus 4 hijos, viven en la zona Villa Tunari de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para comprar materia prima (Pintura, masilla), de esa forma fortalecerá tu pequeño taller.

Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobarle el prestamos.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ahiadéké

texts.fr:
Ahiadéké S. was born in 1947 in Noèpé and is a widow and the mother of six. Being from a large and very poor family, she was not fortunate enough to have much schooling. And so she very early on began working in a modest grocery business going from market to market. Her mother got her started in this, which currently involves going to different inland markets to get different produce (grains, cassava flour, vegetables, tubers, and so forth) that she would then sell back in Lomé, the capitol city. Because of business needs and the persistent demands of her customers, she decided to request a loan of $600. The success of this project will significantly increase her returns, and thus her economic and financial potential, and will scoff triumphantly in the face of her surroundings.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1947 à Noèpé, madame Ahiadéké S. est veuve et mère de six (06) enfants. Issue d’une famille très pauvre et nombreuse, elle n’a pas eu la chance de fréquenter et très tôt a commencé à faire de petit commerce de denrées alimentaires de marché en marché. Initiée par sa mère, elle se rend actuellement sur différents marchés intérieurs et se procure de différentes denrées alimentaires (céréales, farine de manioc, légumes, tubercules et autres) qu’elle vienne vendre sur place à Lomé. Pour les besoins de ses activités et à la demande persistante de ses clients, elle décide de solliciter un crédit de $600. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera sensiblement son rendement et par conséquent son potentiel économique et financier qui raillerons sur son environnement.

loans.use: Commerce in grains, vegetables, and tubers

loans.name: Sokphun

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokphun A. (age 24) married in 2002 and has two children (see photo). She and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. She is requesting this, her second loan with Maxima, to buy materials for weaving.

Sokphun learned to weave when she was a teenager over the course of a year in which she traveled to a nearby island in the Mekong. It’s not uncommon in this area for young people to apprentice with experienced weavers. Initially they weave the simplest designs and, as their skills improve, their output is exchanged as fees for instruction. Sokphum has since passed along the craft to a younger sister.

In addition to weaving, Sokphun and her husband also farm rice to feed the family. He also does construction work in the area. She explained that the loan will help her by allowing her to buy weaving materials for cash rather than by barter with a middleperson. If she works with a middleperson, she trades two of every three finished pieces just to pay for the weaving thread. She, in turn, gets the sales price from a single piece. If she pays cash for the thread, the cost is cheaper. If she sells for cash, she can increase her profit by as much as 10% or more per piece. Sokphum smilingly expressed confidence that she could easily repay her loan because, with the quality of her weaving, she can sell all she makes.

loans.use: To purchase thread and other weaving materials

loans.name: Dafrosa

texts.en: Dafrosa, age 33, is married with a 4-year-old child. She also lives with her sister and her kids. Dafrosa has a business of selling traditional alcohol, which she began doing in 2005. She makes about $85 a month, and works from 11am to 7pm daily. She hopes for a loan to increase her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Aida Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. Aida Maria was a housewife before she started selling products at her own convenience store. Her spouse’s earnings were not enough to provide for herself and their two children, and that is why she decided to start her business by setting up a neighborhood store in the city of Leon which is where she resides.

Today Mrs. Aida Maria is very thankful since she has obtained three loans with Ceprodel with have enabled her to increase her working capital as well as help her improve her quality of life thanks to the profits that she gets from her neighborhood store in Leon. Currently she needs to urgently obtain more products so that she can sell them in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Aida Maria, antes de tener su negocio de venta de productos de variedad (pulpería) se desempeñaba como ama de casa. Sin embargo, por ser madre y tener a cargo dos hijos en edad escolar los ingresos que obtenía su cónyuge no eran lo suficiente para la subsistencia de su familia, por lo que decide iniciar su negocio poniendo una pulpería en la ciudad de León que es su localidad.

Hoy en día la Sra. Aida Maria se siente agradecida ya que ha obtenido 3 créditos con Ceprodel y gracias a esto ha logrado incrementar su capital de trabajo además de mejorar su nivel de vida por la ganancia que genera su pulpería en la ciudad de Leon. Actualmente la necesidad que atraviesa es la urgencia de adquirir sus productos para comercializarlos en su negocio.

loans.use: To buy products for her convenience store.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Mrs. Delia, as hard-working as always, is ready to get ahead and make herself useful. She says that she carries youth in her heart everyday, and that's the reason she decided to sell various types of foods seven years ago, particularly her chicken soup. This business makes her happy because she also has the opportunity to try a delicious chicken soup while sharing it with others. Day after day, she gets up at dawn to make, in addition to this tasty dish, the well-known national food cau-cau, and various hot coffees to suit the cold season. She dreams of having a big restaurant where she can prepare and server an immense variety of specials. Her efforts all go toward her dream of sending her children to the university in the city. With this loan, she will purchase more china, spoons, and cooking utensils to improve those that she has and also to improve the facility where she serves her famous chicken soup.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Delia, como siempre tan trabajadora esta presta a seguir adelante y a sentirse útil, la juventud se lleva en el corazón es lo que dice cada día y esta la razón por la que ha decidido vender diversos tipos de comidas, especialmente caldo de gallina hace 7 años, este negocio es de su agrado porque también tiene la oportunidad de probar un suculento caldo de gallina y compartir con los suyos. Día a día se levanta de madrugada para preparar además de este delicioso plato, cau cau plato nacional muy conocido y adicionalmente ofrece cafecitos calientes para esta época de frío.Aspira tener un restaurante grande donde pueda preparar y ofrecer una inmensa variedad de especialidades. Sus esfuerzos tienen el propósito de ayudar a cumplir los sueños de sus hijos que estudian en la universidad de su ciudad.Con el préstamo que obtenga comprará más platos de lozas, cucharas y utensilios de cocina para renovar los que ya tiene y también para mejorar las instalaciones en las que ofrece su conocido caldo de gallina.

loans.use: Purchase cooking utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Bupe

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 30-year-old Bupe M.. She is married and has 3 children aged 1, 5 and 13. In 2001, Bupe established her genge business. Bupe has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan from SELFINA and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

When you see a SELFINA entrepreneur whose business title is ‘restaurant’ or ‘café’, you may have to adjust your mental image of what that is. A local restaurant or café in Tanzania usually consists of a rough wooden table and some long, wooden benches, with the sky as a ceiling. Such places don’t even appear in the Lonely Planet’s budget guide, but if you’re looking for a cheap and tasty meal and someone to have a chat with, this is the place to be. The food is all-local; rice, ugali (a hot, icky dough, made from maize flour), a plantain (a cooked savoury banana), all served with beans, vegetables, meat, and a variety of yummy sauces.

loans.use: To buy more stock in bulk.

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anabel S. is from the sector of Somotillo in the city of Chinandega. She is a very hard-working woman with the goal of providing her two young children the best conditions in which to live. Her business for the past four years has been the sale of materials in her sector, offering her clients the materials that they come to buy.

In order to grow and develop her business, she is currently seeking support from Ceprodel to obtain the credit necessary to buy her materials. She trusts that she will be given credit and will thus be able to succeed with her business and be able to provide for her children, who so depend on her.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La dama Anabel Sánchez es originaria del municipio de Somotillo en la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama muy esforzada en su trabajo con el único fin de brindarles a sus dos pequeños hijitos las mejores condiciones para vivir. Su negocio desde hace cuatro años ha sido la venta de granos básicos en su sector ofreciéndolos a sus clientes que la visitan para realizar sus compras.

En vistas de crecer y desarrollarse en el negocio, hoy en día ha buscado apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de sus granos básicos. Es por este motivo que espera muy confiadamente a que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio beneficiando a sus hijos que tanto necesitan de ella.

loans.use: Purchasing materials

loans.name: Ama Florence

texts.fr:
At 46, Mrs. Ama Florence E., born in Ariva in the plateau region, is married and responsible for 4 children. She is a seamstress and three years ago, she had the brilliant idea to add to her dressmaking business the sale of sewing notions and cellular phone card refills. This differentiates her from the competition and at the same time, she has become their supplier for sewing notions.

She needs this loan to bolster her stock in view of the increasing demand.

/Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

A 46ans, madame E. Ama Florence, née à Ariva dans la région des plateaux, est mariée avec 04 enfants à la charge. Elle est couturière et il y a trois ans de cela, elle a eu l’idée géniale d’associer à son activité, la vente des articles de mercerie et des cartes de recharge pour cellulaire. Ceci la différencie de ses concurrentes et en même temps elle devient leurs fournisseurs en articles de mercerie.

Elle nécessite ce crédit pour renforcer son stock vue que la demande augmente.

loans.use:
Purchase of sewing notions for re-sale

Achat des articles de mercerie

loans.name: Neema

texts.en: Neema has owned a business selling food in Arusha for one year.  She is married with three children, ages 3, 6, and 9.  Every day she works from 6:30am to 10:00pm, which allows her to generate a monthly profit of approximately $150.  Neema is hoping to take out a loan to expand her business and increase her profit.

loans.use: To buy more inventory and expand her business.

loans.name: Phann

texts.en: This is the second time Mrs. Phann K. E. has taken out a loan to improve her business. She is a Khmer Cheese (Prohok) maker in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province. In this business, Mrs. Phann K. E. can earn around $4 per day. Since her business is going well, Mrs. Phann K. E. wants to expand it, so she decided to ask for a loan to buy more small fish to make Prohok to sell. Her husband, Mr. Nheb Tuot, assists his wife in business. Mrs. Phann K. E. is 51 years old and the mother of seven children, four of whom are employed in different business activities while the others are attending school. Her husband is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more small fish to make Prohok (Khmer Cheese) to sell.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Alhaji M. is the leader of Trust, a group consisting of three other members: Aminata K., Aminata M. and Isatu M..  Having repaid their previous loan, they are seeking a new one in the amount of $1100 to improve their businesses and their families’ living standards.

Alhaji M. is 26, and was born in Kabala, Koinadugu District, North of Sierra Leone, but he and his wife, a businesswoman who sells cigarettes, now live in Makeni. For the past five years, Alhaji has owned and operated a kiosk (a telephone-centre) where he makes calls for people, sells top-up cards for all 4 mobile networks, charges mobile phones and sells mobile phone accessories. He also sells drinks and cold water at his kiosk, and with this loan he will increase the volume of drinks he sells. This will certainly generate more income, the profits of which he will reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand their businesses.

loans.name: Oeurng

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurng S. is a villager in Trapaing Krasang Village in Takeo Province, and breeds pigs for a living. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it so is requesting a loan to buy six more piglets. She will use the rest of the loan to buy more pig food. She is a 27-year-old widow with three children, one of whom attends the local school while the others are too young to work or study because they are just one and five years old.

loans.use: To buy six more piglets and more pig food.

loans.name: Khary

texts.fr: Khary  est agée de 39 ans elle est mariée et mere de plusieurs enfants son activité principale est la vente de tissus teintés "thioup" tres prisés par les femmes sénégalaises.les revenus tirés de cette activité qu 'elle meme depuis plus de 4ans lui permet d 'entretenir ses enfants .elle sollicite un pret pour augmenter ses marchandises .
texts.en:
Khary is 39 years old, married, and the mother of several children. Her main business involves selling dyed 'thioup' cloth that is highly prized by Senegalese women. The income derived from this work, which she has been doing for over four years, enables her to care for her children. She is requesting a loan to augment her merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: Afia

texts.en: Afia D. is 34 years old, married, and has five children who are all in school. She is a very hard working and resourceful mother. She sells charcoal and smoked fish in her neighborhood in Obuasi. Charcoal is a very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all traditional Ghanaian homes. Afia obtains her charcoal from the surrounding villages and resells it to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy bulk supply of charcoal and smoked fish to sell to her customers. She hopes to increase her savings so she can pay her children’s educational fees. She belongs to the community group called “Kristo Tease” (Jesus lives) Trust Group. Her picture was taken at a group meeting. In this group, members provide social collateral for one another to guarantee the repayment of loans. She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and smoked fish.

loans.name: 13- Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 13 consists of six poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Luong is the lead borrower of the group. She is 34 years old, married, and has two children, both of whom are at school: a 10 year old son and a 6 year old daughter.

This is Mrs. Luong's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW").  She will use the proceeds from her loan to buy clothes for her market stall.  

She buys women's clothes in the Vuon Hoa market and sells them in the Dong Thanh market. With this loan, she will be able to buy 10 jackets on which she expects to make a 13% profit. She buys jackets for 160,000 VND (~US $9.15) and sells them for 180,000 VND (~US $10.30).  On a good day when the weather is chilly (as it is now), she can sell 5 jackets a day.

Mrs. Luong will use the profits from her loan to pay for her children's school fees and for general household expenditures. 

The loan will be split equally between 6 borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:

* Mrs. Yen is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$93) to buy material that she will use to make and sell women’s clothes.
* Mrs. Chien will buy many kinds of small fish to sell in the Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Bien will buy outfits to rent to others for special occasions (Teacher Day, Army Day, etc.)
* Mrs. Nguyet will buy pork to make lean pork paste and grilled chopped meat to sell in the Dong Thanh market.
* Mrs. Minh Quyet will buy bowls and dishes to sell in the Dong Thanh market.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Aditcha

texts.fr: Dame A. Aditcha,âgée de 45 ans ,est revendeuse de condiments,liqueurs et divers autres articles (piles, conserves, huile rouge et autres).Elle n'a jamais été à l'école  et réside dans un quartier lacustre ,périphérique de Cotonou. Elle a commencé à faire le petit commerce depuis qu'elle est adolescente. Elle a été initiée par sa défunte tutrice. Dame A. Aditcha a sollicité ce 2è prêt pour renforcer son activité et s'approvisionner surtout en liqueurs et sucreries dont les stocks sont totalement épuisés.Originaire de Ganvié, elle est mariée et n'a pas eu la chance d'avoir des enfants.
texts.en:
Ms. Aditcha A., age 45, is a retailer of condiments, liqueurs, and various other goods (batteries, canned foods, red palm oil, and more). She never attended school and resides in a lakeside district on the edge of Cotonou. She started in small-scale commerce as a teenager, being introduced to it by her deceased tutor.

Ms. A. is requesting this second loan to bolster her business and to stock up, especially with liqueurs and soft drinks, which are totally depleted from her inventory. She is from Ganvié, married, and without children, since she has not had the chance.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 2 boxes of liqueurs and 3 cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Mr. M. Abel is 40 years of age. He has been running a small retail shop in Kabwohe for the last four years. He is married to a woman who is a primary school teacher and a hard working mother. The couple has 3 children, whom they take care of very well.

Abel is requesting a loan to purchase sugar, rice, flour, and cooking oil. He dreams of transforming his retail shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đỗ Thị Chỉ, năm nay 35 tuổi ở Mê Linh, Hà Nội. Anh chị có ba con nhỏ và hiện đều đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ từ năm 2002 với hoạt động chính là chăn nuôi, buôn bán rau  và tiền công làm thợ xây của chồng. Hiện tại thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị 5.000.000/tháng. Vòng vốn tới anh chị mong muốn được vay thêm 20.000.000  một phần gia đình chị sử dụng để đầu tư mua bò về nuôi, phần còn lại chị sử dụng đầu tư thêm vốn để buôn bán rau.
texts.en:
Mrs. Do Thi C. is 35 years old, living in Me Linh, Hanoi. She and her husband has three young children who are going to school. She joined TYM Fund in 2002. Her main source of income comes from livestock raising, selling vegetables and her husband's salary as a construction worker. Currently, her average income grosses at 5,000,000 VND per month. She would like to borrow 20,000,000 VND to invest in buying cows and in her vegetable selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Thiennga Ngo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and business

loans.name: Nada

texts.en:
Nada is a 34 year old woman who lives Borj El Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. Nada has been working as an esthetician for eight years. Nada is special in her work because she does it well. Her clients can be anybody from her region.

Nada has been a microcredit client for six years now and has always paid on time. Her previous loans helped her improve her work. When she first started her business, she didn’t face difficulties. She decided on doing her business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. In the future, she plans on improving her work.

Nada has requested a loan of 3,000 U.S. dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for her business.

loans.use: To purchase tools for her business

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо Мамурова 1976 года роджения замужем,  имеет 3 детей.  Она работает учителем математики в средней школе . По совместительству торгует детскими вещами на рынках разных регионах. Она ездит за товаром за пределы страны и по мере возможности отвозит по регионам для продаж. На рынке она почти 11 лет. В Микроинвест обратилась для  расширения ассортимента своего товара.
texts.en:
Marhabo M. was born in 1976, is married with 3 children. She works as a mathematics teacher in middle school. In addition to this she sells children's clothing in various regional market places. Marhabo travels out of the country to get her goods and then travels around the region selling them. She has been doing this for almost 11 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her inventory.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand inventory

loans.name: Akwata Empola Group

texts.en:
Mariam is a 44-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is now 26 and her youngest is just 17. The 17-year-old is still in a private secondary school in the area. Mariam also cares for her late sister's four children.

Mariam has a boutique where she mainly sells dresses and dressmaking materials. She has owned the shop since 1997 and recently branched out into providing other goods like mattresses, suitcases, bed sheets, and decorative home items.

Mariam is requesting a loan of 2 million USH. With this money she will buy 10 mattresses, 4 suitcases, 12 bed sheets, and other needed stock. She says that her loans help her to have the variety of items that her customers demand.

loans.use: To buy 10 mattresses, 4 suitcases, 12 bed sheets, and other stock

loans.name: Kosar Muhammad Awais Group

texts.en:
Kosar Baji is a very hardworking lady. She sells bangles to the community. Her husband, M. A., also helps her in her business. He sells bangles by going to different areas and announcing his products in a loud voice. They have been living in the city of Borewala, Pakistan for the past 10 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. Kosar Baji has been in this business for five years. She is applying for a loan to buy more bangles to expand her business.

Kosar Baji is the leader of a group of six other women from her locality. Raeesa Kanwal Baji and Shamim Akhtar Baji each want a loan to buy sewing machines for their tailoring businesses. Ghafooran Baji wants a loan to buy decorations to sell. Naseeban Baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruits to sell. Abida Hafiz Baji wants a loan to buy stationary (pens, pencils and notebooks) to sell. Naseem Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

This is a group loan. The funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy bangles to sell

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina R. is from the town of Liposong, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. Nina owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Nina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from GDMPC. Nina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pig-feed. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for family needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pig-feed

loans.name: Abdurabi

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Абдураби на закончивший займ смог увеличить свой оборотный капитал по бизнесу купли продажи скота. Сейчас у него два больших быка темно коричнего цвета шведской породы.Скот данной породы очень ценится на рынке.На следующий кредит Абдураби планирует купить ещё пару молодых бычков этой породы.
texts.en:
Abdurabi, upon paying back his loan could increase his working capital for his business buying and selling cattle. He currently has two big dark cinnamon-colored bulls of Swedish breed. Cattle of this breed are highly valued in the market. In his next loan, Abdurabi plans to buy several more young bulls of this breed.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and sale of cattle

loans.name: Suraiyo

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Сурайё 1971 года рождения. Замужем, мать троих детей. Сурайё портниха. Её муж тоже портной. Он занимается пошивом чехлов для машин и покраской кожаных изделий. Сурайё больше года кредитуется нашей организации. У неё в областной больнице города Худжанда есть цех. Она занимается пошивом спец. одежды для медицинского персонал. Также ей заказывают матрасы для коек больницы.Сейчас Сурайё заказали халаты и матрасы, поэтому она намерена досрочно погасить оставшуюся займ. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить ткань для пошива халатов и матрасов.
texts.en:
Suraiyo was born in 1971. She is married and is a mother of three children. Suraiyo is a seamstress. Her husband is a tailor. He makes car seat covers and dyes leather goods. Suraiyo has been our client for over a year. She has a factory at the district hospital in the city of Khujand. She sews uniforms for the hospital personnel. Suraiyo also gets orders to make mattresses for the hospital beds. Suraiyo recently received orders for lab coats and mattresses; thus, she is determined to repay her remaining loan amount early. She wants to use this loan to purchase fabric for sewing the lab coats and mattresses.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

loans.name: Hadji

texts.en:
Hadji P. is from the town of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. He is 28, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Hadji owns & operates a motorcycle transportation service. Hadji has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Hadji joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hadji is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP; this will be his first loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to expand the business

loans.name: Elsa Emerita

texts.es: La señora Elsa Emerita V. Suazo  ella tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad. Ella tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en genera. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  25 años, sin embargo ya tenía 2 años de estar vendiendo de forma ambulante cuando logro establecer  su negocio en el mercado. Ella empezó vendiendo ropa y calzado, y con el tiempo logro vender una mayor cantidad y variedad de vestuario. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos para el colegio de ambos sexos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una pulpería para obtener más ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a member of the Kinanambo borrower group in Kinyanambo, iringa. She is married and a mother of 3 children. Her children are 20,16,11 years old.

Amina has owned a business selling chicken for 12 years, she works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit approximately 200,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Amina`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more Chicken for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Amina hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: T buy more chicken for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a hair dryer, hair extensions, and beauty products

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane G. is a 30-year-old rice farmer from Norala, South Cotabato. She lives with her husband, Joey, and their six children. Their eldest child is 13 years old. Mary Jane manages a 1.5-hectare rice field, and the farm's income meets the family's basic needs.

Mary Jane now needs additional capital for her farming business. She has joined Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI), requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. Provided with proper farm inputs, her farm would have a good and bigger harvest.

loans.use: To finance her farm, e.g. buy farm inputs

loans.name: Sabouratou

texts.fr: Cette dame s’est spécialisée dans la vente de matériaux de construction. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2001 dans le quartier d’Avédjie à Lomé ; elle connaît parfaitement son secteur d’activité, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à la plupart de ses besoins. Elle a loué un local dans lequel elle stocke ses marchandises. Elle a tissé de bonnes relations avec beaucoup de chefs chantiers qui viennent s’approvisionner chez lui. Pour disposer de nouveaux stocks, elle sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 04 WC ainsi que plusieurs autres articles essentiels. Elle n’est pas mariée et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This lady specializes in the sale of construction materials. She began this business in 2001 in the Avédjie area of Lomé; she has mastered this field of business perfectly, which allows her to meet the majority of her needs. She has rented a place in which she stocks her merchandise. She has developed good relations with many construction site managers who come to her to obtain their supplies. To establish new stocks of merchandise, she is currently seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy 4 toilet fixtures as well as several other essential items. She is unmarried and has no children in her care.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy toilet fixtures and various other items for resale

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn B. is a villager in Chan Teab village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder. Since the pig-breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy some piglets for breeding and pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living situation with this loan. Mrs. Lorn B. is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding and pig food.

loans.name: Dus Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Dus Maiya M., a resident of Thecho, lives in a nuclear family with her husband and two children. Her daughter and son are studying in grades 6 and 3, respectively.
