Il désire alors un crédit de $1000 pour louer un atelier, faire l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées et construire des tentes sous lesquelles se réfugier lors des pluies.

loans.use: Rental of shop and buying and selling parts

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Mr. Phun Y. has been married since 2006. He's been a fisherman for a few years, a skill he learned as a young man by watching other men in the village. Besides fishing, he is a construction worker. He started construction work in 2005. After he finishes construction work, he spends his time fishing in the Mekong River and sells his catch in his village.

Phun's wife, Sreycheat, has been weaving for two years but now she has temporarily stopped weaving as she is preparing to give birth.

Phun is requesting a first loan through MAXIMA in the amount of $100. He will use this loan to purchase a new fishing net (US$ 100). Fishing is a profitable business, by Cambodian standards, but the upfront costs are high. This loan will enable Phun to continue his work and earn a good profit without sacrificing the family's standard of living.

loans.use: Buy fishing nets

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Ever since he was young, Juan had the courage to push forward and pave his way through life. Now that he has his own family, he wishes to offer them the best and grant them financial stability. For this reason, he gets up very early every morning, and makes his way to his shop where he cheerfully works as a carpenter. One morning, Juan left his home determined to distribute the shelves that he so eagerly prepared for a school in his community. He placed them in a delivery truck and decided to ride along with them so that he could show his appreciation to the principal for having appointed him to the project. While on the road, they encountered a huge bog that caused an accident and destroyed a month’s worth of Juan’s work. The monetary loss was considerable since he was forced to remake the shelves. From that moment on, Juan has struggled to reach the stability he and his family enjoyed before this unfortunate loss. Now he would like to purchase a machine to expedite his wood work so that he can restore his family’s financial status in a short period of time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde joven Juan, tuvo los ánimos progresar a fin de abrirse camino por la vida y ahora que tiene una familia desea ofrecerles lo mejor y otorgarles estabilidad económica.Por esa razón todas las mañanas sale muy temprano rumbo a su taller de carpintería en el que se desempeña con mucha alegría. Una mañana de tantas en la vida de Juan se marchó de casa dispuesto a repartir los módulos que había preparado con mucho ahínco para un colegio de su comunidad, ingreso cada uno de ellos en el camión que los conduciría hasta su morada final y decidió marchar con ellos para agradecer y manifestar al director su agradecimiento por haberle encargado este proyecto. Mientras transitaban salió a su encuentro un inmenso lodazal que ocasionó un terrible accidente que destruyó el trabajo de un mes de Juan. La pérdida monetaria fue considerable ya que tuvo que volver a fabricar los módulos.Desde ese momento Juan esta luchando por alcanzar la estabilidad que tenían antes de la penosa pérdida. Hoy desea adquirir una máquina para agilizar la fabricación de artículos en madera a fin de alcanzar la recuperación económica de su familia dentro de poco tiempo.

loans.use: Purchase of wood working machinery

loans.name: Lucrecia Teresa

texts.es:
Mrs. Lucrecia Tereza L. started her own business (in which she sells home made soft drinks) a year ago in the city of Chinandega in order to be able to support her two children.

The business is located in the market of Santa Ana, where she has been able to get several customers thanks to the quality of the soft drinks that she makes. Since last year, Ceprodel has helped Mrs. Lucrecia with 6 loans that she has used to buy fruits to make the soft drinks that she sells in order to be able to provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva Volunteer.

Desde hace un año, en la ciudad de Chinandega, para poder mantener a sus 2 hijos la señora Lucrecia Tereza L. inicia un negocio de venta de deliciosos refrescos elaborados por ella misma.

El negocio se ubica en el interior del mercado Santa Ana donde ha logrado obtener varios clientes por la calidad de los refrescos que ella misma elabora. No podemos omitir que desde hace un año, Ceprodel ha apoyado a la señora Lucrecia con la realización de 6 créditos los cuales los ha utilizado para invertir en la compra de las frutas para elaborar los refrescos y de esta manera llevar el sustento a su humilde hogar de habitación.

loans.use: To buy fruits to make soft drinks

loans.name: Felícita

texts.es:
Felicita is constantly searching for ways to improve her household economy, and facing a difficult situation and a lack of employment, she decided to make her own and used one of her greatest strengths to carry on and gradually overcome that problem. She is very able in the kitchen, and 9 years ago she began to dedicate herself to preparing pancakes and coffee to sell on the corner near her house. Later as her business grew, she decided to offer other dishes as well. Now that her business has grown even more with the sale of fried foods and kebabs, she is very excited, her sales are growing, and she dreams of one day having a restaurant.

Felicita doesn't just dedicate herself to this work, but also to working some small plots of land where she has planted potatoes, which has helped to sustain her family. Her husband works in shipping, and together with Felicita, they support their home's finances every day because they want to make sure their three children have access to a good education and want for nothing, as much as possible. This admirable mother will go on working, but for this kind of opportunity she needs a loan which she will invest in purchasing a grill and some fertilizer for growing potatoes. Support Felicita to go on building a promising future for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Felicita esta en una búsqueda constante de mejoras para la economía de su hogar, y ante la difícil situación y la escasez de un empleo decidió crear el suyo y utilizó una de sus mejores habilidades para continuar y superar gradualmente ese problema, ella es muy hábil en la cocina y empezó hace 9 años a dedicarse a preparar café con panqueques para venderlos en una esquina de su casa, luego como iba creciendo su negocio decidió ofrecer además de esto también algunos platillos y ahora a implementado aún más este negocio con la venta de frituras y anticuchos por lo que está muy emocionada debido a que han ido incrementando sus ventas y desea a futuro tener un restaurante.

Felicita no sólo se dedica a estas labores sino que además tiene unos pequeños terrenos en los que ha sembrado papa y esto se ha convertido en un sustento más para los suyos, su esposo trabaja en el transporte y junto a Felicita cada día aporta en la economía de su casa, porque desean que sus tres hijos accedan a una buena educación y en lo posible no les falte nada. Esta admirable madre seguirá trabajando pero para esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo los cuales invertirá en la compra de una parrilla y para la compra de abono para su sembrío de papa. Apoya a Felicita a seguir construyendo un futuro prometedor para sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase a grill for her restaurant, and some manure for her farming

loans.name: Jaweed

texts.en: Jaweed, who is married, lives in District 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. Jaweed is a highly experienced tailor, specializing in sewing wedding clothes. His growing popularity as a tailor requires him to expand and improve his business, therefore, Jaweed is requesting a loan to buy new machines in order to complete his stock. By improving his business, he will also be able to better support his family.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr:
Ismaila S. is married and the father of five children, who all go to school. His principal business is poultry farming. He buys chicks that he raises to sell at market. He has 15 years of experience in this domaine.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Ismaila S. est marié et il est père de 5 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Son activité principale est l’aviculture .Il achète des poussins qu’il élève pour le revendre sur le marché.Il a une expérience de 15 ans dans ce domaine.

loans.use: To buy and raise chicks

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: B. Dilorom is 40 years old. She is married with three children. Dilorom is a market vendor. She sells kids clothing at the local market. The elder daughter helps her mother in her business. For seven years, Dilorom built her clientele. Now the business is successful and generates a stable income for the family.  Dilorom would like to purchase kids clothing for the summer season. She requests 200 $ US Dollars for the term of 3 months. Dilorom thanks everyone supporting her and promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: To purchase kids clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya F. is married with a one-year-old son. She lives in Korolyovo and sells bikes and spare parts in one of the local markets. She has been in this trade for 3 years. Currently, Nataliya has about $2000 in inventory. Her income is about $250-300 a month.  

Nataliya has passed many milestones on her road to success. She has learned to adapt with each
wave of change in the market world. Today she is a stable and confident entrepreneur with many bright ideas and plans for the future. One of her current plans is to increase her turnover capital with the help of a 1500 Grivna loan. 
 
(Note: this is a short term “express” loan that will be paid back in one month.)

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria where she sells weavons (hair extensions) and provisions. Rose O. learned this business for 6 months and has been in this business since 2007. She needs the loan amount of US$ 875 to buy more weavons and provisions for sale. She  says a big thank you to Kiva lenders. She is grateful to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more weavons and provisions for sale

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en: Sevil is the mother of 3 children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. She settled in the Fizuli region, in a Garabulag village. Sevil was born in 1971. You can see in the picture Sevil's husband. This family has been in this business for 6 years. Now they need a loan of $875 to buy a calf to improve their business.

loans.use: To buy a calf

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
La Sra. Maximina C. de 35 años, es separada, tiene una hija que esta cursando sus estudios primarios.

Doña Maximina C. es propietaria de una ferretería, aproximadamente desde el 2.002; ella tuvo que salir fuera del país en busca de trabajo, fue a nuestro vecino país, la Argentina allí estuvo mucho tiempo trabajando, para luego ahorrar hasta que llego el momento que decidió regresar a nuestro país e invertir en el rubro de ferretería, esta pequeña empresa que ahora pretende ampliar con este crédito, comprando más mercaderías como: artículos eléctricos, pinturas y otros.

Ella sueña que la hija tenga una vida mas satisfactoria, un desarrollo personal y una educación que le ayude a sobresalir siendo una buena profesional.
texts.en:
Maximina C. is 35 years old, separated, and has a daughter who is in primary school.

Maximina C. owns a hardware store, which she has had since about 2002. She had to leave the country for a while to work, traveling to neighboring Argentina where she was employed for quite some time. During this time, she saved money until she decided it was time to return to her country and invest in the hardware trade. With this loan, she can plan to expand her business and purchase items such as electrical products, paints, and others.

She dreams that her daughter will have a more satisfactory life, more personal development, and an education that helps her to succeed as a professional.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as electrical products, paints, and others.

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en: Mr. Phoeun P. was born in 1965 and lives in Kvet village in Kampong Cham Province. He is married with two children who attend the local school. Mr. Phoeun P. owns a plot of land and cultivates rice to earn his living. His wife, Mrs. Horn Oeun, is a pig breeder who has 12 animals. Her pigs are growing bigger and she does not have enough money to feed them. Mr. Phoeun P. would like a loan of $275 to buy pig feed. He hopes this loan will increase the family's standard of living. They have two father of two children who attend the local school. His wife appears with him in the photo.

loans.use: To buy pig feed.

loans.name: William Genaro

texts.es:
El señor William Genaro C. es originario del municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León y se dedica a su actividad de pintado profesional realizando esta actividad ambulantemente donde le soliciten el servicio. El señor William es experto en pintar casas, muebles entre otros y este ha sido sus único sustento desde muy joven.

Hoy en dia a la edad de 45 años continua destacándose como un buen pintor en su municipio y para llevar a cabo esta actividad hace uso de los créditos brindados por Ceprodel el cual los ha invertido directamente en la compra de las pinturas. Una vez más espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta forma continuar con el mantenimiento de su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
William Genaro C. comes from the municipality of Telica in the city of León and works as a professional travelling painter, working where people request his service. William is an expert at painting houses and furniture among others, and this has been his only support since he was very young. Today at 45 years old he continues to stand out as a good painter in his municipality, and to continue to do this activity he makes use of the loans granted by Ceprodel, of which he has invested directly in buying paints. Once more he hopes that a loan will be bestowed and in this way he can continue to maintain his familiy that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase Paint

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Née à Avétsèdomé en 1971, madame Akoélé T. s’est mariée à un mécanicien avec qui, elle a eu trois (03) enfants.
Gérante d’une boutique, elle vend un peu de tout. Sa localité qui est très reculée de la ville, fait que toutes les bonnes femmes viennent s’approvisionner chez elle. Sa capacité de financement très limitée fait qu’elle a souvent des ruptures de stock.
Pour y remédier, elle sollicite un appui financier qui servira à approvisionner sa boutique de tous les produits de premières nécessités afin d’avoir de nouveaux clients.
texts.en:
Born in Avétsèdomé in 1971, Ms. Akoélé T. married a mechanic with whom she has three children. The manager of a shop, she sells a little of everything. Her town, which is very remote, is the reason all the good and honest women go to see her for their supplies. Because of her very limited ability to obtain financing, she often has inventory shortages.

To remedy the situation, she is requesting financial support for acquiring supplies for her shop with all the basic provisions in order to have new customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with merchandise

loans.name: Mr. Yean Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan includes fourteen people who are located in Soupy village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mr. Yean C. is the village bank president and was selected by the members. He is a pig breeder. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it, so he decided to ask for a loan to buy two more piglets and use the rest of the portion of his loan to buy pig food to feed thE.. He hopes to increase his income and improve his living conditions with this loan.

His wife, Mrs. Seing Phal, is a basket maker in the local village. Mr. Yean C. is 53-years-old and the father of five children. One is a palm juice collector while two are farmers. The remaining children are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows thE. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy two more piglets and pig food to feed them.

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
A sus treinta y nueve años, Charito, ha trabajado en el encuadernado y empastado de libros toda su vida. A los dieciocho años empezó trabajando en imprenta. Sin embargo, recién empezó a trabajar independientemente: hace dos años. 

Trabaja al por mayor para empresas, que la proveen con todo el material que necesita para la tarea, y ella hace el empastado, alzado y gomado de los libros. Solo necesita invertir en unas esponjas, trapos y rodillos, así que cuando empezó a recibir préstamos de EDAPROSPO pudo usarlos para cubrir gastos grandes de su casa, alcanzando reembolsar los préstamos con las ganancias de su trabajo.

Todo su trabajo es manual, así que normalmente trabaja sola, cuando recibe pedidos grandes necesita requiere la ayuda de dos o más personas.

Charito es separada, pero su esposo ayuda con los gastos de sus dos hijos menores, así que su deseo por el futuro solo es de seguir en su trabajo.
texts.en:
At 22, Charito has been working in the bookbinding business her whole life. She started working at a printing works when she was 18. However, she started working independently only two years ago.

She binds books in bulk for companies, which provide her with all the materials she needs for the task. She just needs to invest in sponges, cloths and rollers, so when she started receiving loans from EDAPROSPO, she was able to use them to cover the household expenses, managing to repay the loans with the profits earned from her job.

All her work is done manually, so she normally works alone. However, when she receives big orders, she sometimes needs help from two or more people.

Charito is separated, but her husband helps her support their two young children. Her wish for the future is to keep her job.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: New work tools

loans.name: Dienalyn

texts.en:
“Being diligent towards work is a key to success”, says Dienalyn, a hog raiser in Sto. Domingo, Luna, Isabela.  She is 33 years old and married to Jackson, a welder.  The couple is blessed with two children: Chrisjohn - 6 years old, elementary student and Stefanie - 4 years old. The family is living a very simple life in their village.  

She wanted to help her husband in meeting the needs of their family.  She then started to plant vegetable seeds in their small farm and sold the products afterward. Her income from this business is just enough to support the immediate needs of their family.  

At present, she is maintaining her hog raising business and for it to grow, she would like to request a loan of PHP 5,000 that she can use for business expansion.  Aside from raising hogs and selling vegetables, Dienalyn also plans to venture in fish ball vending for extra income.  She wants to earn more income for the education of her children in the future.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Sabali (Tolérance) Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Sabali (composé de 5 femmes mariées et d’une veuve) ont une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent, la plupart dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies à Kamalen Sirakoro un des villages de la commune de Sikasso  3ème région administrative  de la république du Mali. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de poissons fumés, du charbon de bois, d’arachides, de pomme de terre, tissus, chaussures, de soumbala et enfin des articles de boutique.  
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et sont à leur huitième  prêt de groupe. Tous les prêts précédents se sont bien  dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter 65 kg de poissons fumés, 4 paquets d’articles de boutique, 600 kg de pomme de terre,  200 kg d’arachide, 30 sacs de 100 kg de charbon de bois,10 paniers de soumbala et 5 douzaines de paire de chaussures en plastique,  6 pièces de pagnes wax  real.
 Elles s’approvisionnent aux marchés (Médine et au grand marché) de Sikasso ville et  dans les  localités avoisinantes. 
Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Kamalen Sirakoro et dans les villages avoisinants à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the group Sabali are composed of five married women and one widow who average 32 years of age and 3 children each. They live for the most part in traditional extended families in Kamalen Sirakoro, a village of the Sikasso community (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The women do a variety of work, including selling smoked fish, charcoal, peanuts, potatoes, cloth, shoes, soumbala (a condiment made from fermented pounded seeds or beans), and finally boutique items.

The women are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso to satisfy the needs of their customers and are on their eighth group loan. All the preceding loans were settled. With this new loan, they intend to buy: 65 kg of smoked fish, four packets of boutique items, 600 kg of potatoes, 200 kg of peanuts, thirty 100-kg sacks of charcoal, ten baskets of soumbala, five dozen pairs of plastic shoes, and six bolts of Wax Real pagnes (colorful West African cloth).

Supplies are gotten at the marketplaces (in Médine and at the grand market) of Sikasso City and in neighboring towns. The goods are sold mostly in cash transactions at the Kamalen Sirakoro market and in neighboring villages. The customers are composed of men and women.

The group members each envision realizing an average monthly profit of 17,000 francs CFA. A portion of the profits will be for meeting family needs and the other portion will be invested in business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various good

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 27-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Mhammad has owned a bakery and has been working as a taxi driver since 2001. Mhammad does “mankoucheh”. A mankoucheh looks like a folded pizza; most common toppings are zaatar (thyme), jebneh (cheese) and lahm bi ajin (minced meat). You can eat it anytime of the day, but somehow it tastes better in the morning. He requested a loan of 1500 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials for his bakery and do some maintenance work on his car. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loan helped him improve both of his businesses. His clients for his bakery are mainly students and for the taxi, his clients can be anybody. When he first started, he didn’t have the startup capitA.. Mhammad decided on doing his work because he wants to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on improving his businesses.

loans.use: To purchase raw material for his bakery and do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлуба Усмонова 1976 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Матлуба имеет среднее образование. После распада Союза осталась без работы. Торгует на рынке 4 года продуктами питанием. От сюда приобретая товар ездит в Душанбе для продажи. С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2006 года. До сих пор  получает  кредит и во время погашает. Благодарна КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en:
Matluba U. was born in 1976, she is married and has 2 children. Matluba has a high school education. After the fall of the Soviet Union she was left without a job. She has been selling food products at the market for 4 years. She purchases her products here and travels to Dushanbe to sell them. She has been working with MicroInvest since 2006. Until now she has taken out credit and paid it back on time. She is grateful to KIVA for its support.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Grow business

loans.name: Power Of God Group

texts.en:
This is Kerelie B. and Fatmata T.. They are entrepreneurs who sell food in the Magburaka town market. They named their group Power of God. They have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have made a big impact on the lives of these entrepreneurs. With the proceeds they earned as the result of previous loans, they were able to run their homes. 

Kerelie B. (left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Sanda village, which is about 45 miles from Magburaka town. She is age 55, approximately. She is married with eight children. All of her children are now adults except for two who are still in school. Kerelie has been a businesswoman since her childhood days. She sells market food. She will use this loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest in her food business

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
"When my husband and I decided to have a business, we faced a lot of challenges. There are times that we will have low sales. But we learned so many things from it. Now, we know how to deal with the situation. Everything that happened is charged to experience," says Anecita C., the 32-year-old mother of one child.

She is asking a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchased stocks of merchandise to sell. She thinks that her loan will help add more display that could attract customers.

Through CEVI she was able to sustain her store and manage it well. CEVI gives her not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise to sell

loans.name: Farhod

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Фарход Отабобоев  занимается животноводством и переработкой молока. Проживает он в Ганчинском районе вместе со своей семьей. Фарход женат и  у него 2 детей. Жена Фархода Шукринисо помогает ему в откорме скота.
     Получив кредит в первый раз Фарход смог получить хорошую прибыль и увеличить количество своего скота.
Благодаря результатам программы кредитования  нашей организации он подал вторично заявку на получения кредита для откорма скота.
texts.en:
Farhod O. is involved in animal husbandry and milk processing. He lives in the Gonjy district with his family. Farhod is married and has 2 children. His wife, Shukriniso, helps him with livestock feeding. Having obtained his first loan, Farhod was able to make a good profit and increase the quantity of his livestock. Thanks to the results of our organization’s lending program, he requested his second loan for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Ciriaca

texts.en:
Ciriaca M. is a 71-year-old woman, who is determined and optimistic to get out from poverty. She is married to Francisco who is a pensioner and they are residing at Cardona, Rizal province in the Philippines.

She joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines in 2008. Her previous loan was used as additional capital for their businesses: hog fattening and hog slaughtering. Now on her second loan, she is requesting the amount of 10,000 pesos as additional capital for hog slaughtering. This business is running well with the help of her child. They slaughter pigs and sell the pork to their neighbors within their village.

She is hopeful that with the help of ASHI, she can save more for their future since they are already old, and that her child can continue her business.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for raising and pigs for slaughtering.

loans.name: Anacleta

texts.en:
Anacleta is 47-year-old woman married to Ethlebert, who is part of their local Barabgay council, and they have four teen-aged children. They live in Pandan, a beautiful coastal town in the north of Antique province. When she started her business five years ago, she had only meager capital to buy and sell rice and run a small sari sari (general) store. With every loan, she is able to expand just a little bit more. With this loan of 15,000 Pesos, she is looking to expand her business into hog fattening as well as buying supplies for her other businesses.

Anacleta's hope is to be able to save enough to help all of her children finish school. She believes she has it in her to be a successful business woman and is excited about this loan taking her one step closer to her dream. Written by Sloane Berrent, Kiva Fellow

loans.use: Hog fattening, food vending, sari sari (general store), school supplies

loans.name: Mien's Group
loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions very close to her house. She hopes for the loan amount of 120,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola is 44 years old. She is single and has two children. Shola sells polyethylene bags of various colors and sizes. The demand for her bags is high and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is hoping for a loan of N170,000 to purchase more bags to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more polyethylene bags to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena B. is from the village of Sepac. She is 34 years old. Rowena is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rowena owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Rowena joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rowena has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Rowena is requesting a new loan of 14900 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Rowena from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Rice farming and duck raising are the source of income of Helen B.. She started her business in 2001. Now she has a 2-hectare rice field and 497 heads of duck. Now, at 45 years old, she has 5 children. She was able to sustain her family through this kind of business.

She would like to request a loan of 15,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. in order for her to have additional capital to buy ducks and farm supplies.

loans.use: Financing

loans.name: Loty

texts.en:
Loty O. is now 47 years old and married to Joey O., who is 48 years old. In the long years of their marriage they were given five children: Judy Ann, 27; Bill Joel, 25; Jackielou, 24; Joelito, 20, and Alexis Miel, 4 years old. Most of their children are currently studying, so more money is being spent on the expenses for their education. Loty and Joey have doubled their work in order to earn more income for them.

One good thing is that some of their children are now working, so they are contributing to the educational expenses of their siblings. Aside from the employment of their other children, their main source of income is through their fishing business. Loty's husband is a fisherman, and she is the one who personally manages the business. Loty helps her husband through the financial aspect of their business. The money that finances the business comes from Loty, which she gets from the Kiva field partner, Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI), since she become a member. She has always properly utilized every loan that she received. Generally, she used the loans to buy the needs of their business to make it more productive. She will do the same thing with this loan, to make sure that the business will grow. One dream that Loty and Joey share is to have a big fish pond in the sea that would provide them with income and enable them to live a better life.

loans.use: To buy things necessary for their fishing business

loans.name: Illumenada

texts.en:
Illumenada P. is from the village of Bobontugan, Jasaan Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Illumenada is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Illumenada owns a sari-sari (variety) retail store with video games, and sells a variety of products in the local community. Illumenada has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Illumenada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and give her the ability to engage in business. Illumenada is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Illumenada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Sanilyn

texts.en:
Sanilyn is a 36-year-old married woman from Agusan Del Sur. She has seven children with her husband Richard. Her oldest child is now 17.

Sanilyn is a rice farmer. She spends most of her time taking care of the farm. She wants to ensure its good condition. The farm is her only source of income, so she works hard to achieve an abundant harvest.

She joined CEVI, a Kiva field partner, to use its financial services, which is what Sanilyn really needs. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP. This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She will also use part of it to pay the laborers who helped at her farm.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay laborers

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is thirty years old. She is divorced and has given birth to one child who is in school. She lives with her child in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coastal area in the western region of Ghana.

Fishing business is the major occupation of the people. Leticia is a trader. She trades in ready-made clothes for both men and women. She sells her wares near and far. She buys from Accra. Leticia has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to expand it.

loans.use: To buy ready-made clothes

loans.name: Simbiat

texts.en: Simbiat is 45 years old and married with five children. Her husband is a trader who is into sales of foodstuffs. Simbiat sells kerosene and has been in this line of business for a long time. She has been a good client of the Kiva field partner, LAPO, for over 2 years. She is requesting a loan of 170,000 NGN. With the loan, she plans to expand her kerosene business, which is now booming. She hopes to increase her earnings over time and to be able to provide better for her children's education. She says thank you to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell.

loans.name: Savanna

texts.en: Savanna is 25 years old; she is married and has given birth to two children. One of her children is in school. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed popularly as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread or what we called 'Kose'. 'Kose' is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge. With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk etc.

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en:
Thaer is a 24-year-old young man who studied medical laboratory science and started his own medical lab a year ago. His lab is the only one of its kind in Rummaneh village in Jineen District; therefore almost all the citizens of his village are the lab’s customers. Thaer appears in the photo at his laboratory.

After one year of being in business Thaer decided to buy a needed device to use in his laboratory and that's what he is going to use the loan from FATEN for.

Thaer is an ambitious young man who runs a small chicken farm besides the laboratory. He is also thinking of renewing the loan when the current one ends to improve his laboratory so as to serve a larger number of customers.

loans.use: To buy a device for his laboratory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand her inventory

loans.name: Renovacion 2-5 Group

texts.en:
Sujeiri, 29, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Renovación (Renewal), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Sujeiri and her husband have one child and live in a simple home in Samana, a beautiful and sparsely populated peninsula in the northeastern part of the Dominican Republic. Life in rural areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate access to healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Sujeiri runs a successful business running a small eatery. With this loan, Sujeiri plans to purchase more food including rice, beans, and sugar.
 
This is Sujeiri’s sixth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve life for her family. With her profits, Sujeiri hopes to purchase equipment so that she can also start baking cakes. She will also use her profits to purchase school supplies for her daughter, including a backpack, notebooks, and pencils. Sujeiri is currently studying as well, and her loans have provided her business with the profits that will get her through school. In the future, Sujeiri hopes to build a house of her own that she can pass along to her family.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Sujeiri and the Renovación group!

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, and sugar for meal preparation

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo S. is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries at home, earning approximately USD 5 per day in revenue. She has been with the business since 2008. Her husband operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of USD 3.3 per day. Their standard of living has been improved since they have had these businesses, so they want to have a loan to expand their businesses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 200 to purchase more groceries to stock her store. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.es: Aurelio tiene 55 años, es un padre de familia muy responsable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nery de 53 años y sus 6 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Los campos de sembrado que con tanto esfuerzo a conseguido Aurelio, son el principal sustento que tiene su familia, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de buena calidad, le ayuda a vender sus productos a buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es cuidar sus sembríos de plagas que pueden afectar la cosecha. Es así que lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa, por ser muy pesados y los fardos de gladiolos que son muy delicados de transportar, resultándole muy agotador el trabajo. En el futuro, espera comprarse un carro, para que pueda realizar más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Este es su noveno préstamo con MFP, sabe que el crédito que recibirá, le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. Además de ser socio de su grupo comunal, le gusta mucho poner orden en las reuniones. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono e insecticidas para cuidar sus siembras y lograr que sean más productivos.
texts.en:
Aurelio, 55, is a very responsible, hard-working father. He lives in his own home with his wife, Nery, 53, and his 6 beloved children, for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Aurelio’s farmlands, which he has acquired through much effort and sacrifice, are the family’s main source of support. His products are highly sought-after by wholesalers in Tarma because he’s famous for producing high quality crops. This good reputation commands good prices. What he likes best about his work is watching over his plantings so that pests will not affect his crop yields. He has been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part having to transport the sacks of potato, which are very heavy, and the bundles of gladioli, which are very fragile; thus his work is exhausting. In the future, he wants to buy a car so that he can move his products more easily. This is his 9th loan with MFP. He realizes that the loan he will receive will be very beneficial for his work. Besides being a member of his communal group, he enjoys keeping order at the meetings. He will use the 3000 new soles requested to buy manure and insecticide to care for his crops so that they will be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides for his potato and gladioli crops.

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en:
Bayrjargal is a widow with two children. She lives with her 21-year-old son and 22-year-old daughter in Zavhan province, one of Mongolia's western provinces. Both of her children are university students, and during their summer holidays they come to their mother and help with her business. Bayarjargal operates a vegetable trading business in her town. She has been operating her business for 17 years and has steadily expanded her business.  

Bayarjargal harvests seven tons of vegetables from her own plot of land each year. She has been planning to purchase more land to grow vegetables as well. She is a very hardworking businesswoman. Besides her business, she manufactures Buriad-style boots in order to earn extra income for her family. With her business profit, she has been paying for her two children's university tuition fees and providing money for her family expenses. Bayarjargal is a great mother who has been working hard to provide a better life and education for her two children. She is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (~  1075 USD) loan to purchase irrigation equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.en:
Isidro P. is from the village of Yeban Norte. He is 46 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Isidro owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. Isidro has been involved in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2008, Isidro joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidro has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI, which was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Isidro is requesting a new loan, his 5th, of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Semfrosa

texts.en: Semfrosa U. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Semfrosa is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Semfrosa operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling slippers and bags. Semfrosa has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2010, Semfrosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Semfrosa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Semfrosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang S., 53, is married and lives with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for its palm products. Her husband appears in the photograph.

S. teaches at a local school in the town for an income of USD 2.30 per day. Her husband is a police officer, earning an income of about USD 4 per day.

S. is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for one of her children to use for commuting to work in the town.

In the future, S. would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for one of her children to use for commuting

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina is married with six children and all her children go to school. She owns a retail shop in Busega selling all types of merchandise. She also takes care of her late sister's children. She has been in this business for ten years. She wants to use this loan to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap, and one-litre cans of cooking oil.

Safina sells to all categories of people but by retail only. She rents her business premises at UGX 30,000 per month. She works seven days a week. Her business challenges include thieves and transportation of merchandise from Kikuubo in Kampala city to her shop in Busega. Safina shops for merchandise once a week. She is aspiring to see her business grow large and start selling by wholesale only. She joined MCDT because they are trustworthy. Safina resides and owns a four-room house and the family has access to electricity but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and one-litre cans of cooking oil.

loans.name: Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Suraiya is the wife of N. A.. They have three sons and live in a two room brick house in a city called Borewala in Pakistan.

N. and his eldest son sell blankets to various places in the community. They also sell in different cities such as Islamabad and Lahore, where people buy blankets in advance of the winter season. N. has been doing this business for over twenty years, but his son joined him in his business five years ago.  

Suraiya is also a very hard working lady. She stays at home and manages the household chores, but she also operates her own sewing business. Her clientele base is her neighbors. She receives orders from them and earns a good income from the business. 

Suraiya has taken three loans from ASASAH and successfully repaid them. She has maintained good credit behavior. Now she is applying for the fourth loan so she can expand the business of her husband. 

With the loan he will buy more blankets and increase his sales.

loans.use: To purchase blankets for reselling.

loans.name: Rolieta

texts.en:
Rolieta B., from the city of Dapitan, is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rolieta is starting a business venture raising pigs for sale.

In 2007, Rolieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC, she is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Awate

texts.en:
Awate J. is currently in the business of selling foodstuffs in a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell.  

Awate is 36 years old and married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house for rent.

loans.use: Stock more foodstuffs in the restaurant to sell

loans.name: Merashiela

texts.en:
Merashiela M. is from the city of Dipolog City. She is 28 years old. Myrna is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merashiela owns and operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing children's school bag manufacturing services to local community members. Mershiela has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately PHP6,000 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Merashiela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merashiela has successfully repaid a previous loan of PHP8,000 from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Merashiela is requesting a new loan of PHP8,000, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Merashiela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Golondrinas.
Marina es casada y tiene 4 hijos D. los cuales 3 estudian, Marina tiene un restaurante en su casa en donD. además venD. bebidas, actividad con la ayuda D. su esposo e hijos. Además Marina junto a sus hijos tienen una carpintería en su casa.
Marina solicita un crédito D. 2000 soles para la compra D. gallina, gaseosas y cerveza.
Los sueños D. Marina son ampliar su restaurante y ampliar un carro para pasear.
texts.en:
Marina belongs to the "Las Golondrinas" ["The Swallows"] communal bank. Marina is married and has four children, of which three are in school. Marina has a restaurant in her house, where she also sells drinks. Her husband and children help her with the business. Together with her children, Marina also has a carpentry shop in their house. Marina is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy chickens, soft drinks, and beer. Marina's dream is to expand her restaurant and to add a cart for selling on foot.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy chickens, soft drinks, and beer

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
El señor Domingo V. Peña es de 53 años de edad es casado más de 23 años con la señora Francisca Claros Hinojosa, tiene 2 hijos dependientes  que estudian en nivel secundario, se dedican  a la producción agrícola de papa, haba, oca, tiene 5 cabezas de ganado vacuno de engorde y 3 lecheras lo cual usan en faenas agrícolas y lo demás como productoras de lecheras, mayormente cuida la esposa aparte de ayudar al esposo en la agricultura, el señor Domingo y su esposa se apersonaron a nuestras oficinas a solicitar un préstamo para comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza) y avena (forraje) para su ganado vacuno, la familia viven en Colomi comunidad Alto Viru Viru hacia el norte. 

EL Señor Domingo V. Peña nos cuenta que más antes trabajaba como funcionario público pero el sueldo era bajo que no le alcanzaba para mantener a su familia, de tal modo se retiro y empezó a dedicarse a la producción agrícola y pecuaria sembrar en mas superficies como antes tener ingresos mayores para mantener a su familia y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios hasta que logren una vida profesional.
texts.en:
Domingo V. Peña is 53 years old. He has been married more than 23 years to Francisca Claros Hinojosa, and he has 2 dependent children who are currently in secondary school. His work is agricultural production; he grows potatoes, beans, and yams, and he has 5 head of cattle he is fattening up and 3 milk cows; he uses some of his cattle in agricultural tasks and the rest as milk producers. His wife takes care of them most of the time, in addition to helping her husband in the fields. Domingo and his wife came in person to request a loan to buy organic fertilizer (chicken manure) and oats (forage) for their cattle. The family lives in Colomi, in the northern part of the community of Alto Viru Viru.

Domingo V. Peña tells us that some time ago, he used to work as a public employee, but the salary was low and was not sufficient to support his family. For this reason, he retired and began to work in farming and ranching, expanding the area he cultivates in order to earn more income to maintain his family and help his children with their studies, so that they can pursue professional careers.

loans.use: Buying organic fertilizer to improve his agricultural production

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth C. is from the village of Barangay Vista Alegre, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 49 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business selling fish in the market. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2006, Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. AAbout ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Kiyomiddin

texts.ru: Ибрагимов Киёмиддин проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 29 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование среднее. Клиент недавно вернулся с России и имел 1000 долларов США сбережения. Приобрел торговую точку на рынке "Тиджорат" с намерениями открыть собственный бизнес. Сейчас он занимается торговлей спортивной одежды, обуви и других принадлежностей. Этим видом деятельности занимается 5 месяцев. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Kiyomiddin I. lives in the Yavan region. He is 29 years old. He is married and has one child. He has secondary education. He has recently returned from Russia and brought $1,000 US dollars in savings. He has acquired a vendor space on the Tidjorat market with the purpose of opening his own business. Right now he is selling sportswear, shoes and other goods. He has been in this business for five months. He is taking out the loan to increase sales.

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Sao

texts.en: Sao T., 44, is a widow with five children and lives in Takeo province. She sells clothes at the local market and is able to make about US$7 each day. Sao T. is asking for a loan of US$1200 to reinvest in her business by buying more clothes. (The old man who is sitting behind her is her neighbor.)

loans.use: To purchase clothes.

loans.name: Evanjelyn

texts.en:
Evanjelyn E. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 23 years old and single.  Evanjelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling clothing, shoes, and cosmetic products from AVON & NATASHA in the local community. Evanjelyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Evanjelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Evanjelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to buy and sell. Evanjelyn is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan provided to Evanjelyn by HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret Y. is 45-year-old woman and a mother of four. Her children are aged 22 (twins), 16, and 12 years old. She has been in the grocery business for the past ten years in Eldoret, Kenya. She was introduced to KADET by a member of the group and this is her sixth loan with KADET. 

Margaret is applying for 80,000 Kenyan shillings, which she plans to use to buy onions, potatoes, mangoes, and to boost her stock. This will enable her to live a good and comfortable life. She plans to add more stock to her grocery business and to see her children obtain better education.

loans.use: To buy onions, potatoes, and mangoes

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline M. is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Caroline has a retail shop business, which she has run for four years.
To help expand her business, Caroline has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sugar for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Caroline hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, Caroline hopes to own a charcoal business. She is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her new games.

loans.use: To purchase sugar for resale

loans.name: Magali Rosmery

texts.es:
Magali tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo dependiente. Reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Mórrope, una zona agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la comercialización de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños. Ella adquiere su mercadería en la ciudad de Chiclayo y la ofrece a sus clientes en calidad de pedido. Adicionalmente vende productos cosméticos por catálogo entre sus clientes: ella les toma el pedido y la empresa abastecedora se los envía cada fin de mes. Los ingresos que logra percibir de estas actividades los utiliza para sacar adelante a su menor hijo y ayudar a su familia a solventar sus gastos.

Magali desea adquirir ropa de la temporada de verano para poder ampliar su negocio y aumentar sus ventas percibiendo a la vez  mayores ganancias que le permitan seguir progresando y ayudando a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Magali is 29 years old, single and has one child dependent on her. She lives together with her family in the Mórrope district, a farming and commercial zone that belongs to the province Lambayeque and is found, at most, 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She sells clothing for women, men and children. She acquires her quality merchandise in the city of Chiclayo and offers it to her clients upon their request. Additionally, she sells cosmetic products through a catalogue amongst her clients. She takes their order and the supply company sends the products at the end of the month. She uses the income she makes through these activities to move her youngest son forward and to help cover her family's expenses. 

Magali wishes to acquire summer clothing in order to be able to expand her business and raise her sales, increasing her profits in order to allow her to continue progressing and helping her family move forward. In order to achieve this goal, she has confidently put her trust in asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1000 nuevo soles ($375 USD).

loans.use: To obtain summer clothing in order to be able to expand her business.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “CENTRAL PATAQUEHUAR”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Quiquijana, perteneciente a la provincia de Quispicanchis y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de verduras y también se dedica al servicio de Wawa Wasi (es como una cuna jardín donde se cuida bebes y niños),la socia tiene pequeños terrenos de cultivo donde siembra maíz, papa y verduras y luego los vende en los diferentes ferias que se realiza en el distrito de Quiquijana, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de verduras. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Here is a member of communal bank named "Central Pataquehuar". It is located in the district of Quiquijana, belonging to the province of Quispicanchis and in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Irma. She is 34 years old, single, and the mother of 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with the sale of produce and she also has a Wawa Wasi business (like a daycare where she takes care of babies and children). She has small plots of land where she cultivates corn, potatoes, and vegetables that she later sells at the various fairs that take place in the district of Quiquijana. She wants to expand her produce business. She requests a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her fields. 

She is happy to receive a loan and she is committed to making the payments of that loan.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Lemeria Ole

texts.en:
Lemeria Ole K. is 55 years old. He is married and the father of nine children who attend school. K. is a farmer who works on his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET LTD from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to buy farm supplies and prepare the land for planting. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to buy more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land so that he can plant wheat on a large scale. Despite his age, K. is hardworking, and, with the right resources at his disposal, he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and prepare land for planting

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.ru: Мирзоева Гулбахор жительница района Фархор. Ей 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж находится на заработках заграницей. Сама Гулбахор занимается шитьем. Она берет заказы на дому и шьет национальные платья. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для покупки новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Gulbahor M. lives in the Farkhor Region. She is 46 years old. Married, with four children. Her husband temporarily works abroad. Gulbahor works as a seamstress. She takes orders and sews traditional national dresses at home. She has a lot of experience in this area. She is taking out a loan in order to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: Purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a thirty-seven-year-old married man living in his own house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He buys and sells maize and has been in business for ten years.  The fluctuating price of maize is a challenge for him.  His dream is to own a store. Joseph needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Las Brillantes De La Q Group

texts.es:
La señora Natividad de 48 años tiene una Bodega donde vende abarrotes y útiles escolares, ella es presidenta de la Alcancía Comunal “Las Brillantes de la Q” cuyo nombre refleja cómo se sienten en la sociedad: brillantes, que resaltan de lo común y hace mención a la zona donde viven, la Manzana “Q”.
Hace seis meses, Natividad decidió emprender en este negocio para poder estar cerca de su niña de 10 años quien aún sigue en el colegio. Antes de esto vendía jugo en un puesto del mercado que ahora está alquilando para asegurarse otra fuente de ingreso.
Natividad es divorciada, su esposo se fue de la casa cuando gestaba de su última bebe, aún así ella no se rindió y por amor a sus niños trabajó duro para asegurarles el sustento, comprarse artefactos y mejorar poco a poco su casa que carecía de puerta principal en el momento de la separación y que con mucho esfuerzo logró acondicionarlo.
Ahora comparte los gastos del hogar con uno de sus hijos mayores quien también apoya en el abastecimiento del negocio. El siguiente gran paso que desea hacer es agrandar la Bodega y convertirla en un Minimarket e instalarle rejas de fierro.
texts.en:
Sra. Natividad is 48 years old and has a store where she sells groceries and school supplies. She is president of the Communal Bank “Las Brillantes de La Q” (The Brilliant Ones of the Q), which reflects how they feel about themselves as a group – brilliant. Their name also reflects what they have in common which is the name of the area where they live, Section “Q”.

Six months ago, Natividad decided to start a business so that she could be near her ten year old daughter while she is in school. She previously sold juices from a stand at the market, but now she is renting it out while she secures another source of income.

Natividad is divorced. Her husband left home while she was pregnant with her last child. However, she did not give up and out of love for her children, she worked hard to support them, buy appliances, and make gradual improvements that her home was lacking at the time of her separation. With great effort, she was able to complete these upgrades.

Now she shares the household expenses with one of her grown children, who also helps with stocking her business. The next major step is to expand her grocery store, convert it into a mini-market, and install iron security bars.

loans.use: To install iron security bars at a storefront.

loans.name: Ngin

texts.en: Ngin S. L. has spent her life cultivating crops. This is a skill she learned from her grandparent when she was young. She is now married and has six single children; two of them are employed in different jobs to order to earn a profit. Her husband frequently works in the farm fields alongside her. Growing crops is a year on year activity with which she has had great success. She is able to plant the crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. Ngin S. L. is seeking a loan to buy two cows to use in her farming business. The cows can also be used for breeding purposes and Ngin can raise their offspring.

loans.use: to buy two cows to support her farming business

loans.name: Dominga Antonieta

texts.es:
Doña Dominga Antonieta C. G., tiene 40 años de edad, tiene un hijo que no esta estudiando, estudio sus estudios primarios, tiene un hijo que no esta estudiando, se dedica al comercio y a la tejeduria, en la tejeduria lleva 10 años de experiencia, a sido este su trabajo desde que inció.

Solicita un préstamo a ASDIR para compra de hilo que les servirá para elaborar mas tejido de todo tipo, ya que elabora servilletas, fajas, cortes, etc. Espera en el futuro tener un negocio aun mas grande y con mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Doña Dominga Antonieta C. G. is 40 years old. She has one son who is not in school, he completed primary school. Doña Dominga weaves and sells the pieces she makes. She has ten years of experience weaving, this has been her job since she started weaving. 

She is asking for a loan from ASDIR to buy the thread that she uses to make all kinds of fabrics, for example napkins, belts, shorts, etc. Her hopes for the future are to have a bigger business with a larger income.

loans.use: to buy thread for weaving

loans.name: Cristalito Group

texts.es: Griselda Del Rosario, Adela Del Socorro y Alba Luz conforman el grupo solidario Cristalito. Son personas muy responsables y disfrutan de sus negocios, ya que han demostrado salir adelante con las diferentes situaciones que se les han presentado. Adela se dedica a la venta de comida, la mayoría de sus clientes llegan a disfrutar de los deliciosos platillos que ofrece como son gallo pinto, queso frito, maduro, tajaditas, tacos, repochetas, enchiladas entre otros. este credito es parala compra de tortillas, cremas, tomates, cebolla, repollo, aceite, frijoles, arroz, entre otros. Es por eso que se han unido para que cada una pueda obtener financiamientos para sus negocios.
texts.en:
Griselda Del Rosario, Adela Del Socorro and Alba Luz make up the Cristalito communal bank.  They are very responsible people who enjoy their businesses because they’ve demonstrated that they can move ahead from different situations that have presented themselves.

Adela sells food.  Most of her customers come by to enjoy delicious dishes like gallo pinto (rice and beans), fried cheese, plantain, fried plantain, tacos, repochetas (corn quesadillas with slaw on top), and enchiladas, among others.  

She will use this loan to buy tortillas, cream, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, oil, beans and rice, among others.  This is why they’ve come together so that each one can obtain financing for their businesses.

loans.use: to buy tortillas, cream, tomatoes, onions, cabbage, oil, beans and rice, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; La socia vive en el distrito de Huanchac; en la provincia de Cusco,  departamento del Cusco.

La  socia tiene 46 años de edad y La socia es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia  es comerciante minorista. La socia trabaja vendiendo escabeche en el mercado de San Pedro, la socia vende este riquísimo plato frio hecho a base de pollo cocido con cebollas, zanahorias, arvejas, yuca y en trozos grandes macerados en vinagre y aceite de oliva; este plato se puede comer a toda hora, la socia requiere el crédito en esta ocasión para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de este riquísimo plato. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de su escabeche.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The memberm 46, is a member of the “Renovación” (Renewal) communal bank.  She lives in Huanchac District in Cusco Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and three children.  She is a retailer.  She works selling “escabeche” in the San Pedro market.  She sells this delicious cold dish made from chicken pieces cooked with onions, carrots, peas and manioc soaked in vinegar and olive oil.  This dish can be consumed at any time.  She needs the loan on this occasion to invest in ingredients to prepare this delicious dish.  She requests the loan to buy escabeche making ingredients.

She values and is infinitely grateful for the granted loan which will allow her to improve her quality of life; she also commits to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make escabeche.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es una madre D. familia D. 54 años D. edad, ella vive en casa propia junto a su esposo, ellos tiene 3 hijos mayores D. edad que son independientes. Maura resiD. en el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz su comunidad es urbana la cual se encuentra en vías D. crecimiento cuenta con luz y agua propia.

Maura se dedica a la venta D. comida en el mercado Los Patos desD. hace aproximadamente 08 años, en este tiempo a adquirido experiencia en dicho negocio, cuenta con puesto propio, es así que D. esta manera que posee una  clientela fija y fidelizada a sus negocio.

Maura está solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa D. 3000 nuevos soles para que pueda realizar mejoras en la infraestructura D. su domicilio y en su local D. ventas, D. esta manera ofrecer un mejor ambiente para sus clientes.

Maura es una mujer muy carismática, que se esfuerza día a día para sacara su familia a delante, cuenta con buenas referencias por parte D. las personas que la conocen , la describen como una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en:
