Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Phạm Thị T. (10105050010) là 48 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. 2. M. Thị D. (10105050013) là 56 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng thịt. 3. Bùi Thị N. (10105050011) là 47 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 4. Lê Thị Hồng M. (10105050009) là 28 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. 5. Nguyễn Thị B. (10105050012) là 54 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5,014,000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Elena's Group

texts.en:
Elena O. is from the village of Lapinig, Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 46 years old. Elena is the leader of a 3-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Elena is married and has 5 school-aged children. Elena owns & operates a manufacturing business. The main source of income comes from manufacturing & selling bamboo products like "amakan" and sticks for barbecues to local businesses and community members. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elena joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elena is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elena from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Samei

texts.en:
Mrs. Samei K. is a villager who lives in Andoung Samretth village, Takeo province. She is 31 years old and is married with three children, two of whom are attending the public school while the youngest one is 3 years old.

Mrs. Samei K. and her husband, Mr. Arn Tuos, are farmers who own a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) field on which they cultivate rice and grow vegetables which has allowed them to support their family.

Mrs. Samei K. wants to take a loan of 1,500,000 Riel from AMK to buy a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for transportation

loans.name: Angela Adriana

texts.es: Ángela Adriana tiene 62 años, este no es el primer financiamiento que ha solicitado con Fundación pues por la responsabilidad del pago de sus cuotas ha mantenido su record. Esta emprendedora Señora tiene más 4 años de tener este negocio, por lo que ha luchado con muchas dificultades en su vida para salir adelante una de ellas fue tener un tramo propio en el mercado en donde ofrece sus productos, porque no tenía el capital suficiente para esto, con la ayuda de los financiamiento logro obtenerlo. Actualmente solicita este crédito para la compra de materia prima queso, mantequilla, maíz entre otras cosas. Su deseo es mejorar la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en:
Angela Adriana is 62 years old. This is not the first loan that she requested from Fundación and she has maintained a good credit record through the responsible payments of her installments. This enterprising woman has had her business for more than 4 years. In order to get ahead, she has conquered many difficulties in her life. One of those was the obtaining of her own space at the market where she offers her products, she did not have enough money to get one but was able to do so by getting the loans. She is currently asking for this loan to purchase raw materials such as cheese, butter, corn meal and others. Her wish is to improve the quality of her products.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marcedes

texts.en:
Marcedes B. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 26 years old. Marcedes is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Marcedes owns & operates a business harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Marcedes has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Marcedes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marcedes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from GDMPC. Marcedes is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marcedes from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for her business

loans.name: Wilmor Javier

texts.es: Wilmor Javier tiene 28 años, su actividad económica es una pulpería y ofrecer el servicio de billar. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y salir adelante. El tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, por lo que siempre le ha gustado ser un hombre responsable. Al inicio no tenía mucho conocimiento de este negocio, pero con el tiempo fue mejorando, además a sus clientes siempre les ha ofrecido un excelente servicio y les gusta conversar con Wilmor. El solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de materia prima necesaria. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Wilmor Javier, 28, has a grocery store and pool tables. He has been in this line of work for over 5 years. He has always enjoyed working and getting ahead in life. He has two children under his care and he has always liked being a responsible man. At the beginning, he didn’t know this business very well but he improved with time; besides, he always offers good customer service and they like chatting with Wilmor. He is asking for funding to buy needed stock items. His wish is to improve his dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory.

loans.name: Houch

texts.en:
Mr. Houch I., 24, and his wife, Mrs. Mom Eng, 25, live in a small village off of National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They were married in 2007 and have a young daughter. 

Houch has been a blacksmith for three years. His wife is a construction worker. He is asking for his first loan of $150 to fill up the land under his house.

loans.use: To fill up the land under his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing beans

loans.name: Rodora

texts.en: Rodora D.'s main source of income comes from making and selling snacks and delicacies in her community. She is 33 years old, married and has three school-aged children. They are from the village of Talakag, Bukidnon. Rodora has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Rodora joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rodora is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Tourk

texts.en:
Tourt S., 60, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, an area known for the most populated city in the country. She is a tailor and earns an income of USD 2 per day. 

S. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more fabrics for tailoring. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy fabrics for tailoring

loans.name: Kamuyu Group

texts.en:
Fatu K. (pictured left) is the leader of this group called “Kamuyu”. She was born in 1965 in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and the couple has four children – one in primary school and three in secondary school.

With the help of her palm-oil business, Fatu has been able to significantly contribute towards her family’s wellbeing. She has been selling palm-oil (the country’s most favorite cooking oil) for five years now.

Fatu and her group members have applied for a loan of SLL 500,000 each from SMT, a Kiva partner, for the first time. With the help of this loan, each of these borrowers will be able to expand her business, make more sales and make better profit.

Fatu will use her share of the loan to buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To buy gallons of palm-oil to add to her current stock

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.en:
Eugenio S. is from the village of San Roque, Enrile, Cagayan. He is 27 years old. Eugenio is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Eugenio owns & operates a business venture in the services sector providing transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motorcycle transport business. Eugenio is just starting this business.

In 2009, Eugenio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eugenio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Eugenio is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase tires and other accessories. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Eugenio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tires and other accessories

loans.name: Monica Atieno

texts.en:
Monica is a 45-year-old widow living in Sondu, an upcoming town next to Kisumu City along Lake Victoria. Monica’s husband died and she was left with the responsibility of taking care of four children; two are in high school while the other two are in primary school. 

Monica sells secondhand clothes (locally known as mitumba) at her clothes stall within Sondu. She has been in this business for the last eight years and is experiencing growth due to the high demand for this clothing in the area. This she confirms through her monthly income of KES 10,000 ($125). This is the fourth loan that Monica is getting from Kadet Ltd and she intends to buy more stock for sale and from the profits she anticipates to generate, Monica plans to open a wholesale shop.

Monica is determined to support her children in school and to see that they have a better standard of living. This determination makes her work hard and pay her loans successfully so that she can be considered for subsequent loans.

loans.use: To buy more used clothing for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan moved to the US from Ecuador five years ago. He knew he wanted to start a franchise business and found that the cleaning business was the most affordable. In 2007, he started his own cleaning business and has been running it with his wife.

With ACCION USA’s help, Juan was able to receive his first loan in 2009 to purchase cleaning equipment. Now, Juan is refinancing his loan in order to bring his business to a new level. He is looking to purchase equipment, sign new client contracts, and launch a multimedia marketing campaign and website.

Juan is optimistic that these strategies will help him gain more clients. He is looking to expand his business beyond his local community. The loan will also help him sign larger contracts, which will generate higher revenues for Juan’s business.

Being self-employed and generating income for his family have been Juan’s greatest successes. He has great pride in providing for his wife and two young daughters. Juan enjoys managing his own business and loves the flexibility of his work. 


About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild the economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and launch a multi-media marketing campaign

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Laïdou, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 31 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana coura,  région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage et font le commerce, de condiments alimentaires, de boissons non alcoolisées, de céréales, de tissus et de tubercules.
Ces femmes du groupe Laïdou sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire, après avoir correctement remboursés les quatre précédents.  
ADA D. qui est un membre du groupe Laïdou compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, six sacs de 100Kg de céréales.
Elle s’approvisionne en marchandises généralement dans les villages environnants et au marché de Fana. Elle effectue sa vente sur place et au marché de Fana aux forains venant de Ségou, Sikasso et de Bamako, au comptant, en gros et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 75.000FCFA qui sera utilisé dans les dépenses  quotidiennes de la famille et le reste sera réinvesti dans les affaires.
texts.en:
The women who belong to the Laïdou group are all married, average 31 years of age with three children each and live in traditional extended families in the town of Fana (in the Fana coura district) in the prefecture of the same name, which lies in the region of Koulikoro (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through relatives and neighbors and are active in the sale of condiments, non-alcoholic drinks, cereals, fabrics and tubers. The women in the Laïdou group are on their fifth group loan, having repaid the four previous loans in full. Ada D., a member of the Laïdou group, is planning on using her loan to buy six 100kg sacks of cereals. She gets her supplies generally in the surrounding villages and at the market in Fana. She sells her goods locally and at the market at Fana to fairground people coming from Ségou, Sikasso and Bamako, for cash, wholesale and on credit, to a customer base made up of men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 75,000FCFA, which will be used for everyday family expenses; the balance will be reinvested in the business. .

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereals

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité DEGGO (en langue national sénégalaise) signifie entente entre les membre en français. Il est crée depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de WANGO qui l'abrite. Il regroupe 07 femmes qui habitent le même quartier et toutes vendeuses au marché du quartier.

Madame Seynabou M., assise à l'extrême gauche sur la photo, élevant la main droite, est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée d'une cinquantaine d'année. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. 

Elle fait du commerce depuis son entrée dans le Banc Villageois. 

Avec son financement de 100.000 francs cfa elle va acheter des tissus en wax et basin qu'elle va revendre à crédit et/ou au comptant dans son quartier et au marché. 

Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux, tels que les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et une participation à la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DEGGO (in Senegal’s national language) signifies harmony between members in French. It was created after the inauguration of the WANGO Banc Villageois where it is based. It consists of 7 women who live in the same neighborhood and are merchants at the neighborhood market. Mrs. Seynabou M., seated at the extreme left in the photo raising her right hand, is the leader of the group. She is 50 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She has been in business since joining the Banc Villageois. With financing of 100,000 CFA, she is going to buy wax and basin (damask) fabric that she will sell in her neighborhood and at the market for cash or on credit. Her goal is to provide for her family’s needs, such as her children’s school fees and contributions to daily expenses.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wax and damask fabrics

loans.name: Aydalina Del Carmen

texts.es: La Sra. Aydalina del Carmen B. G. ella es trabajadora activa de la Alcaldía municipal San Rafael del Sur   ella  se desempeña  como conserje, tiene  dos año de trabajar para esta institución, es casada actualmente, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. Ha tenido  dos créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar materiales de construcción para mejorar su casa de habitación y este lo esta solicitando para cambio de techo de unos de los cuartos de su casa, los cuales los créditos con ceprodel le han beneficiado en gran manera ya que de esa manera ella ha  mejorado su condición de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Aydalina del Carmen B. G. is an active worker at the San Rafael del Sur town hall where she has been employed for the past two years as a councilor. She is currently married and has two school-age children.

She has had two loans through CEPRODEL and has used each one to purchase construction materials for housing improvements. She is requesting this loan to change the roof of some of the rooms of house. The CEPRODEL loans have benefited her greatly because she has improved her and her family’s living condition.

loans.use: To pay for cement, stone, gravel, and iron

loans.name: Suyarbek

texts.ru: Шамуратов Суярбек проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 41 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сам Суярбек высшего образования не имеет. Занимается растениеводством. При доме имеет большой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. В этой области имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. В этом году он хочет, посеет пшеницу.
texts.en: Suyarbek S. lives in the Shahrituz Region. 41 years of age. Married, with three children. His wife works at a cooperative farm. Suyarbek does not have a college degree. He is a farmer. He has a big land plot next to his house and grows vegetables. He has a lot of experience in this area. He is taking out a loan to purchase seed and mineral fertilizers. This year he would like to plant wheat.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Teresiah Waithira

texts.en:
Teresiah has practised farming in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  She is 37 years old, a single mother of one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend  and this will be her fourth loan.  She repaid for all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the cash to buy fertilizer and potato seedlings which she will plant after harvesting the maize in her farm.

Teresiah is very hard-working.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato seedlings to plant

loans.name: Altansuvd

texts.en:
Altansuvd B. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and infant baby in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband is handicapped and receives a monthly disability pension of 41,400 MNT. At first, she started helping her mother to make a variety of souvenirs and crafts using beads and pearls.

Since 2008, she has been operating her crafts business by herself in her home. Her husband also helps with her business. For the future, Altansuvd says, "My main business goal is to expand my business and establish a new production factory." She is a very hard working and talkative person and is requesting a 640,000 MNT loan to purchase a large amount of beads and pearls in order to make a variety of handicraft products.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of beads and pearls.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en: Annabelle P. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 27 years old. Annabelle is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Annabelle provides repair and repainting services for various vehicles like multi-purpose cabs, jeepneys and cars to local community members. Annabelle has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Annabelle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Annabelle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Annabelle is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the second loan taken out by Annabelle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab O. is a middle-aged woman who is a widow. Her 2 children live separately: her son is working in Russia, her daughter is married and has her own family.

Zainab increases her regular income by breeding cattle.  Currently, she has a cow with a heifer.  Several years ago her son helped her to start this business by putting up some amount of money.

In order to increase her cattle stock and enlarge the family budget, Zainab wants to purchase more cattle for keeping and fattening. For this purpose she needs to get a loan. Her future plans include building a bath-house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Thise Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. He started to work in the motorcycle repair field in 2007 and in parallel he began to work as a home painter in 2008 because he is the only income provider for the family in cooperation with his father and wants to increase the  family’s profit. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase various supplies to complete his work and be able to increase his efficiency and his sales.

loans.use: To purchase various supplies

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Matilde, de 31 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Nilson (30)  y sus tres pequeños hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida.Trabajando arduamente Matilde ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su café y plátanos los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de Pichanaki, ya que es en ese lugar  donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus campos, ya lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo tiene planeado adecuar sus tierras para plantar mucho más café, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias.Es el  segundo préstamo de Matilde con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, y en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida.Matilde tiene planeado invertir  los quinientos soles solicitados, en la compra de cantidad de  abono y fertilizantes, que necesita  para mejorar la calidad de sus tierras.
texts.en:
Matilde is 31 years old.  She is a very humble and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Nilson (30) and her three small children, for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through hard work, Matilde has managed to make progress with her crops.  Every morning she gets up very early to irrigate and care for her coffee and bananas which she will later sell in the city of Pichanaki since this is where she receives the best prices for her products.  What she most likes about her work is being able to enjoy the freedom of working in her fields.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be working her land.  Over time, she plans to get her land ready to plant a lot more coffee.  In this way, she hopes to improve her profits.

This is Matilde's second loan with MFP and she knows that this loan will help her in making progress and developing her business.  For this reason, she is prepared to make all her repayments on time.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and, for this reason, she is a very well-liked member.  Matilde plans to invest the 500 Peruvian soles she has requested in buying a quantity of manure and fertilizers that she needs to improve the quality of her land.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers to improve her crops

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar vive en la casa propia cuyo domicilio esta ubicado en la localidad de Pucarani. El señor se dedica a la crianza de ganado ubicada en el mismo domicilio. Es su principal fuente de ingreso para su manutención. El tiene tres hijos.
 
El préstamo lo destinara para la compra de una vaca lechera para mejorar sus ingresos por concepto de venta de leche a la Planta Industrializadora de leche PIL.
 
Es primer crédito con Impro y será canalizado a través de Kiva..
texts.en:
Edgar lives in his own house, located in the vicinity of Pucarani. He is dedicated to raising cows at the place of his residence. This is the principal source of income for the maintenance of Edgar and his 3 children.

The loan will be used to buy a milk cow to improve his income. Edgar sells milk to the Industrial Milk Plant, PIL. This is his first loan with Impro and it is being channeled through Kiva.

loans.use: TO BUY A MILK COW TO IMPROVE HIS INCOME FROM MILK SALES

loans.name: Ita

texts.en:
Ita K. is 34 years old. He is married to Nalamae K. and is the father of three children. He operates a Kiosk in a rental premise, which he has been doing for the last seven years.
  
He learned about KADET LTD from a member of a group within his locality who is registered with KADET. This will be his first loan and he plans to buy more stock of goods for the shop, e.g., rice, wheat flour, tea leaves, cooking fat, etc. 

With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest and educate his children. His hope and dream is to become a prominent businessman.

loans.use: To buy more stock of goods for the shop, such as rice, wheat flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Kyandago Development Group A, Kihihi

texts.en: N. Loy of Kyandago Development Group A is a 37-year-old determined, hardworking, and happily married mother of 5 children. She is a multi-business lady with a business of selling timber and wood from Bwindi, as well as being involved in agriculture and more specifically poultry. With the timber business, she has worked with her husband for 6 years, and she is grateful that the business has been moving smoothly because of the good market, especially from carpenters. She is able to make 280,000/= as monthly profits. Loy needs a loan to be able to buy more trees for her timber business.

loans.use: to buy more trees for selling timber.

loans.name: Twunganirane Dusabirana Group

texts.fr: Janvier Niyibizi est notre client depuis 2011, il est marié,il a 4 enfants entre 7 et 1 an, le lieu et pays de naissance est Bugesera – Rwanda, il est membre du groupe solidaire appelé Twunganirane Dusabirana. Il fait le commerce de détaille de récolte (haricot, sorgho, chèvres,…), et son prêt c’est pour acheter ses articles. Il veut augmenter son capital pour améliorer ses activités de son commerce. Son ambition et vision c’est d’élever ses enfants jusqu'à un niveau élevé. Et faire du bien pour sa famille.
texts.en: Janvier Niyibizi has been our client since 2011. He is married and has four children, ages 1 to 7. His place of birth is Bugesera, in Rwanda. He is a member of the solidarity group called Twunganirane Dusabirana.  His retail business involves farm products (beans, sorghum, goats...), and his loan is for buying his supplies. Janvier wants to increase his capital to improve his commerce. His ambition and vision is to raise his children well and to do some good for his family.

loans.use: Buying supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To replace the old tires of an auto-rickshaw with new tires
